Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in a Quiet, yet Convenient Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: BlahBlah10708
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. We had a triple room which was a king or near king size bed plus an alcove bed for our daughter. Nice decor, well maintained, a friendly, helpful though a bit formal staff. Our room was clean, comfortable and a nice size, which in Paris is a real plus. The bathroom was a nice size as well and we have stayed in some hotels in Paris with very tiny bathrooms. Also, nice lobby with breakfast and important to us, coffee anytime. Not inexpensive, but we thought it was a very good value and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaMiami
Reviews.Content: On my third trip to Paris, I stayed at the Hotel Muguet flat near the Rue de Cler. Nice location and great little neighborhood to stay in. Well furnished and immaculate. Clean throughout. The hotel staff were great help. When I experienced a problem with the hotel shuttle, they went above and beyond to solve the issues and make sure things went smoothly. Would definitely reccomend. The hotel itself is located on a nice side street convenient to many locations, including Invalides. Good breakfast room and a computer in the lobby, the hotel is intersperesed with touches of the modern and intique to keep its charm

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Peters365
Reviews.Content: It is located between two Metro stations, lots of bars and cafes and on a quiet street. The bed was uber comfortable. We found free parking right in front of the hotel (weekends only). Fresh fruit & grocery store nearby. The front desk staff was knowledeable but classic "French" friendly. The dbl room is really small. The toilet sat right up against the shower and the water took 10 minutes to heat up. Parquet floor only in the bathroom. Breakfast is expensive with very little variety-- all pork products and no fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Good, with limitations”
Reviews.Author: Bob A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Muguet in September of 2010. Our experience was good, with one exception. They advertise wi-fi in the rooms, which was not the case on the fourth floor, at least. Most frustrating were the lame excuses and blaming of my computer for the problems. Very frustrating! If internet access is important to you, don't stay here, unless you want to spend lots of time in the hotel lobby on their system!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: jdwksu
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Location was great, somewhat central location, easy to walk everywhere. The staff were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a couple in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jane K
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband and I have stayed at Hotel Muguet. It's a perfect quiet hotel that is lovely and secluded, get in the heart of the Rue Cler district. We have stayed at hotels on Rue Cler the were just too noisy and well -- almost youth hostel like -- for the same price as Hotel Muguet. They have a great little breakfast and the staff is always helpful. It's "our" Paris hotel now!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanchia46
Reviews.Content: The hotel muguet is located in a nice quiet area, but is 15 mins walk from the effiel tower. The metro stop is 2 mins walk away and it was pretty easy and quick to go to most places I was visitng. I had a great view of the effiel tower from my bedroom which was nice. Staff were friendly and helpful. Had free wifi in the rooms. The breakfast was good, but no hot items. The rooms were a little small, but clean and nicely decorated. I would stay here again, as it's so close to many of the Paris attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: My0la
Reviews.Content: My two teenaged daughters and I stayed here on December 17th to 21st. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend Hotel Muguet to other travellers who are looking for mid-ranged accomodation in a pretty, quiet, safe location that has convenient transport and is close to many sights. Our room was beautifully furnished and the bathroom was large for Paris (we had a triple room on the first floor). Breakfast was lovely and really enjoyable sitting in the pretty breakfast room. The staff were outstanding and were very patient with my terribly rusty French but were just as happy to converse in English too. I totally agree with another reviewer's comment about it feeling like coming home when you arrive back from a hectic day of sightseeing - Hotel Muguet IS just like coming home! Can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Touches and Service at Muguet”
Reviews.Author: Reedybear
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for three nights in July 2011. I stayed at the Hotel Muguet. They did something for me right away that showed a nice touch. I am a large man, and I had a very large suitcase with a carry-on with me. I had rented a small room because I wanted to save money, but when I came in they simply offered to upgrade my room to the largest they had for very little more money per night. I stayed one night in the small room, and then two nights in the largest room when it opened up. The difference in cost was minimal - they discounted the big room for me. The bathrooms in the small rooms are very small. They are uncomfortable for large people. In contrast, the room and bathroom in the big rooms are very large. In the big room, there was a large, deep bathtub that was great for soaking. After long walks in Paris, to soak in a hot tub up to the neck was a wonderful feature. Also, the rooms are very clean, and have a nice modern look. They feature AC and cable TV. There are some English channels and American CNN on the cable. You have a lot of privacy in the hotel - there doesn't seem to be much noise that travels through the hotel, and since the hotel is on a side street and not one of the main avenues, street noise is hardly there. Another great feature was the breakfast. It was a cross between a continental and a cooked breakfast. It was "Parisian." There were lots of French breads and pastries and croissants, and fruit, hot and cold cereals, breakfast meats, cheeses, and boiled eggs. But here is where the cooked part comes in - they will make an omlette to your order if you so choose. The furnishings are modern and not overly fancy at the hotel, but I like modern sometimes. Another nice touch - I speak English and not French, and though I picked some French up and tried speaking some French phrases, the staff was patient with my French and would help me with it if I had a quick question. The hotel is right downtown in the Eiffel Tower district. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower in 5 minutes, and Napoleon's tomb with the military museum and veterans hotel (Palace d' Invalades) are one block away. There are two metros one block away, which take you all over the city to the major attractions. There are tons of nice cafes right around the hotel, and a special treat is a small neighborhood called the Rue Cler that is right around the corner. It features a blocked off street with shops and cafes. There is a pharmacy and grocery store about 1/2 a block away. Overall B+.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely area”
Reviews.Author: mamaduckling
Reviews.Content: My young adult daughter and I stayed at Hotel Muguet for 4 nights in mid-December. The hotel provided a wonderful haven after our crazy days and evening trying to see everything in Paris. As other reviewers note, the location is hard to beat - Rue Cler is just steps away, as are 2 metro stops. Multiple cafes and restaurants make finding breakfast (we weren't terribly impressed with the hotel's breakfast, but in a pinch it's fine), dinner, or just a nightcap so simple. The rooms are very clean, the rain shower was wonderful, the hotel staff is friendly and helpful. We both thought the beds were comfortable. There is adequate space for clothes (this is not always the case in Paris!) and there is a hotel. The toiletries are not great, so if you have particular needs, I suggest bringing your own shampoo and conditioner. I love staying in the Rue Cler neighborhood; even though there are plenty of Americans represented, this is still a real Parisian neighborhood where you can sit with locals for that morning cappuccino. My daughter said it best, when she commented one evening that she was glad we were staying in the Rue Cler neighborhood and at Hotel Muguet "It feels like we're coming home."

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: futgal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in spring 2011 for over a week. The service was outstanding, the hotel was very clean, it's right near 2 Metro stops, and 2 blocks from quaint Rue Cler neighborhood and grocery stores, where we would buy baguettes and munchies before heading for the sights. If we were to return, we would not rent a double room again. The furniture is rather large and there is not enough room to move around in, especially if you are staying for a week or longer. We would rent either a deluxe (larger) double or a triple room. We drank their wonderful coffee each morning, but did not buy the breakfast buffet as it was a little expensive, although I'm sure the food was delicious in keeping with their high standards.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vratcliff
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here four or five times over the last seven years with other hotels and apartments in between. I don't think I'll bother trying any others from now on. My experiences in December 2011 and again in January 2012 have convinced me this is my address in Paris! Friendly staff , great location and squeaky clean and well appointed rooms cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Riddleson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with a friend which been highly recommend by family friends and was not disappointed. The staff are all very friendly and speak great English!Â  The room and bathroom are small but that is standard in most European hotels and they were not uncomfortable. In fact the bathroom was probably bigger than most European hotels I have stayed at.Â  Didn't realize there was a lift (keep walking past the stairs) which was my own fault but had to drag my heavy suitcase up four flights of stairs. Short walk to the Eiffel Tower and located just by the Metro which is very easy and quick to catch to all the other sight seeing spots! Breakfast was not included in the rates however is offered at an additional cost. We always went out for breakfast though as there are food markets just around the corner. Located in a nice area in Paris with many great options for dining, wine and coffee! Would definitely stay here again!Â

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: carol c
Reviews.Content: great hotel near the eiffel tower and rue cler area. Convenient to metro. My husband and I stayed in a room with a view of the Effiel tower. Comfortable bed, adequate space and very clean bathroom with Hot water (had a problem with this when I was in Italy). Recommend the following nearby restaurants, Le Petit Cler, Pasco, and La Terrasse du 7'eme all within walking distance. the staff can help you get into a restaurant if you don't have a reservation. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ljp26
Reviews.Content: I want to spend my money enjoying the city and the sights when I'm on vacation, not on a luxury hotel. Yet I want a clean place in a location where I feel safe, where I can walk to great restaurants, and without late night hoots and shrieks of night clubbers just below my window. Hotel Muguet meets all these requirements and more. Our room was reasonably sized - bigger than a comparable room in New York but smaller than in a suburban chain - with a window that actually opened fully. The room was very clean, the bathroom sparkled, and the staff was very professional and helpful. The sheets even smelled great. There are two metro stops within a couple hundred yards, the Eiffel Tower park about 3 blocks away, and there are multiple museums around the corner. Rue Cler is a block away, with cobblestone streets, markets, and great cafes. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: watfor
Reviews.Content: The Muguet is a nice, clean place to stay. My room size neither too big nor too small. It had sufficient closet space,a safe and a hair-dryer.The room and bathroom is cleaned everyday. The breakfast cost 12.5 Euros and is well-priced for the variety provided. It is about half a km from La-Tour Mauborg and is in a safe locality. There are plenty of restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Daniel Z
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Muguet was very friendly throughout our trip, and the location was excellent. We could see the tip of the Eiffel Tower from our room, telling us right when we arrived that we were in the heart of what we wanted to see for our first trip to Paris. Because it was a bit of a heat wave when we arrived, the Muguet's air conditioning was a welcome change compared to the outside temps! The hotel is around tons of patisseries and boulangers so unless you are very strapped or scared to order at a local shop, head down the street for breakfast. Your 11 Euros can go much farther! Overall this was an excellent hotel stay and a place we'd definitely consider revisiting in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for price”
Reviews.Author: Megan K
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the hotel for our first trip to Paris & Europe. Looked to reviews for hotel to stay at in Paris and the reviews are pretty accurate. The location is great, close to Metro, Invalides, & Effiel Tower. I would have given this a "Very Good" rating however: The rooms are a normal size for Paris, a "queen" bed (after 2 nights realized it was essentially 2 twin beds pushed together because we could feel the seams) and a large ottoman chair, desk and 2 amiors fit into the room. My husband and I are used to plush pillow tops mattresses, however we have slept on hard mattresses and by our account our room's mattress was HARD (as in absolutly no padding/cusioning to support our backs), after a few nights our backs were sore from sleeping on the bed. Also, it should be noted, and I am not sure why no one else posted it in their review, but you are required to leave your room key at the front desk when you leave at any time (we were not sure if this was "normal" Paris standards). We thought this was a bit odd because the hotel has a large sign posted that they do not assume responsibility for any stolen or missing items from the room and it is suggested that you lock your valuable items up (no brainer for that one) but it would clearly not fit a laptop or anything large. There is a small safe provided in the room but it cannot fit a laptop or ipad. We also ran into a misunderstanding when we first arrived, we were told by the lady at the front desk that the free breakfast was from 06:30 until 10:30. We went to breakfast the next morning, we saw a sign-in sheet where the eggs are ordered and asked the waitress working there about the breakfast and if it was free and she also said it was HOWEVER, the same evening when we picked up our key for our room the gentleman working the front desk asked us if we had breakfast (which we had) and he said that it was not free (the cost was 12 euros per person). We explained to him that 2 people had told us it was free but he assured us that we had heard wrong, we could tell there was no way he was going to be budging with taking it off of our tab (it seemed that there was NO way that his staff was wrong or misinformed us). But over all it was pleasant. If you are looking for a hotel with no frills but clean this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jonwnc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights at the end on October. It was our 4th trip to Paris and this was the best place we stayed. The room was bigger than any other we had stayed at. It was on a quiet street yet only 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Numerous places to eat nearby. The breakfast is a bit pricey but there is plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy little gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Aviator74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel back in May 2008 but never got around to writing a review. We were very pleased with the hotel, the staff were really great and help out in things like arranging an airport shuttle, recommending places to eat, shopping, etc. The location of the hotel is fantastic near the Hotel Invalides and walking distance from the Eiffel Tower grounds. We had a wonderful romantic time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Location, CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugg
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet is located about halfway between Rue Cler and Hotel Invalides on a quiet street just off of Avenue de la Motte- Picquet. A very short walk to either and with many great cafes and restaurants around, this is a nice place to call home, while in Paris. We were here for three nights in September and we found the hotel to outperform its rating. This was our first time staying here. Our taxi took us right to the front door and we were greeted inside by staff. Our check-in went quickly and the staff was very pleasant and informative. They do require that you leave your key with the front desk anytime you are out of the hotel. That wasnâ€™t a problem for us, and less likely hood of losing it. The hotel is modern and has a very nice lobby with plenty of sitting space to wait and read. There is a small elevator that will take you to your floor or you may take the winding staircase if you wish. We had a room on an upper floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. That view also allows you to see the street below. Having stayed on Rue Cler before, the street noise here was limited and the view was wonderful. Our room was spotless upon arrival and the bathroom was spacious with a shower/tub combo and a small sitting area with the room. The bed was wonderful and slept well. There is a phone in the room and a television with multiple language channels. Our room also had plenty of closet space for two people, with two separate closets. The breakfast area is somewhat tight in space, but the closeness creates an opportunity to meet some new friends, share ideas, and get some very helpful information for sightseeing. The breakfast itself is wonderful with a wide variety of items to choose from, including a made to order omelet. The bread is fresh and the croissants will melt in your mouth. You couldnâ€™t do better. There is a great variety of meat and cheese, juices, rolls and yogurts. At checkout, the staff went out of their way to get us transportation to the airport and it was on time and priced right. We will stay here again on our next visit. Kudos to the staff, they make the place what it is!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, super-friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carky29
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is not only in a great location, but it has the best, helpful staff! I left my coat behind, and they kindly forwarded it to me in Reims as soon as I notified them. The rooms (and bathrooms) are very nice, and the breakfast room is charming. We have already recommended it to some friends, and we will certainly stay there again ourselves when we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Marcia H
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this lovely little hotel in Oct. 2011. The location was perfect!! Close to the Eiffel Tower and Ecole Militaire Metro. Close to many great restaurants and cafes. Very clean and staff was wonderful, very helpful! I would definitely recommend to my family and friends and would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian s
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the price this is a lovely hotel the rooms are first class very clean nice bathrooms. The hotel is cdnfrally located for Eiffel tower and the army museum I will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: B K
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Hotel Muguet for the fourth time in the last 12 years. I continue to love this hotel and its location. In the 7th, close to Ecole Militaire Metro stop and Rue Cler shopping, I feel like a local hanging out here. We shop at the little boutiques in the neighborhood, hit the local market for groceries, take advantage of the local laundromat, and wrestle with choosing which pattisserie in the neighborhood is best. The rooms at Hotel Muguet are tiny but immacualte with very good, firm beds (dramatically improved since my last visit). Modern bathrooms, small but helpful elevator for access to upper floors with luggage. Very quiet street just a half block off the rather busy Avenue Motte Piquet. Walking distance to la Tour Eiffel, les Invalides and Rodin museum. Many wonderful restaurants in the neighborhood (Cafe Bosquet, Cafe Central, Punjab and Bistro St, Dominique some of our favorites). Breakfast at 12 euros per person is not a bargain, but for us, worth it to save time and get going in the morning, and decent offering of breads, ham, cheese, yogurts, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, cereals. Wonderful service from breakfast staff who always scrambled to help seat our party of 3. You can always pop over to Rue Cler markets, just 2 blocks away, if you want variety or a less expensive alternative. Front desk staff is mostly a little reserved but very helpful; their English is good but not super fluent. Martin of the evening staff is the exception to the "reserved" - absolutely charming and delightful - the kind of personality that makes a difference in the stay. Hotel Muguet is always my first choice in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martini1BostonMA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in October. Our room was small but this is to be expected in Europe and it didn't bother us in the least. Hotel was very well appointed and very quiet. The young woman serving breakfast was wonderful. There are a lot of Americans staying at this hotel: take this at face value, for some it's an advantage, for some a deterrent! Either way, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nicely located...”
Reviews.Author: Redeaglez
Reviews.Content: A pleasant, boutique of a hotel. Conveniently located a 1-2 minute walk from th Rue Cler. Rooms were small, but beautifully maintained and decorated. Freah flower boxes outside our window, which overlooked the Rue Chevert. The staff is pleasant and helpful. Parking a 4-5 minute walk away and moderately pricey (~70â‚¬/3 days).

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Trinity100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for five days this fall and found the location to be excellent. Very convenient to the Metro, Eiffel Tower and the Rue Cler neighborhood restaurants and shops. Our room was very clean and comfortable. We had a superior room which afforded us a little extra space, which I recommend after peeking into one of the standard rooms. The standard rooms are fine but of a typical European size. We had a view of the courtyard below as we were on a lower floor. If you have the money to do so, a higher floor and view of the Eiffel Tower would be wonderful. This hotel is not great for people with any sort of mobility issues which the hotel owners make perfectly clear on their website. Oh -- and the shower was divine! It had one of those enormous "rain shower" showerheads.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mg788
Reviews.Content: Paris is a sheer delight. Everywhere you look there is something to please the senses. This comfortable hotel is well located, a short walk from the Tour Eiffel, Les Invalides, and metro line 8. The staff are helpful and friendly, making it a worry free choice from which to explore this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Close, clean but lacks a smile”
Reviews.Author: VinoVan
Reviews.Content: A great spot in Paris, all rooms well equipped, clean and modern... Don't expect anything more as staff at front desk find it hard to smile let alone give travellers advice on their own town.. Noisy corridors makes for an early morning most days.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: ralee21
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located near the metro, Rue Cler, about 10 min from Eiffel Tower, 2 min from Napoleon's tomb. Our room 61 had fantastic view of the Eiffel tower, great bathroom with bath. Hotel has cute little lift (3 person capacity) to the 5th floor and the dining room is available to guests to use for dinner. We would get some fresh bread, cheese or takeaway from Rue Cler and eat in. Best way to get around is probably the 10 ticket pack and use the underground. If you also get the Museum Pass you can also skip some of the lines. If going to the Lourve - you can enter via the Underground or the Lion gate to avoid the queue at the pyramid.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: barve
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet had received positive reviews both on this site as well as in Lonely Planet, so I was delighted when they responded saying they had rooms available. Especially since I had written to at least 10-15 other hotels only to be informed that everything was full. Hotel Muguet was not cheap - we paid 190 euros for the room which I thought was extremely high, even given this was Paris. But I guess this was peak period hence the high rates. However the hotel is very nice. The staff is very helpful and offered to store our luggage till such time as the room got ready on the day we arrived. The rooms are small, but I would say slightly bigger than what we expected for Europe. Our room was on the 5th floor with a view of the Invalides dome and was quiet and peaceful. The bathroom was quite nice - I'm always nervous about this in small hotels, but I must say this turned out to be a pleasant surprise. The hotel is conveniently located to a Metro stop - Le Tour Maubourg. Not far from the hotel are a couple of good bistros and cafes to grab a bite for breakfast. We had a lovely stay and would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: brvancouver
Reviews.Content: We first stayed in room # 42, from which you can see the top of Eiffel tower, the room was quiet, with good size bathroom. The location of the hotel is great, very close to a metro station, in walking distance to Eiffel tower and other main attractions, and very close to the interesting Rue Cler. After returning from Provence we stayed in room # 12, not as good as the previous room, and less quiet. The area around the hotel felt safe at any time of the day and night that we walked by. The free Wifi in the room worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: clokpo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for four days in September. We reserved a Superior Room, which was more than worth it. A perfect view of the Eiffel Tower. The neighborhood is absolutely charming, and not as swarming with crowds as other areas we visited. The metro is a couple of blocks away, as is a full-service grocery. The Rue Cler is just around the corner. The room was spacious by Paris standards, though the closet and bath were small. Very well appointed. The staff is accommodating, but a couple of them were not particularly welcoming. The breakfast is modest, but tasty, and you can take a tray back to your room, which we appreciated. Beware that anyone with mobility issues would have a problem with the sixth-floor rooms. The elevator only goes to five, and the stairway to six is a bit precarious. Overall, we would definitely stay in the Hotel Muguet again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: texasgran
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 women using 4 rooms stayed at this lovely small hotel from September 8 - 16 2001. The staff was welcoming and helpful, the location couldn't be better. They are a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower, 3 blocks to the metro and taxi stand, and 2 blocks to Rue Cler. There are wonderful restaurants in the area so ask for and use the suggestions given by the staff. We opted for breakfast in the hotel, they could use more seating but people came and went quickly so it was never a big problem, coffee was good. I would stay here again and highly recommend this hotel. If you are nervous about picking a hotel in Paris, pick this one.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than I Remembered!”
Reviews.Author: chebellagiornata
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Muguet with a group of women travelers for 10 nights in early Sept. and found it to be the same great little hotel I remembered from my last group tour five years ago. Every person in my group rated it highly. The location a block away from Rue Cler is perfect for walking to tourist sights and is close to two Metro stations for convenient travel across the city. Restaurants in the neighborhood are excellent. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, with updated bathrooms (small, as is the norm in Paris). The staff was helpful and friendly. Updates since my last visit were free WIFI in the rooms and an enlarged breakfast buffet, including omelettes made to order. This hotel is located in a residential area, so you will find laundromat, post office, small shops, grocery stores, and the feeling of living around the locals. Tres bien!!

Reviews.Title: “A Room With a View”
Reviews.Author: cooptown-travelers
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, we found the Hotel Muguet in one of Rick Steve's books and followed up by reading the reviews in trip advisor and were pleased with our choice for a first visit to Paris. The location was terrific as far as getting around, finding good places to eat and proximity to famous sites such as the Eiffel Tower. We especially enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Muguet having sprung for a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. We looked forward to seeing it all lit up at night after long days exploring the city. The room was on the small size as most European rooms are, but it had some nice amenities such as a spacious wardrobe and an in-room safe, windows that opened out onto a little window balcony. The bathroom was bigger than we had expected having stayed in some Italian hotels with tiny bathrooms. We agree with other reviewers that the staff persona was a mixed bag. Some staff were friendly and helpful and others seemed a bit cool, but we wouldn't let that deter us from staying there again. We also thought that the breakfast was a bit over priced and preferred to go out to Rue Cler to have breakfast with a little more atmosphere, although in truth, eating out was not always much cheaper! All in all, we had a very pleasant stay at the Muguet and would certainly consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: FunandSunNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at Hotel Muguet with a friend in early September 2011. The hotel was in a great location, it was easy to get around to all the major sights, many were in walking distance. The hotel staff was friendly and helped us book several reservations. The room was good sized and clean and we had two wardrobes which was very convenient. We ate breakfast most mornings and it was well stocked and had a good variety of foods. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're looking for a comfortable, friendly stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: MJR102011
Reviews.Content: I stayed seven nights at the Hotel Muguet with a friend in early September 2011. The hotel was in a very good location and was a great value for the money. Also, our room was pretty large for a European hotel and was very clean and tidy. The staff at the reception area was hit or miss. A few of the staff members were very friendly and helpful and some others were not helpful at all. The last night of our stay we discovered our flight was cancelled. The man working the night shift was not very willing to help us with phone instructions to call our airline in order to make alternate arrangements and had a "figure it out yourself" attitude. Also, we only ate the breakfast one due to the fact that it was overpriced for what was offered. This was my fourth trip to Paris and when I plan my next trip I may look into other hotels, but may consider the Hotel Muguet again too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room, Parisian service”
Reviews.Author: BirdBikingBuddha
Reviews.Content: We had one night in Paris on our way to the airport from Brittany. We chose this one from Rick Steves just for grins (we usually do TripAdvisor). Not hard to get to from Montparnasse Train Station if you take the Metro. The location is even better for the one-night stay because it is easy walking distance from the Rodin Museum, Napoleon's tomb, The Eiffel Tower, and perhaps-too-American-friendly Rue Cler (you have to ask for a menu in French or they will give you one in English). We walked our feet off after checking into the hotel. Given that we had experienced a near-microscopic triple room in London a week earlier, the spacious triple room we got was a pleasant surprise. The neighborhood is quiet and blank, making it a bit spooky as one arrives but comforting after returning from the bustle of touristing on the main streets. The breakfast is miminal, but even minimal French food is hard to beat! The service was a bit on the chilly side but absolutely efficient and effective, especially arranging for a taxi to CDG that got us there in plenty of time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Paris”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights and were very happy with the property. Front desk helped us book a day trip and were helpful with taxis. The room was small but very well kept and clean. I would stay there again. A very good central location in the 7th, but also nice and quiet. We didn't do breakfast as we are late starters and just walked over to Rue Cler to start our day. Location, quiet and central make this a place I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: H M
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to book here after reading all the great reviews. It was everything we expected it to be...super clean, very comfortable bed, friendly service and a fabulous location. For breakfast, we found a patisserie within 5 minutes of our hotel, and brought back our food to eat in the breakfast room, ordering a coffee/OJ to go with our meal. We really appreciate the fact that the hotel allows and even encourages bringing in food, as long as it is not consumed in the room. Hey...that's how they keep the rooms so clean!!! You will not be disappointed with this hotel. It is just excellent, and conveniently located close to 2 metro stations and some amazing restaurants nearby (Pasco and Le Florimond).

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelers01
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris, we stayed for three nights in July in a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. This is a no frills hotel, but the room was large and clean the bed was firm, and it is close to the metro. This is not the place to stay if you want to be close to the St. Germain area or if you are looking for any luxuries but it is perfectly fine. A few downsides: the shower head is not attached to the wall so it is a hand held wand (this may be common). The breakfast is expensive for what it is and I am glad we did not buy it. Our room had a view of the Eiffel Tower, but you must stand at the window to see it. Not a complaint, just an FYI. One clarification from review we read-- there is a card to put in the wall to turn on the electricity and you must give this card to the front desk when you leave the hotel, BUT it does not affect the air conditioning, so you do not return to a stifling room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Manon165
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a charming, quiet street, very close to the metro (3-5 walking distance). Many sights are within walking distance. The rooms are small and the shower is tiny (but very clean!), but you don't come to Paris to stay in your room anyway. Wi-Fi is free and I never had problems with the signal. My bed was very comfortable and I slept like a baby all 5 nights I was staying there. The best way to get to and from the airport is by taxi, unless you don't have luggage and can take bus and metro. The staff was very friendly and always helpful, happy to make recommendations. I paid extra for breakfast and for me, it was well worth it since it saves so much time. I would definitely stay at Hotel Muguet again, I am looking forward to visiting Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mattmf16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary and were very pleased with the hotel! We had a "Superior" room (#45) which was on the 5th floor and faced the courtyard. The room was a lot bigger than we expected and included a king size bed, desk, armoire, chaise lounge, security safe, small plasma tv, free wi-fi, and plenty of room for the two of us. The room was very clean and the bathroom looked recently remodeled. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The room was cleaned every day. We had a problem one day with the electricity in half our room (popped circuit breaker, I think) and although it couldn't be fixed that night, it was fixed the next day. The best thing about this hotel is the location. While reasonably priced with great amenities, you can't beat the quiet street it is on and the closeness to Rue Cler, the Metro, and the Eiffel Tower. The Eiffel Tower is a mere 10 minute walk and the Metro and Rue Cler are less than 5 minutes away. Rue Cler has several Cafes, bakeries, and other places to eat. There is also a pharmacy and a few grocery stores all also within 5 minutes. This hotel was a great bargain and the location was great. Not to mention the staff and the room were also excellent. We definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and very helpful staffs”
Reviews.Author: TerryOldAgeDancer
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 spent 6 nights in this lovely hotel. Three years ago we stayed one of highly recommended hotel near by so I can make comparison. The room we got has one king size bed and sofa bed. Room is very spacious comparing with other hotel. The bathroom is even better that equips with bathtub comparing with other hotel room only has very tiny shower area. The room is very clean. The location is really convenient that metro station, many cafe/restaurants within less than 5 min. walk. The hotel is situated at very quiet street that we don't hear any noise from street at all. We did not take breakfast at hotel so I can not comment it. The free wifi is so wonderful that my daughter can not live without it. We particularly want to thank Charline at front desk that we got unexpected experience when we arrived at Eurostar train station. We told Charline and asked her to help us to call the company and make claim. She persistently called the company for 3 days; finally we got e-mail reply from the company. They settled our claim. We are very happy with the end result. Definitely we will come back to this hotel if we visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: angede
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff was great and friendly. The hotel was in a fabulous location in a nice neighborhood, the metro was close and easy to get to, but also in walking distance from several attractions. The room was great, yes the room was a bit tight, but you are in Europe all rooms are small and are you in Paris to be in your hotel room? The room was clean and well kept. We will definitely stay here when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Service and room roulette with great bed, shower, and location”
Reviews.Author: maremel
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay, though different front desk staff affected our visit in quirky ways. With two people, we were assigned the smallest room I have ever seen in my long traveling experience. The next day, the manager found out and moved us...we had been in a room fire coded for one person. We were moved to a slightly bigger room on the first floor. I told the gentleman on duty the next day that the motion-triggered light wasn't working outside our room, and he asked me what he was supposed to do about it. I asked him to tell the manager. So...pros: - easy location - fabulous bed - great shower and water pressure Cons: - the rooms are very different. The one- and two-person ones we were in were tiny - the front desk was highly variable I would recommend this hotel, but only if you are in one of the bigger rooms with a decent view.

Reviews.Title: “Huuuuuuuge Thumbs UP!!!”
Reviews.Author: RumRoll
Reviews.Content: The location was terriftic, the staff were incredibly polite and helpful and the room - c'est fantastique!!! And to be right near the beautiful Eiffel Tower - what more could you ask for?! Hopefully you will meet Martin. He's the great character at front desk during the evenings who will be sure to make you laugh :)

Reviews.Title: “Charming, quality hotel - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 1starving-artist
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were here for 4 nights with our daughters (ages 15 and 22). Pros: Online reserving was uncomplicated and easy with reassuring email confirmations; photos online and the positive reviews listed here are very accurate; good value; very clean and updated; quiet and clean neighborhood very well situated conveniently close to Tour Eiffel, Invalides, Rue Cler, Metro and many cafes; helpful staff (assisted us printing advance tickets with the lobby public computer, ordered a taxi for us, gave helpful city advice) - Martin was great; although there is no eating in the room - we were told food was allowed in the downstairs dining area at any time except for breakfast; we had a few hot days while there and the rooms were cool and comfortable; rooms were small (as expected) but not uncomfortable since we had plenty of room for luggage and a closet for hanging items as well. Hotel Muguet and the surrounding area felt very safe. Cons: We had requested rooms together on the same floor but were unfortunately put on 2 different floors and were told there was no other option (very disappointing, but not a deal-breaker). Rue Chevert (directly in front of the hotel) was undergoing construction during our stay but this is NOT a hotel issue. We had NO noise from this construction, it only prevented taxis from pulling directly in front. Just mentioning it FYI. Overall a positive experience; I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Delighful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JHROrange
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at the Hotel Muguet at the end of June. The air conditioning was invaluable as there were three days of heat during my stay (the lobby does not have a/c). The front desk was helpful at all times. As the hotel has been reviewed in detail by others, I will limit my review to topics that have not been covered. The Ecole Militaire Metro stop is more convenient for services such as cafes and groceries, the La Tour Maubourg stop is fine if you wish to go directly to the hotel. The Rue Cler is between the two stops. I personally found the Rue Cler touristy, but convenient. Many businesses are closed Sunday and/or Monday which is common in Paris. Nobody mentioned the bus. There are buses on the Motte Picquet that are very easy to use. The hotel staff looked up the numbers for me. The buses use the same ticket as the metro. I was able to take a bus to Gare du Nord instead of trying to manage luggage in the metro. The metro is wonderful, but it is underground and the buses can be more scenic and direct. Paris is a beautiful city to walk. I walked to the d'Orsay and on to the Left Bank. I also feel the Champs Elysees is doable (others have mentioned the Eiffel Tower). If you need to purchase a museum pass, head over to the Army Museum. You do not need to actually visit the museum to buy the pass. There is a newstand on the Rue Cler. Pick up a copy of The Periscope. It is in French, but it is easy to figure out. It lists what is going on in key theater venues. I went to a piano concert at the Hotel des Invalides and a ballet at a theater off of the Champs Elysees. Even though I travel frequently in Europe, I really don't like washing my clothes in the sink. There is a wonderful, clean, easy to use laundramat down the street from the hotel. Paris is such a fabulous city, I wish you the best on your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet - Wow!”
Reviews.Author: 917p3
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about Hotel Muguet. Absolutely idea location, close to the metro, Eiffel, Invalides, Rue Cler, and both a laundromat and a Carrefour. Free Wifi/Cable with CNNI, and comfortable rooms, albeit slightly on the smaller side. The evening attendant, Martin, is awesome! The man who works the day shift is not very pleasant. Don't get the breakfast- it's a bad deal. Overall- it's an easy choice. If it's available- book it worry free.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and a great price for the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: artfan54
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! So neat and clean and comfortable. Also, the location is great, just a block from the metro and the staff was helpful. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We spent one night at this hotel between travel to two different areas of France”
Reviews.Author: rascalWarrenTownship
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews on tripadvisor and Rick steves/the NY Times. It was near the Eiffel Tower where we were to meet family that evening. Our room was quiet and very large, the bed large and comfortable. At the front desk, George was good but the other two men were useless. We missed two calls in the evening because one didn't know any english at all. it's a pity, but maintenance seemed to be a problem. The handle on the middle window fell off when I tried to open it, as is usually the case in Paris, the air condition control was near the front door but the light above it didn't work and I had to fiddle around in the dark and the shaving mirror was broken at the neck. In the morning, when my wife was getting out of the shower, I heard a constant ring and finally called the front desk and was told that it was the fire alarm. We rushed down as soon as possible and joined the guests and the attendants who where sitting there at the desk. A short time later, we were told that we could return to our room. I think that someone should have knocked on all the doors to make sure that the rooms where empty. .

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhwere else?”
Reviews.Author: JonesieLinthicum
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great six-night stay. This hotel really has it all- a great location, comfortable rooms, and a helpful, English-speaking staff. I thought that the location near the Eiffel Tower and the rooms-with-a view would be perfect for the first-timers in our group. I also wanted air conditioning, since we would be staying in July. I made arrangements for our group of six (which included three generations) to stay here. Everyone was pleased with the decision. I found the beds to be extremely comfortable, and the blackout curtains ensured a sound sleep. The rooms were very well soundproofed. The built-in tile shower stall featured a large showerhead and excellent water pressure. The air-conditioning worked well, and was most welcome after our first two days of hot, sunny weather. One couple opted for the superior room with a view, and were happy with their view of the dome of the Invalides. Others might be disappointed not to be able to seee the Eiffel Tower. The seniors in the group were initially placed in a room on the sixth floor. However, since the elevator only goes to the fifth, it would mean climbing stairs, which they had difficulty with. We asked for a different room, and were able to make the change after the first night. I also had a problem with the in-room safe, and they sent someone up to the room to fix it right away. The guests here were almost exclusively American, and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. There was a problem calling a cab the day of our departure due to a triathalon, but we just walked to the taxi stand near the Tour Maubourg metro stop. There are several good restaurants (le Florimond, l'Auberge Bressane, and Pasco) that are a two-minute walk away. This wonderful hotel represents a great value, and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: exmontrealgirl
Reviews.Content: I took my granddaughter here for her birthday. It was very hard to find a hotel with twin beds, TV and Internet. The hotel was very clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were quiet (!), the location was fabulous and we highly recommend it! Very close to pulic transit, air conditioned and on a quiet street!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adam K
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel. I pay for one person room 100euro, this is not much. This hotel have great location, free net, nice rooms and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & A Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nikki7479
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel on our 3 week trip around France, Italy and Spain. I must say, we were a bit spoiled after leaving here. The staff was friendly, the bathrooms were spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. It's fairly close to the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler Area. I will definitely be back and will make sure to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, prefect location in the Rue Cler neighborhood. Easy walk to the Eiffel tower”
Reviews.Author: BrianJ81
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, esp with making reservations. We stayed on the 3rd floor in a double room with a queen bed. The bed was very comfortable and the room spacious. I was surprized we had such a nice room as we booked a standard room. The rate was $150 euros per night. The room came with a shower and tub. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel tower. Loved the nieghborhood, nice restuarants nearby. Paris is a very busy, crowded and noisy city, so be prepared for that. In order to avoid lines at the musuems and the Eifflel tower go when they first open and you will avoid alot of the crowds. By 11am all tourist sights are very busy with long lines. Hands down the best musuem is the d' Orsey. If you see only one this one has it all. The Louvre has the Mona Lisa and some nice Egyptian artifacts. It tends to be hot and stuffy, their are no water fountains so you need to bring your own. A river cruise down the Seine is fun, as well as going to the very top of the Eiffel tower. Beware the Metro, as it is very crowded dirty and full of pick pockets. I came close to being robbed. There are also many other scammers working near the Eiffel tower, the police come and chase them away and after the police leave they come right back.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: PennTraveler12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Muguet in late June. I will not repeat much of what has been written and posted by Trip Advisor but will add some additional comments not yet offered about this property. First, the negatives: The bathroom amenities (e.g. soap) were very poor, about the size of a postage stamp (literally). For the price paid, I think the Muguet can do a little better here. On our first morning about 0730 there was a fire alarm....evidently someone set the detection system off by smoking in their room. When we reached the lobby the staff acted like nothing was happening, sitting at the desk working. Finally the owner appeared and announced that everyone could return to their room. To my knowledge the fire department had never been called, nor was their a public address sytem (required by codes) to announce and inform guests what was going on. We asked about a hair dryer and told that there was one in our desk drawer. It literally was wired through the rear of the drawer, and you had to hold the button continuously to operate. I know electric is expensive in Paris, but give me a break! I had great difficulty with the internet/computer in the lobby. On the postive side, the property was very clean, the staff friendly and courteous, and we had a quiet room. The air conditioning worked fine, but only when you were in the room. You must remove your key card when leaving and this shuts all electric off in the room. This is why they collect the key card at the desk when you leave. Based on our experience and the money paid, we will look for a different property in Rue Cler upon our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Service at front desk is inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: Savvytourist2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week for the first time. As other reviewers have noted, you aren't allowed to eat anything in your room. I think this should be more clearly stated on their website as it's not the case in every hotel in Paris, and they are very strict about this at the hotel. My recommendation to the hotel is that they work on clearly communicating this rule at the arrival of guests. They have several rules at this hotel which are posted in their elevator and behind their concierge desk, but who can keep track of reading all these materials when it is scattered? My advice to the hotel is to type up all the reminders and rules that are important to them one one page to give to guests at their arrival: no food eaten in room, nonsmoking, charge a day's hotel fee if you checkout early by 7am, guests must handover hotel key every time you leave the hotel and the list of their rules go on. To us, it didn't seem classy of the hotel (in fact it was pretty annoying, like being bossed around by mom with post it notes around the house) to post all these reminders everywhere and it was unprofessional to not clearly communicate this at the beginning. In fact, we didn't realize we were supposed to give them the hotel key every time we left the hotel (for security purposes they said), until one day we came back and we were harshly reprimanded by the older man at the desk (wears glasses). Well this rule does not apply at every hotel so we were not aware, we certainly would have done that earlier if we had been advised. That grumpy man at the desk works long hours day and night. Then there is a cheerier more pleasant man (slim, stylish) who sometimes works the night shift. There are also maybe four other younger staff that work throughout the week. When we asked the grumpy older man at the desk if he could arrange a shuttle to the airport for us, he was pretty rude and said they don't call shuttles for guests and we would have to call ourselves! What the heck does a concierge get paid for then??? So we waited for Grumpy Guy to leave and got one of the younger guys to call the shuttle, which took a long time to arrange by phone (25 min) but we were just grateful he did it. Service is inconsistent and rude at times, and this hotel should work on making the front desk better at communicating what the hotel expects from it's guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JTrawn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Muguet many times while visiting France/Paris and haven't written a review yet. I wanted to share our fine experience with you this time around. The reviews on Trip Advisor are most accurate about the quality of the hotel and its customer service. The location in the 7th district is a stones throw from the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is located in a lovely residential/high end/luxe neighbourhood. There are many quaint bistros nearby, museums (Ecole Militaire), and of course the fresh open air market located in Rue Cler. The subway is a 5 minute walk and the Champs Elysee main avenue is a good 15 -20 minute walk. The rooms are updated, modern, and albeit on the small side. That notwithstanding, the bathrooms are immaculate and also modernized. The front desk staff were accommodating, pleasant, and provided service with a personal touch which is hard to find in Paris. Read = they were not obnoxious which I have unfortunately come to expect many of the time. The internet in the lobby is great as a reviewer has previously noted. The Muguet is my place to stay and the price of $140 euros per night is more than reasonable for what you get in return. Enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Updated, modern rooms in the 7th”
Reviews.Author: tomkey
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet appealed to me as seeming to have the most updated, modern rooms in the price range and area that I preferrd. The rooms were small, as one would expect in Paris, but not unbearably so, and they were fitted out quite nicely, as depicted on the web site. The bathroom, while small, provided an enclosed shower, which was nice given that a lot of French hotels really don't provide this (either no shower, or an attachment on the tub which is not adequately enclosed to prevent water from getting all over the place when you shower). Our party of six (one couple, my two sisters, my nephew, and I) got three rooms--one queen bed and two rooms with twin beds. The beds were very comfortable, and the rooms were well appointed. The air conditioning in our room was not overpowering (my sisters' room was much cooler), but we never really had a day that put it to the test. The location was what we were looking for--close to the metro (Ecole Militaire and La Tour Maubourg about equally close in opposite directions on La Motte Piquet), and in the quiet 7th arrondisement. If you are looking for late night action, or tons of bars and restaurants, you might prefer someplace like the Marais. If you want a quiet neighborhood, but one that is not remote, this is where you want to be. The hotel doesn't want you to take food into the rooms (no minibars here), but you can use the ground floor breakfast area if you buy something on Rue Cler and need a place to sit down and eat it. This hotel also provided the most reliable high speed internet of any of the three hotels we used during our stay in France. I have to give a special thanks to the night clerk from Saturday night. About 4:30 a.m. Sunday morning, I woke up and realized that I had booked our airport shutte on the internet using the wrong day (I booked it for the first day of the week, which in the US, would be Sunday, but which on French web sites is Monday), so I had to cancel that reservation and line up two cabs, and the night clerk made the call for the cabs which were on time, and only about 10 euros more than we would have paid for the private shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “It was everything promised”
Reviews.Author: jimmerjimjim
Reviews.Content: A very clean, quiet hotel in a convenient neighborhood. Access to local Charcuteries, Patisseries and bakeries as well as a fantastic wine shop next door made for excellent dinners in the hotel's dining area. Martin is worth his weight in gold. A real helpful and hard working guy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good, quiet location!”
Reviews.Author: bamse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Muguet for four nights and liked the hotel a lot! The hotel is very close to the metro station at La Tour Maubourgh, so it was easy to reach the hotel from the airport, by first taking the Roissybus to the Opera and then changing to the metro. The hotel is in a quiet side street so no noise whatsoever from the outside! The metro station at Ecole Militaire is also close and quite a few sights are within walking distance (e.g. Eiffel Tower, The Invalides) and there are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants in the area. The room was very clean and tidy and had comfortable beds and a nice bathroom. We could see the Eiffel Tower from the window of our room (number 53). We had breakfast at the hotel and it included coffe/tea, orange juice, croissants, different types of cheese, yoghurts, cereals and eggs. The breakfast is a bit expensive (12 euros), but still worth it I think. The staff was very friendly and helpful and made you feel welcome. I would definitely stay here again and would also recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in A Quiet Area”
Reviews.Author: sedasa
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in Hotel Muguet between May 3 and 8. it was 5 minutes away from etoile militare metro station. the hotel staff was always ready to help and nice. our room was small but i guess it is common in France. The room was quiet clean and we were allowed to use the kitchen in the downstairs. if you are going to Paris, it seems hard to find a budget hotel. This hotel is not cheap, but it is comperasantly cheaper. its location is good and it felt safe. i would prefer it for the second time.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ILtraveler812
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our trip and we spent 5 nights at the Hotel Muguet. We had 2 grandmothers, 2 kids and 2 parents and the rooms fit our needs perfectly. The hotel and the rooms were very clean and in a great location. We were able to walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Amy Museum, the Roudin Museum, the Rue de Cler as well as to a Metro Stop and several bus stops. The hotel was a good value considering its location and although the rooms were small, the pictures on the website and on trip advisor are very accurate. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: KelliSR
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredibly clean, charming, and offered great service. Everyone who worked at the front desk (who included the owner's parents) spoke excellent English, and all were knowledgeable and friendly. The hotel was close to several excellent restaurants, bistros, markets, and shopping, and just blocks from the Metro. Breakfast was very nice, heathly, fresh, and AMAZING croissants! I am American, and I understand that the size of the room was a standard "European" size, but a bit too small for my taste. We had a nice view, it was incredibly quiet (while we were there for Christmas), and our private bathroom was new, clean, and very stylish. Our bed, however, was INCREDIBLY hard. My body would literally hurt when I woke up in the morning, so there wasn't much sleep to be had. Still, I would definitely return as long as there is a softer bed!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: campceo
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I stayed here for 7 days. It is an excellent location to Rue Cler, the Metro, the Eiffel Tower, neighborhood bistros and stores. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The hotel is clean and quiet. We especially loved room 51 with a balcony and a view of the Eiffel Tower. We'll be back on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel -- Quiet but near to everything”
Reviews.Author: EllieSing
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at Hotel Muguet. It had a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The price (though not cheap) was good given the wonderful location and the very nice rooms. The breakfast was adequate but not wonderful -- the coffee wasn't really what you would expect from Paris. Other than that, everything was perfect. Our room had a very reasonably sized bathroom and the water pressure and the water temperature were perfect. Our 11 year old shared the room with us and it was a nice surprise to find that there was a half wall separating her sleeping area from ours. I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: leslieh33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in May 2011 and loved the location and the staff. The breakfast was extra and O K. It was nice to visit with other travelers in the small hotel lobby. The best thing was the location, Just 2 blocks from Rue Cler where we headed every night for dinner. The only complaint was the rule about no eating in the room, it seems like if you are paying for the room you should be able to have an apple or other snack in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet was delightful”
Reviews.Author: FrogPrince63
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at this small, well-located hotel on a quiet side street in an upscale neighborhood. Our quiet room was large by Paris standards though some of the other guests had smaller rooms. The staff was quite helpful and the breakfast (extra $) was satisfying; they made us omlets upon request.. Located close to the Eiffel Tower, the Seine and the Metro, the hotel is convenient for seeing Paris and enjoying a variety of good restaurants. If we revisit Paris we will definitely stay again at the Hotel Muguet.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: joinfam5
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Muguet with my family. This hotel provides wonderful location (near Eiffel Tower). The hotel is within walking distance of the Eiffel tower, Rue Cler, as well as the Metro (Ecole Militaire). The staff was fairly welcoming and helpful, yet not intrusive. We did not participate in the 12 euro breakfast provided by the hotel mainly because Rue Cler was so close (many restaurant options). Not to mention that the atmosphere was quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: gusfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on our trip to France in May: two days at the start and three days at the end. We loved the location and nearby amenities (7th arrondisement). The rooms were small (typical for big city hotels) but clean and well-appointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. Close to metro and lots of cafes & restaurants, a block from the markets on rue Cler, but on a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in the perfect city!”
Reviews.Author: lsr1011
Reviews.Content: Loved every second of our 4-night stay at Hotel Muguet! Staff is superb. Room was outstanding (we were on the top floor & had a view of the Eiffel Tower! Can you say 'like a dream'?!!!) Hotel's location was an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower, military museum/Napoleon's Tomb, and VERY easy access to the metro....not to mention the neighborhood itself which had wonderful restaurants & cafes all over the place! Strolling through Paris. I still smile just thinking about it! The room itself was clean, spacious & comfortable. The bathroom was quite large - I'm mentioning this because a friend had stayed in a different room a few months before us and said the shower was VERY tight (and he's a skinny cyclist!) WiFi did not work well on our floor, so we had to Skype the family from the lobby; that would be the only criticism. We hope to go back someday!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grouper57
Reviews.Content: the Hotel Muguet is located in the 7th district close to cafes, Metro and bus line. Staff speak English and are very helpful with activites. George was especially helpful, Rooms are good size and well decorated. Our room on the 6th floor (61) had a great view of the Effiel Tower, but the hotel elevator only goes to the 5th floor. Breakfast wasquite good with made to order ham and cheese omlets.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with personal service, great location, comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Helen S
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Hotel Muguet (previously in 2009). The staff/owners made our stay an absolute delight! They were personal, patient and helpful from our reservation to our many questions each day. We feel as though it is truly our 'home away from home'. The rooms are spacious, bedding comfortable, bathrooms large by Paris standards and exceptionally clean. Daily breakfast is available, convenient, bountiful and reasonable. There are restaurants, metro stops, taxi stand, local market all nearby and the Eiffel Tower is only a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: erreci61
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a pleasant surprise. I have picked it based on the positive feedback from this site. I can only confirm that was absolutely a positive experience. From the warm welcome at the arrival to the nice room under the roof (very french), nice small but not too small - except the bathroom...(this was really tiny). The location is perfect if you look a quite place, residential, outside of the most frequented place in Paris. If you look for nightlife go somewhere else.... There are nice restaurants and bistro close to the hotel. Everything is within 20/30 mins by metro. A positive experience I would love to replicate in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: kjs535
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Paris for 4 nights and I chose Hotel Muguet based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor. It was in our price range, was in a great location, and plenty of folks raved about it. We were not disappointed in the least. Upon arrival, even though we were there a few hours before check in, our room was ready and they let us unload and check in early. After a 10 hour flight, that was a welcomed surprise! The hotel itself is easy enough to find and is probably closest to the Ecole Militaire metro stop. There are plenty of shops, ATMs, and even a grocery store nearby for any of your needs. They had free wi-fi which was wonderful, and elevator so we weren't lugging our bags 3 flights up. There is no continental breakfast, but we ended up eating chocolate croissants from street vendors every morning anyway. Our view was of a courtyard off the street which was nice. The hotel is located in a more well-to-do area and the street it sits on is home to many apartments and condos. I enjoyed not having too much of the city noise at night while we slept. The location isn't far from the Eiffel Tower, and if you're using the metro, everything is within 10-20 minutes anyway. The desk attendants are pleasant enough and if we'd required assistance, they would've tended to us. They weren't overly friendly, but we didn't really encounter much of that on our trip anyway. They were helpful enough. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay in a quality hotel for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for 3”
Reviews.Author: TravelSavvy31
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter, and I shared a triple room--not easy to find in Paris--and were extremely pleased. The location is great: a quick walk to 2 Metro stations, the Eiffel Tower, and plenty of cafes and shops, yet on a relatively quiet street . We enjoyed the beautiful sunlit dining room where a bountiful breakfast buffet (cheeses, yogurt, cold cereal, charcuterie, baguettes, croissants, hard-boiled eggs, juice, coffee) was served daily for 12 euros. Coffee was available at all time for a modest charge, as were bottled water and sodas. We are already looking forward to our next visit, whenever that may be.

Reviews.Title: “A truly lovely hotel - worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Dianna W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet when my husband ran the Paris Marathon on 10th April. The hotel was really great. Very quiet with adequate size rooms, very clean and well maintained. The desk staff were extremely helpful and pleasant to deal with. They never even laughed at our funny pronounciation of some of the street names! The breakfast was plentiful and well worth the price we paid (included in our package). I have given their details to family & friends in the U.K. and South Africa. The hotel is very near to all the main tourist attractions but with the Metro being so fantastic nothing was really very far away.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a perfect long weekend!”
Reviews.Author: gd52tele
Reviews.Content: After several trips to Paris on business it was time to go there on holiday. Since it has been years since our last visit and having four days available we decided to take a long weekend in Paris together. Wanting to stay away from the large business travel hotels we investigated the small inexpensive, truely European style hotels. We came upon the Hotel Muguet from an article in the NY Times Travel section on recommended small hotels in Paris - Hotel Muguet made the top 10. After checking their location and home page for specifics we made the Muguet our choice...and we were not disappointed at all. Sitting on the small narrow rue Chevert the Muguet was within walking distance to the Eifel Tower and Champs Elysees. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and very helpful in recommending resturants and in providing directions using the Metro. We will go back there again when we visit Paris in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MickeyT78
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights and had a wonderful experience. They helped by email before the trip and gave good recommendations while there. The hotel is in a great location, near the Eiffel Tower and most importantly, the subway. We also found several excellent restaurants a short walk from the hotel. The facilities were modern and clean. The staff was more than friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I really want to love this hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: TuffysDad
Reviews.Content: I do really want to love this hotel, but there were some problems. First, the staff and particularly the owner, Mme. Richard, and her daughter, are simply delightful. However, there are real problems with the room we stayed in. The room we had faces the street on Rue Chavert. It is a small street but quite noisy at all hours. To get sleep one must close the window to keep out the street noise. The nights were cool outside, but inside the room became incredibly hot. So hot, in fact, that the three of us had a terrible time sleeping! The room was not air conditioned, and I cannot imagine sleeping there in summer months. Also, the shower is doorless but allows water to escape onto the floor requiring us to mop up about a gallon of water after each shower. This was minor however compared to the sleepless nights. Unfortunately, this really affected the quality of our Paris experience. There are a number of positives however that I want to emphasize -- the wonderful staff, the breakfast, location near the metro, the nearby laundrymat, grocery store, and pharmacy. Try to get a room facing the coutyard and you may be able to keep the window open. Get a room on the top floor and it may reduce the noise and no risk of noisy upstairs neighbors -- there were four unescorted kids above us that made a racket well into the a.m. but we cannot blame the staff for that. They did contact the guests, and this problem was reduced but not eliminated. The last night we were provided a portable fan and this helped, but only a little. I am sad to write a somewhat negative review.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized room for Paris! Amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: MelandTom2010
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a view of the Eiffel tower from our room it was beautiful! Paris is expensive for something really nice, but this place was worth it!(it was also only one nights stay though and our last night on our honeymoon!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: AndieD50
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of this hotel, steps from the Eiffel Tower and restaurants and the metro but on a very quiet side street. The staff is super helpful and readily speak English - thank you!!!! The rooms are a bit small as one might expect for a Parisian hotel, and please note the bathrooms are equally compact. I am a small person and I kept turning off the shower accidentally whenever I turned around in the shower. A larger person may want to inquire about an appropriately sized room and bath as I believe I had the smallest. But that is a very minor issue. Overall, the rooms, breakfast room, and staff were wonderful! Having access to a free computer to check email was VERY helpful as well!!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel gem.”
Reviews.Author: Katarina12001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Muguet for six nights in March. Everything was perfect. My room overlooked a courtyard and was clean, quiet, and updated. The helpful staff were available 24 hours. The location in the Rue Cler neighborhood made it very easy to get around on the Metro or bus. I also enjoyed the neighborhood restaurants and historic monuments - Napoleon's Tomb and the Eiffel Tower. Only one slight downside - the room was hot at night - but I just opened the window and it was fine. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, comfortable and secure.”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia090
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here, as a solo traveler, 4 different times in the past two years, and have always enjoyed my room which is attractive, clean and comfortable. I particularly like having front desk staff on duty all night. Free internet is also appreciated and the location near Rue Cler, Metro Stop Ecole Militaire and the Eiffel Tower is nice! I'm coming again in July and my sister is also booking a room, as well as my pastor and his wife who are joining us on vacation. So that tells you how highly I regard the hotel! Sylvia Grant

Reviews.Title: “Very highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: apache85
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 5 night stay at Hotel Muguet, and I'm very pleased with my experience there. The staff were nothing but friendly and helpful, quickly sorting out a problem (my fault) with the room safe and entertaining my beginner's French. The hotel is in an excellent location, very close to the Eiffel Tower, L'Ecole Militaire and a metro station (L'Ecole Militaire on the Creteil - Balard line). There are several good cafe's nearby (Cafe Des Officiers was my favourite!) as well as pharmacies and a supermarket. The room was typically small for Paris, however it was impeccably clean and the bathroom appears to have been recently renovated. The room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The only part of my stay I was not entirely comfortable with was leaving the key at the front desk each time I left and picking it up when I returned. I presume this is a security measure for pickpockets, however I found it inconvenient when simply popping out to do laundry (good laundromat at the end of the street, by the way). Overall I found my experience at Hotel Muguet to be overwhelmingly positive, and I will be staying here again next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: BigDCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I've been remiss in not reviewing this hotel. It's at an excellent location and the rooms are very clean and well maintained. The owners are in fact quite stringent on the cleanliness thing, but I think that benefits the rest of us. The owners are professional and treat their customers that way. They actually put up with my feeble attempts to speak French to them. I had no problems with thin walls or too much noise. A bit pricey, but overall an excellent stay and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service - Extremely cold and rude reception”
Reviews.Author: iloveeurope916
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early and checked in with the front desk. The reception was cold and we were callously told that the room was not ready. We didn't expect the room to be ready and would have only considered it a bonus if it was.
