Asking them for an idea of when it might be ready only made things worse as the desk clerk became even more irritable. This is not an unreasonable question. So we waited. But the attitude of the reception clerk gave us such a sour feeling that we had to get out of the hotel. So I approached her once more to ask to use the restroom and also to ask if she could keep our bags for us. Before I could even say a word, she barked "the room is not ready!!!" When we returned, we were helped by a different lady. Not quite as cold but still with the attitude. I simply wanted to make sure they knew I would not opt for the breakfast and she snapped "if you take, you take!" We made sure to avoid the front desk staff as much as possible during our stay except for the night crew, which were the polar opposites of the morning crew. Very pleasant. However, the day before checkout I came to the front desk to ask about transportation to the airport. This time, a different lady from the first two. I could see that she was being very helpful with an elderly couple so I thought my luck might change. I asked her about transport to the airport in the morning and she abruptly handed me a pamphlet and said "take this, now you go!" as she waved me away with a hand motion as if to say shew. Wow! We travel quite a bit and we have never in our lives experienced such poor treatment. We are very quiet people that don't like to cause any kind of scene. But, considering how well I witnessed an elderly couple being handled, I can only assume they are discriminatory towards young people. We did nothing to provoke such despicable behavior from 3 different staff member. Thankfully, our interaction with everyone else in Paris was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenna_mackenzie
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in Paris and I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel after hearing some horror stories from friends. It was very clean with lovely furnishings and the bathroom seemed to have been renovated recently. I will be going to Paris again in two months and have every intention of staying there again. The hotel staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jmf3327
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Wonderful staff. Great location. Quiet and comfortable. Impeccably clean. This is a small gem. There are others nearby that are also very nice, and it keeps the prices "reasonable" by Paris standards, but I would stay here without a doubt. Close to Rue Cler, the Metro, Tour Eiffel, Invalides, Museo Rodin etc. Paris is a city where everything is close and walk-able, and walking is recommended. We spent more of our time in Saint Germain and the Latin Quarter where there is more activity, but preferred the quiet at night at Hotel Muguet. Only wished we could have met Charline.

Reviews.Title: “Could not recommend it more highly”
Reviews.Author: brenda079
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cozy and in a perfect locatioln close to one of my favourite streets, Rue Cler. Very clean,friendly, pleasant decor and excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Great, brilliant, perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Mom_in_UK_and_Oz
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several different Paris hotels over the last few years, trying not to spend more than 120 odd euros a night. Most of them have had quite small rooms, have barely made it in the cleanliness stakes, and were not the experience one would hope for in Paris. But Muguet, which means Lily of the Valley, was great! 8 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower parkland, 5 minutes walk from two subways, close to a street of restaurants (Rue Cler), Hotel Muguet is very clean, very friendly and worth every euro! The rooms are the largest we've found for the price in Paris, they're light, ultra clean and stylish yet modern. We had two very pleasant "starts to the evening" in the foyer, sipping one night on a Bordeaux, and the other on some Champagne, which we brought with us on the Eurostar! The breakfast was typical Continental fare, some breads, cold meats, coffee etc., and once again everything was clean and friendly. We have already recommended Hotel Muguet to our friends!! Thanks Hotel Muguet!

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean , Nice Beds”
Reviews.Author: Perth_magpie
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean, good area to stay . Quiet and with lots of shops, markets and places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travelbyplane
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, fantastic location-5 min walk to Eiffel Tower. This was a clean, well run hotel. I travelled with my teenage daughter, our room was large considering it was Paris. it was clean,friendly hotel in a safe area where the staff was always ready to help with directions, recommendations (all in English). Will definately stay here again. If you want a quieter room, ask for a room from the street (Rue Chevert), however then you won't have a view of the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Theives! Beware! No help from management.”
Reviews.Author: Ghosttownhunter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 16 days in Europe in May 2010, and this was the worst hotel experience, by far. Hotel employees stole $450 of electronics from our luggage. If you can't trust the employees, it's not worth staying there. We left a $350 Canon point-and-shoot camera in one of our suitcases while we went sight-seeing the day before we checked out. The camera was literally buried at the bottom of the suitcase, which was then closed and stored in a closet. Thus, the offending employee not only dragged our luggage out of the closet to rummaged through everything, he/she/they dug electronic items out from our underwear! My wife also had an $100 electronic cosmetic item that she left in her toiletries bag that went missing the same day. We didn't notice the items were gone until we arrived back in the United States (perfect timing on the thieves' part). I e-mailed management THREE TIMES asking for help and advising them of the situation. They never responded. Not once. Not even a "sorry for your loss" or "we'll ask our employees about the items." They just ignored us. Client here are nothing but a revenue source. It looks like they try hard to maintain a good image on here, but just beware that once you pay your bill, they will ignore you. We stayed in 7 hotels in Italy and France and this was the worst simply because they are dishonest and unresponsive. Stay here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Parisian Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Billyboyrocks63
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in Paris, and I will continue to stay there, each time I am fortunate enough to go. The Muguet is exceptionally clean, and everyone is so friendly, and genuine. My partner was especially fond of Wolfgang, the dog. I hate to tell people how great this hotel is, only for selfish reasons: so I will always have a place to stay. There is nothing negative about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hardest beds ever slept in- sheets felt like sandpaper”
Reviews.Author: bigtrip85
Reviews.Content: Cleaning staff very conscientious â€“ room cleaned well daily. Poor quality linens, blankets and pillows made sleeping on extremely hard beds almost impossible. Towels and washcloths were clean but rough as sandpaper. Breakfast not a good value. Free wifi virtually impossible to use.

Reviews.Title: “i recommend it to my friends”
Reviews.Author: mauro43
Reviews.Content: i did recommend it to my friends,nice hotel,friendly staff,very helpfull,very clean,great locacion,ill be back .if i have to say something to improve it will be the tv channels,they were not international channels or news in english,and i dont like to live the key at the desk everytime you go out,other than that is fine and ill definitly came back.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok - Let down by lackluster reception”
Reviews.Author: Rineei
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet delivers the an okay room at a decent price, but dont expect much more than that. The staff at reception dont smile and seem somewhat affronted when you ask them questions - not what I call customer service. Also dont understand the need for guests to leave their hotel key with the front desk everytime one leaves the hotel? Am I not trusted to take my own hotel key with me? Have never been asked to do this before - it's somewhat of a hassle having to ask the receptionist (if they're even there) for my hotel key everytime I need to access my room. Other guests were generally quite but noise filtered through from other rooms at all hours of the night. Wi fi was very slow and only seemed to work early during the day

Reviews.Title: “Great Room! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: RobertRamos
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet was the perfect stop for our first time in Paris. Location was our main concern and we were not disappointed. Supershuttle dropped us right in front of the hotel from CDG. The hotel is a quick walk to the Eiffel Tower. Itâ€™s around the corner from Napoleonâ€™s tomb and Ecole Militaire metro station. After a full day of sightseeing and walking the room was very comfortable and quiet. A short walk from the hotel is Rue Cler, an open market scene with many eating options for breakfast/lunch/dinner. Excellent Wifi, a big plus when using skype to phone family back home. We traveled with our 11 year old and the double room was actually a full double room (not two rooms with a door in between). Tons of closet space, enough for coats, clothes and luggage. Full size bath with shower/tub. In room safe at no cost. In our travels in Europe one of the biggest rooms so far. No food in room policy. But with so many eating options nearby who wants to eat in the room. Boutique hotel makes the perfect Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, safe, clean, and good value - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: DC_girlinLondon
Reviews.Content: Location - two blocks from the La Tour Maubourg station. Lots of cute restaurants on 'Rue Cler Market' - just a block away , in the western part of St. Germain, and on a quiet street. I felt very safe as a single woman walking at night. Rooms - small (typical for Europe). Decent size bed (european firm), very clean, very quiet (except the occasional plumbing noises from adjourning rooms, and hallway noise - but not bad. A few english channels on television. Good clean bathroom with good shower and hot water pressure. Staff - helpful and nice. I would definitely stay here again. Good value for the money. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A Quaint Hotel near Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: ldyhumbird
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very helpful to us. We had planned on staying two nights but due to the protests in Paris in October, our flight from Spain was cancelled. We called the hotel to explain and were told - "No Problem." When we did arrive, it was about an hour drive from the airport and as the shuttle turned onto a narrow street, there was the hotel. There is a very narrow stairwell or a very small elevator (1 person and 1 luggage). If you are on the 6th floor - it is an elevator and the final flight by stairwell. The rooms were small but adequate. Everything I needed was there. It was a bit difficult to use the hairdryer as it was plugged in through the desk. The hotel is non-smoking, so the smokers go right outside the front door. Our room was on the first floor (ground level is 0) - and we had our window open due to the wonderfully cool air. The smoke came right into our room, causing us to close the window. It is a short walk to shops and a few blocks to the Eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Charm”
Reviews.Author: EleanorMckeown
Reviews.Content: Having visited Muguet for over thirty years and enjoyed three generations of the Pelletier family we feel we must tell the world about this delightful hotel. The location is so central,near two Metro stations and walking distance of many of Paris "must see" sights. The hotel is in a quiet road and not noted for late night noise, although there are plenty of restaurants catering for all tastes and pockets near by. The bedrooms are immaculate, not big but exceptionally clean and cared for, likewise, the en-suite bathroom is equally excellent. Breakfast is an easy start to the day with plenty of time to linger over an extra cup of coffee. The staff are to a man and a woman charming and always ready to help with restaurant bookings etc. they all speak english but will appreciate and help when one tries to speak French. We shall continue with Muguet as our first choice in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AmandaEleanor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Muguet previously and I am pleased to say they continue to offer one of the best hotel experiences I have had in Paris. It is a small family-run hotel, quietly located in a side road, very close to the Metro and with great cafes and market streets around it. The welcome is always professional and warm, the hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms are well furnished. Depending on your room they vary greatly in size - previously I stayed in a spacious room with lovely bathroom . This time I was in the smallest room available and whilst it was comfortable and nicely furnished the bathroom was bijoux in the extreme and the shower was a squeeze. However, the value for money still makes it worth while putting up with a small bathroom! If you like traditionally presented, absolutely spotlessly clean and comfortable at a very fair price this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: jlynn67
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all: Great location, large, clean rooms and helpful english speaking staff. My husband and I couldn't be more pleased with our choice of hotel in Paris. Five blocks from the Eiffel Tower and 2 blocks from Rue Cler; a great local street where we enjoyed the local atmosphere of Paris, from the Boulangerie and other shops to the restaurants. We definitely recommend this hotel! Bon Jour!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless & Friendly Value”
Reviews.Author: kbaerliny
Reviews.Content: Arriving after a transatlantic red-eye they accomodated me before noon, as soon as my room was clean, despite the 3pm check-in policy. Everything in the hotel was spotless and the beds (twins in our room) were extrememly comfortable. Typically tight spaces (but not cramped) for Paris but everything was modern and up-to-date, shower was strong (a personal pet peeve). Internet was strong and free in both the room and lobby. Location as others have written is excellent, within two blocks of both the "Ecole Militaire" and "La Tour-Maubourg" Metro Stops. Street was very quiet so sleeping with open windows was possible. During our stay, I learned that Hotel Muguet is a family business, managed with TLC by Charline who is the daughter of the owner. She and her friendly and helpful staff truly treat you as a guest, not just a customer. If back in Paris, I'll be back at the Hotel Muguet.

Reviews.Title: “Another delightful memory of my first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: chatnoir45
Reviews.Content: When I return to Paris, I will definitely try to book rooms at Hotel Muguet. The staff members were helpful, the rooms were comfortable and clean, and the location is convenient to many things a sightseer wishes to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: GMinorMan
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at HÃ´tel Muguet in September, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was clean, comfortable, and even had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. The breakfast provided was delicious. The staff was very friendly and helpful in every way. Part way through our stay, a medical emergency arose which required immediate assistance from the staff. This was provided without delay. We are already planning our next visit to HÃ´tel Muguet. This hotel is rated 3 stars but we give it 10 stars!

Reviews.Title: “We called it "home" at the end of the day.”
Reviews.Author: quilting44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Muguet for 9 nights. We spent our days walking the streets and sights of Paris and falling in love with the city. Weather was fantastic, the French were friendly, the parks were clean and beautiful, the food was fabulous and we called our hotel room "home" at the end of the day. We slept really well and would love to know what kind of mattresses and pillows you provide for our sleeping pleasure. Maybe it was the 6 or 7 miles we walked each day, maybe it was the dry air and perfect weather, maybe it was the thrill of visiting Paris, but at the end of the day, we knew we would sleep well. If we ever have the chance to visit Paris again, we will definitely return to the Hotel Muguet. We are glad to read in these reviews that the WiFi is a new set up. That was our only disappointment. It didn't work in our room most of the time. Small disappointment compared to everything else we enjoyed. Thank you for a wonderful Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a great value with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ted0825
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is close to Rue Cler, the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides and two blocks from two Metro stations. There are plenty of places to eat around there and there is also a nearby grocery store. It is on a side street and is very quiet. We stayed at this hotel as part of a trip to Paris then Normandy and back to Paris to fly home. The first week we stayed in a hotel in Paris that cost over 320 Euros a night. When we came back to Paris we stayed at the Muguet. The Muguet cost much less and it was comparible to the first hotel, but a little smaller. The staff was friendly and spoke English. The breakfast was very good with many selections. The room was small, but that is what you expect in Paris. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom was very compact but new and clean. Overall it was a very good experience and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, safe, friendly environment, affordably priced.”
Reviews.Author: LindaG60
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this small hotel to anyone visiting Paris. Great location, close to Eiffel Tower, Museums, the River, you can walk almost anywhere. Lots of cafes, restaurants and shops in the area. The owners maintain a very clean, well kept property. Breakfast spread is a great deal and offers lots of choices, including healthy foods like fruit and cereal, they will even make you an omelet. Prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Butcher.T
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and were very pleased. The rooms are small but that is the European style so don't expect large rooms. The day staff was very helpful. The location is on a very quiet street but close to the Eiffel Tower and easy walking distance to the Avenue of the Champs-Elysees, the Arch de Triump, the Place de la Concorde and the Louvre. It is a very short walk to Rue Cler. There are many places to eat just around the corner. Two excellent restaurants in the area are Leo the Lion and La Billebaude. For those it is best to make a reservation starting no earlier than 8 pm. The price was very reasonable for Paris and if you arrive early there is a secure room to leave your luggage. There is a small but nice lobby if you are traveling with friends where you can hang out with some wine and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean and location is convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Icerosetea
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for two nights and this is our first trip to Paris, although the hotel is small but it's cozy and front desk two gentlemen were efficient and courteous. The rooms were clean and bed were comfortable, we loved the bathtub and one of our room has a nice view of Eiffel Tower! We loved the location of this hotel, it's located on a quiet street but is only 5 minutes walk to rue cler and streets with lots of cafes. We walked from the hotel to musee armee and Eiffel tower and it was a convenient short walk. Overall we like this hotel very much!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Deb7111
Reviews.Content: Very well priced, clean and well located. Hotel Muguet is within minutes of the Eiffel Tower and just a few blocks from Rue Cler. It's on a small street but in the middle of everything in the 7th. Check-in was polite and friendly. Our room was on the 6th floor with a clear view of the Eiffel Tower in one direction and in the opposite direction I could see the SacrÃ©-CÅ“ur Basilica in the distance. Room size, decor, bathroom, and cleanliness were all very fine. It would be tough to find a sweeter place at that price in Paris. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy place to return to...”
Reviews.Author: Marcia4
Reviews.Content: After a day of sightseeing in Paris, coming back to the Muguet is just right. It is a small, charming hotel in the 7th near cafes and the metro with the most helpful staff. we loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value and superb location”
Reviews.Author: Pacdan
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, in the 7th Arrondissement and near two Metropolitan stops. There are a number of restaurants and shops nearby. It is within a short walk from des Invalides and the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is small but quite comfortable. The room is spacious, the bathroom clean with a shower stall. One of us found the bed hard, one perfectly fine. The staff is reserved but very helpful. When one of us had to buy for cough medicine, the staff gave directions to the nearest pharmacy, and coached us on the French vocabulary. And they were very helpful in directing us to a taxi queue when we had to get to a train station. A desktop in the lobby has full internet access and is free. The breakfast seemed expensive, but coffee is available throughout the day in the dining area and that area is available after 10:30am in case you want to bring in your own breakfast or lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Fine accommodations in Paris 7th arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: mmd1053
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Muguet is quiet and peaceful while being ideally located to take in all the important sites of the 7th arrondissement (Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Rue Cler). The staff is gracious and helpful and the breakfast (although not included in the room rate) features deliciously strong coffee and omelettes made to order. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Muguet to family and friends travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location = Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: HKR1954
Reviews.Content: I arrived in early September to Hotel Muguet where I was greeted by a very professional staff member who was a great help during my stay. My first impression was that it was modern, clean, albeit a bit smaller than the North American standard but a bit bigger than some ideas of European standards, as I found out all through my month long trip. My room was the same, and as well it was well appointed, comfortable, and very tastefully decorated. The hotel was on a side street just off of a very "hip" district on the left bank. There were many excellent sidewalk cafes and shops in the area that were so classic Paris with that beautiful architecture. The hotel was close to many attractions (less than 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower), and a subway station was just around the corner. A jump on, jump off tour bus stop was close by. I had free access to a P.C. throughout my 3 day stay and the staff were friendly, patient, and accomodating, the day staff at the desk speaking excellent English. There was a breakfast room adjoining a garden offering a standard European breakfast at an additional cost. The price was what you should expect to pay to be close to it all. This shall be the same hotel I book on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: jayelle2
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay, even though we didnt spend much time at the hotel we found it to be very clean and a pleasure to come back to at the end of each day. We stayed in the superior room (51) with a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was very clean and the bathroom was lovely so we were happy with our choice of room. We didnt have breakfast in the hotel as we found wonderful places to eat all within a few streets of the hotel. Overall we would most definately stay there again as it was in an ideal location to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelBH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, close to the subway, bus, etc. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. For a 3 star hotel and the price you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Londoner54_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet is a great find for trips to Paris. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are quite small but well furnished and spotlessly clean. Lots of coat hangers! Our room was very quiet and dark at night, making for excellent sleep. Delicious omlettes for breakfast and fabulous coffee. The staff were able to make good recommendations for local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DGaul94639
Reviews.Content: Ok, I kept forgetting to post this, While planning for our honeymoon in Paris, we came across this fantastic hotel on this site. looked at all of the reviews, starting with the negatives first, then the positives. What caught my eye on this hotel was the almost 500 reviews and 96% positive rate. However our experience was nothing short of 100% positive! From the friendly check in after a long flight, and the stress of metro during morning rush hour we were warmly greeted by the friendly staff. Check in was quick, they answered all of our questions, and even helped us practice our awful French. The rooms are small by American standards but the room had sufficient space for our stuff. The size was not a problem (had a double) but I also did not expect a massive room either. The room, bathroom, and shower were clean with no issues during out entire stay. Iâ€™m 6â€™4 and did not have any problems with the shower head or bed size. The A/C worked great and was a welcome relief after walking around all day. We slept great, with no problematic noise from the street or other guests. I did see on a few another reviews about the elevator. If you have a ton of baggage, yes the elevator is small and slow. But youâ€™re in Paris and if youâ€™re worried about the elevator, you might want to lighten up a bit. It when up, it when down, it worked! I did see several other comments about the cost of the breakfast. I canâ€™t comment on that because we didnâ€™t eat breakfast there. Something I do feel actually bad about because I wanted to try it, but because of either getting up too late from a long night, and the number of patisseries nearby we just didnâ€™t find time. However, I did have a few coffees there for the 2 euro, a much better alternative than the 5 euro espresso at nearby bars. And really the staff were truly the best part of the entire stay. Charlene, George, and especially Martin made the trip infinitely more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel:great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaLoreto
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 4 nights, it was the perfect hotel: excellente location, walking distance to the eiffel tower and trains stations, close to restaurants. The staff were very friendly , room size was reasonable and the hotel was very quiet at night so we could had a good rest; the breakfast was really good too. It's not a luxury hotel but it's a great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great View of Eiffel Tower, Convenient to Metro and Rule Cler”
Reviews.Author: Tiff1519
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a great find. I chose this hotel based on a recommendation from the Rick Steve's Paris book. It is is a great location close to Ecole Militaire, Rue Cler and the Eiffel Tower. There are 2 metro stations within close walking distance. The hotel is small but has a nice lobby, eating area and the rooms and bathrooms are quite large for Paris. The hotel has very nice historic details and the rooms are clean and the bathrooms ultra modern with high end fixtures, tile, and towel warmers. There was even a sitting room in our room. We could see the light show at the Eiffel Tower from our window at night and the price was very affordable. I would recommend to anyone looking for a quiet place to sleep in Paris. The only drawback was that the hotel staff were not very helpful but we found this to be typical for most places in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Parisian hotel with great location, rooms and staff.”
Reviews.Author: AfghanRPCV
Reviews.Content: We have stayed At the Muguet twice now and will do so again. We have sent friends there who also loved it. It is on a quiet side street near the Eiffel Tower, the Invalides and Ecole Militaire. There are lots of good restaurants and other shops nearby. It is easy to get to any part of Paris from the nearby La Tour Maubourg Metro station. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The view of the Eiffel Tour was a plus this time, but most rooms will not have this view. However, even the courtyard rooms are very light and airy due to large windows and a large courtyard space. Although small, the rooms and bathrooms are so well designed that you don't get that cramped feeling that so many hotels in this price range in Paris would give you. We were particularly grateful to the excellent and attentive staff that recommended what to do when a transit strike came on the very day of our planned TGV trip to Bordeaux. We followed their advice, our trip went off without a problem,and we were not even delayed a minute. Thank you for rescuing our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: splitwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for three nights and we were very happy with out choice. Our room was small, but we expected that. Our bed was large and comfortable and the room was very clean. We found the staff friendly and helpful and the location central and convenient to the metro. We will stay here again the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Little Hotel in a great area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Firstymer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night on our return to Paris after travelling around France. We wanted a location that was quiet and in a good area and easy to get from to the airport . The location is perfect on a quiet street but within a two block walk to the pedestrian street of Rue Cler which has all the good places to eat. Staff was friendly and helpful and there was even a computer availble for guest use in the lobby for those without their own laptops. Rooms were spotless but typical size for a Paris hotel. We had rented an apartment for 5 days at the beginning of our trip in Paris which turned out to be more expensive than Hotel Muguet! In the future we would definitely skip the apartment rental and instead use Hotel Muguet as home base.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly staff - clean, quiet and close to 2 Metro Stops”
Reviews.Author: JChaseSeattle
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via TripAdvisor and also it was mentioned in Rick Steves' "Paris 2010". Our room was on the 5th floor looking over courtyard and Invalides. Taking the stairs daily vs elevator allowed for extra pastries. Hotel and room were clean, quiet. Bathroom just the right size with the right amount of towels and hot water. The staff was friendly and helpful. They spoke English and helped us with our French. After getting lost once, the hotel was easy to find and close to two metro stops and wonderful Rue Cler. We thought we could find a better deal price wise for breakfast...but never really tried as it was convenient and tasty. If you are a big 'foodie' seeking lots of adventure in food, seek another place for breakfast. However we found meal kept us full late into afternoon. It was nice to have access to hot tea 24x7. My second visit to Paris was enjoyable and the nice & comfy hotel with nice people and good service added to the week long wonderful vacation. Wi-Fi service for personal PC as well as a computer in lobby was good to have too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but terribly Expensive”
Reviews.Author: jmmarbella
Reviews.Content: It was a clean and well located but nothing else, actually for what you pay I would say it is a poor service (except the nice protuguese man at reception) , very basic, but we realized that, although we had a wonderful time there Paris is just that, a wonderful city that rips you off all the time, and adding the not very helpful disposition of the "parisienne" people and the horrible traffic and polution in all the centre of town..........I am not sure it is the place to go for a little holiday in Europe. Cities like London, Barcelona, Lisboa, Munich, Sevilla, Edimburgh, etc, etc, etc have much more pleasant inhabitants, being exciting and much cheaper places.....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: TnT_Travels
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet was a bargain for the price. The rooms were very clean and a decent size. We were three adults in a triple room. The twin bed was separated from the main room by a wall. It gave a very nice sense of separation/privacy. We could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our room. I'm sure the rooms on higher floors had amazing views. It was a very short walk to the Eiffel Tower. The metro station was also very close. Staff was kind and helpful. Only problem was the "free wifi" which never seemed to work. They did have a computer in the lobby that could be used, though.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancyanne01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 4 nights. The room was very clean and I would describe the room as "romantic". The staff was exceptionally accommodating and everything about our stay was pleasant. The hotel is located on a small street in a quiet neighborhood, but close to sites and two Metro stations. You could walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Rue Cler market. We would definitely stay here again should we be fortunate enough to return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Hotel with great Staff”
Reviews.Author: monetsgardens
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at this Hotel. I stayed there in 2008 and returned this year to find it exactly the same. The hotel is decorated very nicely. The cleaning staff does a wonderful job as the rooms are unbelievably clean. They have Central type air conidtioning which was wonderful in August and not all hotels have air conditioning. The nice thing with this type of air conditioning is it is noise free. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The owner is often seen on site and working behind the counter. I will return again. They are also opening another hotel around the corner if you find there are no rooms available in this wonderful gem. Location is incredible with Rue Cler 2 minutes walk and the Eiffel Tour 5 five minutes walk. Two metros to choose from both within 5 mintues.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Perfect weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GillnBuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Muguet last weekend for the Bank Holiday weekend as part of the Air France A380 flight offers. Chose the hotel because of the consistant excellent reviews and was not disapointed. The Hotel is quite quirky, very French, tucked away down a small side road around the corner from the Metro, ten ish minute's walk from the Eifel Tower, local general convenience store's and a good selection of restaurants if you want to stay local. The manager and staff were very pleasant & helpful (loved Martin) and ensured everyone enjoyed their stay. The rooms are not big but very cosy, traditional but, with a modern feel & twist to them. Loved our small quirky shower room too. House keeping was tip top, absolutley spotless. Didn't have the breakie, but, seemed popular. The hotel also offers an Airport Shuttle Bus Service, we had already organised ours but, useful to know, prices about the same. Loved Paris, smashing hotel and we all will be looking to revisit. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel. Nice location. No view of Eiffel tower :(”
Reviews.Author: llsimms
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Staff was pleasant. They keep your key when you go out. La Terrase restaurant( close by) was great for breakfast while people watching . Lots of good places were closed due to vacations. We booked a triple and read on the web site that it came with a view of the Eiffel tower but our room did not. Jet lag prevented us from being too concerned as they did have a room open very early in the morning for us. But it bears mentioning for others. Great location to Metro. We felt safe. They don't allow eating in the room. A glass room was for breakfast or other time use when not used for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for First Time Visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: ilir11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved hotel Muguet. It was very easy to get to from the airport via public transportation. Check-in was a breeze, and the staff was very polite and helpful. I talked to four different front desk clerks, and they were super friendly, and patiently directed me to where I wanted to go. (It might have helped that I spoke to them in French) The room was very clean, and up to par with North American standards. Very nicely furnished. The bathroom was very clean. The shower was great. The flat screen tv, was quite nice to watch world cup matches, and to catch up on the news. The location was perfect. Real short walk to tons of restaurants and Rue Cler market stands. Very near the Eiffel Tour. We would go once in the morning and once in the evening just to admire this Parisian symbol. Also short walking distance to Napoleon's tomb monument and the military museum. Near two or three Metro stations. The free internet in the lobby is also quite useful, as we didn't feel like carrying our laptop on vacation. The only two minor negative things. No ice. I guess this is considered luxury in Paris. Maybe they lost the recipe... And there is a strange rule that you cannot bring food to your room. We did anyway, but it was something strange to see, and wondered how they could enforce it. Overall, great spot, great experience. This hotel, helped make our first trip to Paris a very pleasant one. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: Sunbeam73
Reviews.Content: After reading so many positive reviews about the Hotel Muguet, I was looking forward to experiencing what many travellers had received. However, I was a little disappointed. What was good: The location of the hotel is great! The cleanliness of the room was very good. What could have been better: I received a very lukewarm reception when I arrived. If you wanted to know anything, do not expect the hotel to be pro-active. You need to make the effort to ask. (Which is a shame, as it should be the other way around; as I'm sure they have a wealth of information to share). As referenced in other reviews the bathroom in my room was TINY! And I mean very, very small. In fact, so much so that the toilet seat nearly touched the door of the shower cubicle. It was a good job the shower doors opened away from you. In fact, there was so little room, that I had to dry myself off in the bedroom. Be aware that the hotel taxi service to CDG (costing 15 Euros) is 'subject to availability' - which is not stated on the promotional material. When I enquired the day before I was due to travel, the service was already full. Due to the above, the hotel kindly booked me a normal taxi to take me to the Roissy Bus stop. Please be aware - the total journey time of only 8 minutes (it was 6am), cost me just over 15 Euros which is super expensive. Sadly, the hotel never advised me how much this short trip would have cost me. At breakfast time, all of the tables were dirty and someone had to clean one for me. Also, no one really took the time to explain to me how the breakfast system worked. Breakfast was 'OK' though and the fresh coffee was very good! The free WIFI didn't work at all on the second day of my stay and I found that when it did work it was very temperamental. When I went downstairs to reception to ask why the WIFI wasn't working, I received a reply of 'it's not working for me too', which I thought was a little unprofessional, as he wasn't a paying guest. So overall, I didn't feel that the hotel really did itself any justice on my visit, which is a shame, as I had read so many good reviews. However, I will only recommend the hotel to my family and friends on the basis of its location and the cleanliness of the room. I suppose, you pay for what you get. I got a promotional rate which was good value for money; however, I just wish the service would have been a little bit friendlier and advice more forthcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: comefromaway2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower which is great in terms of visiting the tower and all other sites. It was also a good location in terms of Ryanair flights. I flew to Paris from Venice on Ryanair, so the bus from Beauvais airport dropped us off at Port Maillot. It was late at night so I decided to get a cab to the hotel and it was very close, it cost me about 10 Euro. I bought the breakfast option with this hotel which for me was a very good choice. I'm someone who needs coffee ASAP in the morning and can't function without it, so the thought of wandering around Paris looking for a decent cafe to get a coffee was not appealing. This allowed me to have a great breakfast and as many coffee refills as I wanted before I started my day (and given that coffee was about 4 euro for just one cup everywhere, the 11 euro breakfast was a great deal for me). My room was very nice, very clean, very comfortable and there was a computer for guests use. The staff were all very nice, and helpful. All in all, breakfast included I ended up paying about $550 (canadian) for 4 nights, which in Paris, I think is quite good value. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: rak_75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 3 nights, in a room facing a very small garden, near the breakfast area. It was a very nice room with character and having the garden just outside my door added to its charm. However, the location was the best part -- it was excellent. Very close to the Eiffel Tower, Musee Rodin, metro station on a line that will take you everywhere, walkable to the Seine, Musee D'Orsay... endless other cultural attractions. I walked everywhere to/from here -- including from Notre Dame Cathedral, through the Latin Quarter -- it was all so convenient. The breakfast too was fairly nice, particularly relative to breakfast offered at other hotels I stayed at. However, the free internet in the lobby was frustratingly slow but at least it was free, unlike at one other hotel I stayed at in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the memories (from 2007)”
Reviews.Author: tikinca
Reviews.Content: Returned to enjoy the hospitality of Catherine and her staff with group of friends including 6 month old. The staff are courteous and helpful. They go out of their way to give you information and tips. The rooms are small, but clean and well appointed. It is close to everything. Altogether a wonderful experience. Breakfast is extra but good value. Also close to Rue Cler with lots of grocers, bakeries, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: tbmoorefield
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet was a great choice for our stay in Paris. The hotel was quaint, service was excellent, rooms were clean, staff spoke English better than us, and the Rue Cler neighborhood surrounding the hotel was the perfect place to escape some of the busyness of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arty1963
Reviews.Content: Had a few days in Paris after a family visit in Limoge, my brother and I enjoyed the quiert well appointed rooms in Hotle Muguet. They solved a booking problem (not their fault at all) we had, and took care of transport for us. I can only recomend Hotel Muguet, when in 7 arr.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barbkeeg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going on a River Boat Cruise and wanted a hotel to stay in for a few days in Paris prior to our trip. The Hotel Muguet was charming and well appointed, and our room was attractively decorated and comfortable. The Left Bank location was perfect for visiting the Eiffel Tower and was convenient to shopping and dining. We highly recommend Hotel Muguet and think it was very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: CaribGuy14
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, the staff is friendly and the hotel looks very nice. But some comments are: The breakfast - this can be upgraded a lot. Cold boiled eggs, no plate, bread is very hard (dry-out) and you have to eat from a catering plate. Not very hygienic, but the price of the breakfast was ok. The fake plant was very, very, and very full of dust, but cleaned after my complain. The rooms are very small (like the hole hotel, small lift/elevator), even the superior room which is described as large..., is very small. I like the safe in the room, also the decoration of the room is great and beautifull. Free Wifi-internet or wired, but very slow. The computer in the lobby has a French keyboard, hard to use, but it is free. It's the breakfast why I won't return to this hotel or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: schoentagb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located whether you choose to walk to the Eiffel Tower, Hotel des Invalides, numerous cafes or city transportation. We were greated in a very friendly manner by the hotel staff all of who spoke English wonderfully. There is a computer available in the lobby for use,which was helpful for my teenage daughter as the wi-fi was a little spotty (but we were on the 5th floor) The rooms are small, although we were aware that was the case for most Paris hotels, but they were cute and very clean. (could be partially because eating in the room is not allowed) There was a shuttle to the CDG available which was wonderful (and inexpensive) I would not recommend the hotel breakfast as it was pricey for what you receive-11 euro per person.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: joni123
Reviews.Content: I was firstly, impressed by the quick response I received from the Hotel when I made my inquiries, and then when I made the reservation. The front desk was friendly and effiecient. Our room was one of the best we had had on our whole trip through Wales, Scotland and France. Joan Howard Victoria BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, and service!”
Reviews.Author: scrunchy
Reviews.Content: I arrived early and was able to check my bags and start touring Paris until my room was ready. When I checked in I was surprised how nice my room was. The room was attractive, comfortable, and the bathroom was large. Staff provided me with a map and called for a taxi when I requested. The location is great. Within walking distance to many Paris sights. The Rue Clear was a great market street with many food options. I really liked the neighborhood feeling in this area.

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: mzsunnyblonde
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband and I have stayed at this hotel. This time we were there for 6 nights in a superior room. The room is clean and the bathroom is quite modern - although it was a bit awkward having the shower head as a hand held rather than attached to the wall. The first night my bed (we had two twins pushed together as a King) was uncomfortable and lower than my husband's side. I mentioned this at the desk and it was rectified for the following night and much more comfortable. We had room 62 which had a view of the Eiffel tour. Our previous stay we had the other room on the 6th floor with a view of the tour per our request. This time we did not request it so it was an added bonus. The ceiling sloped which made it hard for my 6'1" to walk in parts. Perhaps the 5th floor would have been better but I have not seen those rooms so cannot say for certain. Also the elevator (lift) only goes to the 5th floor so there is a flight of stairs to deal with - not a problem for us as we do not take more luggage than we can carry. Breakfast is ample and costs 11 euros each. We actually found it was too much food for us so grabbed a pain au chocolate at the lovely bakery (with opera cake to die for!) en route to the metro. All in all, we will be back and have recommended this hotel to many friends. One added feature for us is that by staying here you feel more part of the neighbourhood than if we were staying in a chain hotel. We quickly learned our way around the area which really made for a more pleasant vacation - in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place”
Reviews.Author: gwhizrd
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Muguet. It's a nice little gem and is definitely our Paris address.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint cozy and friendly home away from home”
Reviews.Author: YVRproud
Reviews.Content: A special thank you to Catherine and her staff for making our 8 night stay very comfortable and memorable. Our queen size bed and room was very clean and well appointed. I had trouble with the electrical outlets as my adapter did not fit so check your unit prior to departure. The daily breakfast offered in the breakfast room was a fabulous deal for 13 euros per person. The location of this hotel is fabulous and very close to the Metro, great cafes and restaurants and even the Eiffel Tower. Air conditioning was a god send during a few hot Paris days. The elevator or lift was key for heavy luggage. Appreciated the hotel internet but had to wait in line on several occasions as teens and young travellers spent alot of time on facebook. Perhaps this could be monitored somehow. A laundra mat is close by for long stay clients. Appreciated this non smoking hotel. Odd that food was not allowed in rooms. Some staff were better than others at helping with travel needs, restaurant recommendations and directions. The hotel recommended shuttle service to the airport was very convenient and efficient. Would definitely stay again and recommend to family and friends. Very good value. Book ahead as this is a popular hotel. Merci Catherine!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what other reviewers said it would be...”
Reviews.Author: ssparkyg
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this gem of a hotel near the Eiffel Tower in July and were very pleased with the quality of this property. Our room was larger than I expected and the air conditioner worked very well and quietly. We did not take advantage of the breakfast (additional cost) because there were many cafes close by. (Rue Cler is very near by.) This is a classic old building property with clean rooms. I would difinitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A true Paris find: A lovely little hotel in a quiet, convenient neighborhood at a great price”
Reviews.Author: ACalGal
Reviews.Content: The Muguet delivers nice rooms and bathrooms with pleasant, fresh, tasteful decor and thoughtful, useful touches in all the right places. We are world travelers with a broad spectrum of hotel experiences, including Swiss five-star hotels, and we would stay here at the Muguet again in a heartbeat. Every three star hotel in the world should be this pleasant! Not all rooms have Eiffel views, but ours did -- a big treat. The bathroom with deep bathtub was fresh, well-organized and very pleasant. Rooms are roomier than at other Paris three-stars, and are well-appointed so that they don't seem cramped. We loved that the entire hotel was non-smoking. The air-conditioning kept things very comfortable, even in the muggy heat of summer. The beds were a delight to sleep in. The Muguet's service staff can be a bit grumpy and snooty at times and the night staff is not well informed with appropriate dining recommendations, but otherwise this place is a total find. Fabulous! Note that breakfast here is only so-so. For the price, you may wish to go elsewhere in the neighborhood for your morning coffee and croissant.

Reviews.Title: “place to stay if you're over 80 and don't want to have any fun”
Reviews.Author: NjMomandaughter
Reviews.Content: We were three sisters and assorted adult children (mostly male). The reception we received when we arrived at the hotel was cool to put it kindly. There were no smiles, there was no warm welcome, and there was a lot of annoyance with questions we asked. Our sons range in age from 19 to 26 and there were 5 of them. Apparently, the hotel does not wish to have young, lively people staying with them. Wish we had known that before we booked.....instead, once we arrived we were told that it was a "quiet hotel" and made to feel that talking at normal decibel level was just too loud. Eventually, we felt that we were walking on eggshells and whispering was as loud as we should speak. We couldn't stay together in a room to talk because the people around us told us we were too loud. We couldn't sit in the lobby to talk because - you guessed it - too loud. How do 9 people talk quietly??? (honestly- no one was shouting, but we were not dead....because that would probably have been quiet enough for them....) We were on a family vacation and were not able to hang out together in the hotel as a family. Not that we wanted to have a party - just a few glasses of wine and sharing stories about our day. It was a huge disappointment to be treated as the 'ugly Americans' when we were paying for 4 rooms for two nights. We are used to being treated much better in most hotels (believe me, we are NOT demanding- we tend to be afraid to ask for anything....). As for the rooms - they were noisy (NOT from our noise since we had been silenced)- the first night I heard the people above me up all night stomping around. The rooms were tiny as well. They were acceptable for a European hotel. We had stayed in several other hotels in Italy and had never been treated as rudely. I believe the reception staff would have been much happier if we had stayed somewhere else - and so would we......it was a disappointment....so many more incidents to add to this but I think you get the picture....

Reviews.Title: “Complete Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MarieClaireetKarl
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I picked Hotel Muguet for our stay in Paris. Very charming, perfect location -- five minute walk to Les Invalides, two minutes to the touristy Rue Cler. Very quiet....barely any street traffic. Lovely room, comfy bed. The AC was much appreciated after a long day of taking in museums and so much walking. The staff was really the best -- professional and friendly. It's not easy to choose a hotel by looking online -- I chose Hotel Muguet based on ratings from other travelers. So glad I did! My husband and I are looking forward to our next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to see Paris in a whirlwind!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole218
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here for 6-29-2010 to 7-1-2010 prior to heading off to Barcelona to go on a Mediterranean cruise. Our flight got in aorund 11am and we were at the hotel by noon. Despite being early, our room was ready. We had a large corner room and had a magnificent view of the Eiffel Tower. We were able to walk to to the Tower in about 10 minutes, and there are 2 metro stops near the hotel. It is within walking distance to Les Invalides and La Rue Cler is right around the corner, with wonderful cafes and boulangeries. Had fresh crepes or croissants every morning for breakfast on Rue Cler. The room was clean, and large for what I expected in Europe. Only thing was bed was a little hard for our liking, but you canÂ´t please everyone in that department. Free WiFi was nice too. Quiet in the hotel and surrounding area. Would hope to stay here again if we make it back to Paris someday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet, comfy, accommodating, easy, and an appealing neighborhood location”
Reviews.Author: dkgsh
Reviews.Content: Our family was very comfortable at the Hotel Muguet and would definitely stay there again. Our triple (a true triple with a comfortable extra bed) with the Eiffel Tower view was roomy, clean and comfortable - hard to beat at any price. The neighborhood was appealing, convenient, and quiet, in the shadow of several major sites. For breakfast eaters the large fresh buffet is fairly priced. For the others, there are several options, including Le Notre, around the corner. As we needed to do laundry there (the public laundrymat is not far from the hotel), I had the privilege of wandering around the neighborhood aimlessly for a couple of hours, and the typically dreaded vacation task became a joy! We also very much appreciated the welcoming and very helpful staff, who cheerfully helped us resolve a few travel snags.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel located on a quite street near Rue Cler and Tour Effiel”
Reviews.Author: mrfootball2008
Reviews.Content: Great location with shops and restaurants nearby. A quite street perfect for resting after a busy day touring the city. Close to the Metro. Rooms were clean, staff was freindly and spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Muguet in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DnKseetheworld
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in France and a week in Italy. We stayed at Hotel Muguet for three nights. It was a peaceful place to stay with a great location - very close to restaurants and shopping and the Metro. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Property With Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: n520964
Reviews.Content: All the amenities looked brand new. Exceptionally clean and well appointed. The staff is what really makes this a wonderful place to stay. They are extremely friendly and accomodating and will do anything they can to make your stay pleasant and enjoyable. I will stay at this hotel every time I go to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ozitravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quiet street in the 7th arrondissement and is walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. It is a couple of blocks from the Ecole Militaire Metro station and buses are in the next street. It is also handy to Rue Cler, a very French suburban shopping area consisting of typical French delicacies such as a Fromagerie and Chocolaterie. The reception area is always staffed and most staff speak good English. Rooms are a reasonable size and very clean with a room safe, phone and TV. The bed was a genuine double and very comfortable. Breakfast is available for 11 Euro which is probably OK for Paris but a little high compared to other hotels where we stayed in France. The TV has CNN and BBC but the BBC channel wasn't receiving very well. There is free wi fi including the free use of a desk top computer in the lobby. Reception assisted with restaurants and directions to Monet's Gardens as well as to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Glad We Chose Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: AlohaJudy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Muguet for five nights and agree wholeheartedly with California86 information. We arrived before check in time, and they held our luggage at no cost Would just add: If you want a full breakfast (cereal, yogurt, fruit, eggs), we found the hotel's price of 12 Euros right in line with local restaurants. Location very safe and short walk to metro or cab. Coincidently, we had the same experience with Paris Shuttle being a no show. Charline at Hotel Muguet took over and got Paris Shuttle to provide a cab. She was a real advocate for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: California86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 13 nights in Summer 2010. We recommend it highly. The hotel is located on a fairly quiet small side street only a couple of blocks away from a Metro station, so it was very easy to get to wherever we wanted to go in Paris. Further, Rue Cler, a restaurant row made famous by Rick Steveâ€™s Paris travel guide, is about three blocks away. There are many other great places to eat in the area as well, plus at least three grocery stores and several bakeries, cafes, and fruit stands located within 3 or 4 blocks or the hotel. (We generally avoided the expensive hotel breakfast, opting instead for a roll from a bakery and some orange juice and fruit from local shops each morning.) Finally, a 10 minute walk gets you to the Eiffel Tower. So the location is very definitely a plus. As for the hotel itself, we would definitely recommend Hotel Muguet. Our room was relatively small, but very clean, well-equipped (including Free WiFi), and quite comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and convenient, and we especially appreciated the excellent lighting over the head of the bed, which allowed for late night reading without disturbing oneâ€™s sleeping partner. The staff was always professional, courteous, and, when approached, helpful with tourist questions. Staff members arranged reservations for side trips, and one of the night staff spent quite a bit of his time one evening setting up a WiFi connection on my uncooperative laptop. Paris Shuttle picked us up at the airport, but when they failed to show for the return, hotel staff made numerous phone calls on our behalf and, as time grew short, ultimately ran out and secured a taxi for us. Overall, our stay was very smooth, and we have no complaints at all about our accommodations. We would definitely stay at Hotel Muguet again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful; convenient, comfortable, extremely clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: traveler945
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful, extremely clean, comfortable with a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. It is close to the metro, near many restaurants, Rue Cler, yet is quiet and serene. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially since they speak English. Highly recommend to all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and great location”
Reviews.Author: rrvzarn
Reviews.Content: My husband and teenage son travel stayed at the Hotel Muguet ealier this month and we were very pleased. The place is a bit small but very comforable. We had a triple room that was perfect for us. Large bed and sofa-bed. Bathroom was very clean and fresh towels very day. Breakfast included fresh baguettes, croissants, cereal, fruit, juice, cheeses, ham, eggs and yogurt. Breakfast was served in a cute, glassed enclosed courtyard. The hotel is located near the Eiffle Tower and a metro stop. There are lots of restaurants and shops on the main street. Near Rue Claire (a great, no traffice street with lots of shops, cafes and markets. The staff speaks English and they have free Internet for those of us that use Facebook.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable. Made the trip easy. Overall a good value.”
Reviews.Author: saranetizen
Reviews.Content: My traveling partner is recovering from a serious illness, so we chose our hotels with the specific hope that they would be comfortable enough to rest in, even during the day if necessary. Hotel Muguet more than met our requirements. It was quiet, tastefully decorated, effectively air-conditioned, spotlessly clean, and the staff were very helpful. This isn't a traveling-adventure hotel -- the area is quite touristy, and we heard mostly English spoken in the lobby. This is for folks who want to venture out during the day and have a soft spot in which to land when they tire out. My partner adds that the bed and pillows were unusually comfortable for a hotel, that those over 6 feet tall will find the shower a bit small, and that for those travelers who need a little protein with their breakfast, the hotel breakfast was a good value -- if you ask, the breakfast attendant will make you an egg and cheese omelet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities, efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: vagaSanFrancisco_CA
Reviews.Content: We were group of 7. My family of 3 adults stayed in triple room at 185 Euros. Other couples stayed in double rooms. At check in, reception was cool (not warm, friendly as Iâ€™d anticipated based on other reviews) but efficient.. We were able to check in early which was a definite plus. We stayed in triple room on 3rd floor (4th by American standards). Room was larger than I expected and extremely efficient. A good amount of closet space and very efficient use of space in bathrooms. Toiletries were included and sufficient towels for family of 3. The room was spotlessly clean. Beds have firm mattresses, with the single bed being even firmer. A little getting used to, but okay, free WiFi available in room and free Internet Access via computer in lobby. This is a small hotel, so the hallways are narrow and on the dark side. There is a small elevator for weary feet at day's end.. Their luggage room is small, so it would have been hard to fit luggage for a large party if a room was not available early. The hotel is on quiet street leading to main avenues, so itâ€™s very quiet at night. Great location near Rue Cler and other eateries, Eiffel Tower and metro. Best cafÃ© au lait I ever had was in eatery next door to Cafe du Marche on Rue Cler. Patisserie on Rue Cler was the best. My daughter bought baguette daily and carried under her arm throughout day. Although I did not find the weekend staff particularly friendly, they were not rude and did respond to my needs for ironing clothing items (I ironed in basement) and calling a cab. I would not hesitate to stay here again, although I would also be open to staying at other nearby properties with similar amenities and pricing. The weather was a little cold/rainy for June, but we still had a wonderful time. We found Parisians, in general, very welcoming and kind (something we had not expected, but were delighted to experience).

Reviews.Title: “So clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: horo_kiwis
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights here as part of our honeymoon and after hearing so many horror stories about hotels in Paris we were thrilled with this place. The rooms weren't massive, but were very clean (towels and bed linen changed daily) , the bed was really comfortable and the bathroom newly renovated and pristine. The shower had a big rose head which was lovely. We were on the second floor so had no view of the Eiffel Tower but this didn't matter as it is only a 5 minute walk to the Champs de Mars where there is a fantastic view, especially at night. We found it so handy for the Metro, the RER train (which we took to Versailles) and for local restaurants and shops. Would definitely stay here again, i think the only thing we missed was tea/coffee facilities in the rooms, however coffee is available at the reception. We had breakfast most mornings in the hotel as you could eat as much as you liked and we found it lasted us all day! Check in was the fastest we have ever experienced!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay, Wonderful Staff, Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Middy
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at this hotel, and I would definitely stay there again. Great location, great staff, very clean. From the minute you walk in the door, you are greeted with a smile and service that is definitely 5 star all the way. From the reception, to the ladies who take care of your rooms, to the ladies who serve you breakfast. Rooms are small, but then this is Paris. We could see some of the Eiffel Tower from our room. Breakfasts are great, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, lots of croissants and baguettes, cheese, fresh coffee, cold cuts. They will make you omelettes all with fresh ingredients. This is all served in a very nice area just off the lobby. Great restaurants in the area. My husband and I walk everywhere, the Eiffel tower is about a 12 minute walk. Special story to tell, my husband lost a very special ring, the day we were leaving to come home. Called the hotel from the airport and the lady who cleaned our room found the ring.and handed it in to reception The hotel sent the ring to us via post. We received the ring within 8 days. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris. Honesty, good service, pleasant, cleanliness, what else can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the City Of Light...”
Reviews.Author: JourneyThruTheLens
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and I picked the perfect hotel! The Muguet is a quaint, clean and professionally run hotel. The staff are wonderful! My room was very clean, quiet and functional. A comforting retreat after a long day of urban hiking. When I return to Paris, I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the pirce”
Reviews.Author: irinmike
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in Paris that is quiet but yet central. Metro is within easy walking distance. Close by shopping and food available as well as a laundromat. I would not hesitate to stay again. Rooms are a bit small, but beds are extremely comfortable. Breakfast for the price is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Back again to Muguet”
Reviews.Author: Autresejour
Reviews.Content: My 5th or 6th trip back to Hotel Muguet. Still an excellent value,an excellent location close to 2 metro stations, comfortable rooms, and a pleasant professional staff. Catherine has purchased another hotel down the street (Hotel de la Emperatriz) and they are completely renovating it.Should be ready late Fall 2010. Catherines daughter is pretty much in charge of Muguet during the renovation of the new hotel. I continue to give Muguet (french word for lily of the valley flower) a top rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Quantico
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my second stay at Hotel Muguet. It is quiet, clean and convenient to many of the main sites. We were able to walk to the Eiffel Tower, Napolean's Tomb and a boat ride on the Seine. The rooms were (we had 3 rooms) good size, comfortable and quiet. The staff at the desk were helpful. Breakfast was 11 euros extra but offered more than rolls and coffee. My grandson (24) had everything he needed to start the day-yougurt, cereal, fruit and coffee. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience at the end of a month long trip through Europe”
Reviews.Author: Advenchar
Reviews.Content: This hotel just made everything easy, from check-in all the way through to check out. The room was spotlessly clean, the staff were extremely pleasant. The location was ideal, not only were we close to most of the attractions (the Eiffel Tower was maybe a 10 minute walk away) but it was quite and restful as well. We had planned on having a picnic our last night there at the Eiffel Tower, however it started to rain heavily, the hotel allowed us to use the breakfast room for our picnic, showing us where we could find the utensils and other items we might have needed. It was a very pleasant experience after a long month and many different hotels throughout Europe. I would have to say one of my most enjoyable experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel with great Value”
Reviews.Author: bagdadjeff
Reviews.Content: The Muguet is a nice and well-managed hotel nearby the DÃ´me des Invalides. It is in a very quiet neighborhood; the staff is very friendly. Our room was small (and we didn't need a bigger one anyway) but clean and convenient. In contrast to many other hotels in Paris, room rates are very reasonable. Only the breakfast could be cheaper. But then again: in Paris you will find a nice cafÃ© or brasserie just around every corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: JennC_12345
Reviews.Content: This was a clean, reasonably priced hotel in the heart of the city. Five minute walk to the metro, ten minutes or so to the Eiffel Tower. The walls were not the paper-thin ones Paris is known for. We could hear people in the morning, but it wasn't overwhelming. The hotel is on a side street, and very quiet as a result. The staff was friendly & spoke English well. Our only disappointment was the night the fire alarm went off twice for no apparent reason. Other than that, it was a great pick and I'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad weather!”
Reviews.Author: ATLgirl37
Reviews.Content: I recently got back from my first trip to Paris along with my sister and aunt. We stayed at Hotel Muguet and thought it was perfect for our interests. The hotel is on a quiet street and the staff are all very friendly and helpful even when your French is horrible like mine! The room was actually bigger than I had expected and the 3 of us all had our own twin bed and there were extra pillows and blankets already in the room along with enough space for the clothes of 3 women. The bathroom was our favorite, we all loved the updated look of it and the rain shower head! There are plenty of cafes around and 2 metro stops within a few minutes walk. You are only a 10 min walk from the Eiffel tower. There are several other attractions/museums within walking distance depending on how much you want to walk. There is the most wonderful pastry shop just around the corner that we grabbed pastries from almost every day! The wine shop next door is also very good if you catch it open, they will even chill a bottle of champagne for you in 5 minutes while you wait! The only con I can come up with is the 1 computer for use in the lobby was almost always occupied, but they did have free Wi-Fi which was a plus so I just checked stuff on my Ipod touch! I would definitely recommend staying here and would stay here again, too bad the cold weather wasn't as wonderful as our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in the 7th”
Reviews.Author: SharonInParis
Reviews.Content: I love the Hotel Muguet! Been here before, things have gotten even better with the renovation of the bathrooms and furniture. Nice size room (single), really comfortable bed, great upgraded bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bax_Delmar
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the single rooms for a week. The room is tiny, but very cozy and well laid out. Keeping things organized in the large wardrobe and not lying all over the room helped manage the tight space. Beautiful bathroom also tiny but immaculate and functional. Rainhead shower was a great treat. Most of the staff was very nice. Breakfast was very good, but so is heading out to Rue Cler and checking out the various markets and cafes in the neighborhood. It was a great place to return to after a day of sightseeing. Very restful and safe. At $110 euros per night I thought it was a great value. I would definately go back. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: cqtexas
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the help finding this great hotel. It is extremely clean and the rooms have AC and a shower. The staff was helpful. Great location about a block or two from the metro. We slept with the windows open and it was very quiet. It is a bit pricey, but worth the comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Muguey is more than OK”
Reviews.Author: green_stripes
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Muguey is a very nice budget stay. Pluses: good area, attractive and clean hotel. Cons: tiny rooms, hotel prohibits eating food in the rooms, a solo room key that must be turned in to the desk each day which can be awkward when 2 people are sharing a room, and some noise on the lower levels from the interior breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nukelal00sh
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet is locate about a 3 minute walk to two different metro stations, a 2 minute walk from the festive Rue Cler, and a 12 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is close to everything but very quiet and peaceful during the nighttime--unlike some other hotels in the Rue Cler area. The staff is generally helpful (though the night staff seemed to be more willing to assist than the day staff who seemed busy) and they made sure that we were comfortably situated. The WIFI was the best we encountered on our trip to Europe and the rooms are average for Paris size-wise, but extremely comfortable with nice beds and a terrific bathroom. Our only complaints were that the pillows on the bed were horrible and we could not get our thermostat set the way we liked--turned out not to be an issue as the weather was very nice and we spent most of the visit with the windows open. I am confident that if we had needed to use the thermostat the staff would have readily assisted us. After staying at Hotel Muguet I do not think I would ever stay at another hotel in Paris. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in the 7th”
Reviews.Author: cattivojo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Muguet 11 Rue de Chevert in the 7th district of Paris May 2 - 6th. We were a group of 6 and so we had 3 rooms, all for 145 euro/night. All three rooms were great and one (#53) had a view of the Eiffel Tower, gorgeous when it was lit at night. The hotel is wonderful. Lovely rooms, great baths with rainfall shower heads, beautiful common areas, pretty garden breakfast rooms. The owner and staff are friendly, helpful, knowledgeable. Easy walking distance to metro stops, the Rue Cler area, Eiffel Tower, and some fabulous restaurants. The breakfast for 11 euro was great and they are happy to make an omelet if you like. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: KtownHK
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is very helpful from check in to check out, whether its navigating the Paris metro or getting a taxi, they are there for you. This is more like a family run hotel. Rooms are clean, spacious, quiet and bathroom is very modern. Location cannot be beat, with wonderful restaurants (Le Florimond! ), cafes, post office, grocery, bookstore and metro stop all within 2 blocks of this quaint area. Not to mention the Eiffel Tower and Champs De Mars park and Ecole Militaire...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. Nothing but charm and a wonderful experience from this visit. We were even given an upgrade on our room. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful gem in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: nomadshan
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed and well run by friendly staff, Hotel Muguet is a great place to stay. Our 5th-floor room facing Rue Chevert had 2 huge windows with a view of the Eiffel Tower, a very comfortable bed, and beautiful bathroom. The wi-fi worked perfectly, as did the in-room safe. We didn't use the TV or take breakfast at the hotel -- we were too eager to get out into the city since we had just one day's layover between flights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet - Lovely boutique hotel in a charming neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: DCDaveBrad
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 15-year-old daughter, my parents, and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Muguet April 5 - 11. We were delighted with the hotel and the neighborhood. The staff is pleasant and knowledgeable. Our triple room (#41) was surprisingly spacious in comparison to other places we have stayed in Paris. Even more important, the room was immaculate every day.
