A small alcove contained a twin bed for our daughter, and she welcomed the bit of privacy it afforded her. The view of the Eiffel Tower from our window was icing on the cake. My parents' standard room also was lovely and reasonable in size. The bathrooms in both rooms were modern and well appointed. What raises this hotel to elite status in our book is the neighborhood...it's pretty much perfect. Central location (two blocks from Ecole Militaire, Champ de Mars, and Invalides), residential neighborhood (quiet at night), easy access to two Metro stations, a short walk to the Seine and the Saint Germain des Pres area, and a half-block over to avenue La Motte Picquet, where you'll find numerous great places to eat and drink. Also from La Motte Picquet you can access one of Paris' great market streets, Rue Cler, not five minutes from the Muguet's front door. Favorites on avenue La Motte Picquet included Pain et Chocolat, a little patisserie where we started nearly every morning with tea and fresh breads and croissants. We ended our sightseeing each day at Home in Paris, a little bar/restaurant just around the corner from the hotel where the cocktails are excellent (who knew you could find a good margarita in Paris?!) and the food was delicious. At the end of the street that intersects with the Place d'Ecole Militaire, you'll find several casual bistros, including the very fun, very laidback Cafe des Officiers. The wait staff is friendly and the crowd is young and happy. The menu is basic bistro fare, but the quality is excellent and the lemon tarts are killer! The Hotel Muguet is the perfect mix of well-appointed rooms, quality service, great location, and excellent value. I can't imagine staying anywhere else when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Comfortable, Friendly Staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: djs04
Reviews.Content: While the room was small, it was a very charming room, and when you opened the window you see the top of the Eiffel tower. The beds were comfortable. The staff was friendly and accommodating and helped us to try and improve our limited french. The hotel was located on a small street but a 5 minute walk to metro. Also located 5 minutes from Rue Cler, which had all kinds of restaurants, and shops. It was probably a 15 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. The elevator was very small, and me my friend had to make separate trips, because both of us and our luggage wouldn't both fit, but that was that a minor inconvenience I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a good hotel conveniently located to a metro, for a reasonable price. The hotel also had free wi-fi which I found to be very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good sleep in a very convient & quiet location”
Reviews.Author: retired-ready-to-go
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of Rue Clair, the Eiffel tower, Ecole Militaire and 2 Metro stops on a quiet side street, we considered Hotel Muguet to be the perfect place to stay for 5 nights in Paris. Rooms were clean & seemed spacious, bathrooms fully equipped, beds were cozy & the windows opened. Seemed like an excellent value for us. The elevator is small, but they have one! Martin, the night clerk, was so helpful suggesting nearby restaurants and even answering our questions about maneuvering the Metro/train connection to Versailles. We found all his suggestions to be excellent. Breakfast, available at an additional cost, was an expanded continental with crosaunts, fresh bauguetts, boiled eggs, cold meats, cheese, cold cereal, etc.

Reviews.Title: “New Sister”
Reviews.Author: Laidback14
Reviews.Content: Before we started renting apts. we stayed many times at l'Hotel Muguet and fell in love with its cleanliness, constant up-grading and service...to the point that we became friends with the Pelletier family and now place our family and friends there when they visit Paris. The news is that Mme Pelletier has just bought the well located, but a bit rundown, Hotel 'Empereur a block down the street across from Les Invalides and has begun upgrading it starting with insisting on the level of cleanliness she has always demanded at Le Muguet. For you Muguet / 7th arrondissement fans who find it difficult to afford the prices at Le Muguet, you now have a lower priced option.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: tootsie12
Reviews.Content: Went on Spring break based on a recommendation from my dentist. The staff was terrific and very helpful. They really seemed to enjoy us visiting. The hotel is located walking distance form the Invalids and ture to the 15 min walk to the Eiffel tower which we walked to several times. The street is quiet and the hotel very clean. Lots of places to eat and shop with good transportation options in many directions. If you ever needed anything answered or were lost we found everyone including strangers very helpful. We can hardly wait until our next vist and this would be our first choice. We had a triple room which we found to be plently big considering reviews we read about hotels in Europe and our bathroom was a comfortable size and did I mention clean. We found the breakfast fully satisfying and it was priced very reasonable for the Euro $$. We liked that we could have as much coffee unlimited since for example a small cup of coffee was 4.00 euors = $5.48 US at the restaurants. It's optional but I would recommend it since if your day was full of sites like ours it held us over with a snack during the day until dinner at night. I work in the transportation industry so I live in hotels and the Muguet possesed everything I consider to be home away from home! Loved it! Southwest Airline Employee Dallas TX

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel.. fabulous area”
Reviews.Author: laj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Muguet last September and I loved it. The rooms were quaint, and clean. Martin the nightman was great company and full of friendly conversation. The area is perfect for getting around Paris. The Metro stop is only a few minutes walk and the FANTASTIC Le Florimond restaurant is right around the corner. Make sure to have the Creme Brulee. This was a fabulous and truly French experience. Make sure to go to the Cafe Centrel on Rue Cler. Their chicken risotto was to die for! Also... if you walk straight down Rue Cler right to the end.. you'll smell the lovely bakery on the right, before you see it. The best hotel and area I've stayed at in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Seatizen_Pete
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading favourable reviews here on tripadvisor. Staff were friendly and welcoming. We were upgraded on arrival to a superior room that even had a view of the Eiffel tower - the top of it at least. The room was very spacious, with lots of storage space, a small sitting area with a table and sofa and a large bathroom with a full size bath. The bed was huge and comfortably solid. Free Wi-Fi throughout was very reliable and a real bonus. While temperatures were constanly sub-zero outside, the hotel was pleasantly warm without overdoing it as is common practice. Breakfast was a little expensive at â‚¬11 per person but there was a good self-service selection of cereals, cold meats, cheeses, fresh bread and croissants. There was also a cook willing to prepare omlettes etc to order. This was served in a glass conservatory in the hotels small garden. I suppose when it's less freezing that this is opened to make a small patio. The surrounding area may not be the livelyiest in Paris for nightlife but there is a good selection of very good restaurants withing walking distance and the hotel is well served for public transport. All in all highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good, inexpensive hotel centrally located in 7th arrondisement”
Reviews.Author: Nitra315
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Muguet for 3 nights in Jan 2010. Hotel staff is multi-lingual and very friendly. I booked a single room at (Euro 106/night) and it had it's own bathroom. If I had to say something negative about the place it's the fact that the bathroom was tiny, but it served its purpose and that wouldn't be enough to discourage me from returning. (Also I believe the larger rooms had regular sized/larger bathrooms.) Breakfast was available on site for a fee, but there were so many wonderful restaurants in the area, so I always ate elsewhere. It's very close to the Metro (Ecole Militaire) and within walking distance of the Champs Elysee and the Eiffel Tower (10-15 min). I arrived very early in the morning and was informed that the room would not be ready until 2pm so keep that in mind. However, they will hold your luggage in their storage room if you wish. Fortunately, there were enough attractions within walking distance that you could keep yourself busy until the room became available. The room was very clean with daily cleaning service. And the best part - free wireless internet! As a solo traveler who was new to Paris, I wasn't sure what to expect, so I relied on TripAdvisor reviews to make my decision and all of the positive reviewers are correct. A really good stay at a boutique hotel and I'd definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to choose a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2dogdad
Reviews.Content: Last Summer was our first trip to France and we were somewhat obsessive about choosing a good hotel for our stay in Paris. I had actually settled on a different hotel, but it was booked up. Muguet was maybe our third choice because a couple of reviews had said the staff was somewhat aloof. Our first several encounters with the desk staff seemed to support that conclusion, but as time went on, we increasingly came to appreciate them. When we checked out and were on our way, our limo driver received a call before we had gone more than a mile - Muguet had found my credit card still in the hotel safe! We returned and were met by the head desk person (Catherine, I think) running to the limo to hand me my card, and urging us to go rather than thank her. I never had to move a muscle and the limo driver barely needed to slow down - good things when you need to drive to Charles DeGaulle airport. The rest has all been covered in the other reviews -clean, tastefully appointed rooms - great location - a quiet neighborhood that was our nightly refuge from a crowded June Paris - even a view of the Eiffel tower, which we had not specifically requested. Also, while the elevator is small, the croissants offered at breakfast were the best we had in Paris. Lastly, there was just that great feeling that we were only a step away from a Paris neighborhood, not cocooned in some sterile hotel that you never need to leave. Frankly, now that we have found the Muguet, it would be hard to justify another hotel choice - at least in the 7e Arrondissement. Have the feeling we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to return to after full days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BYarmouthMe
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Muguet based on what we had read in the Rick Steves Paris guide and the NYTimes travel section. I can't imagine a better place given the price and location. Although we arrived at 10 AM they had no problem checking us into our room. And we were delighted to find that our little window terrace looked out on the Eiffel Tower. Yes, the rooms are very small, but my daughter and I were still able to do yoga (at the same time) and my question for those who complain about small hotel rooms in Paris is: Why are you spending so much time in your room?! The help spoke English well and did not bat an eye when I told them I had spilled a cup of coffee in my room. When I returned that afternoon there was not a trace of the damage I did. The location is incredibly quiet even though you are right in the midst of Paris. Rue Cler is just two blocks away and is a lively scene of cafes, boutiques, and specialty shops. There are plenty of wonderful and reasonably priced dining options to choose from in this area. My only complaint is that my bed was a bit too firm for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “I heart hotel muguet”
Reviews.Author: queen_azu
Reviews.Content: Hotel muguet is simply french! cosy, very beautiful rooms. great staff. The rooms were a little small but very well decorated and very elegant. it was clean and had a romantic feel to it. the lift was tiny and could fit only 3 ppl at a time. With luggage it was tough. the reception staff were friendly and very helpful. The location was fairly central, about 15 mins walk to Eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “Clean! Quiet! Location! More Clean!”
Reviews.Author: dolomites1
Reviews.Content: I reserved a single room that was located in the courtyard, on the first floor of Hotel Muguet. The room had free wireless, a queen size bed and a desk to work at. There is a shrank style closet and easy to use safe. There is enough space to walk around the bed; this is typical in France. The room was beautifully decorated and therefore a pleasure to spend time inside. The bathroom is nice and there is a heated towel rack and shower. The courtyard was so quiet that it was difficult to believe that I was in the city. The only drawback, I felt, was that they did not provide a tiny refrigerator. The hotel is located one block from the subway stop "La Tour Maubourg," #8 Line. It's the perfect location to base oneself and if you are into the food here, Cafe Constant (for dinner) is close by as is the Rue Cler market street. I participated in a Le Cordon Bleu class, located near the #12 Vaugirard stop. I was worried about being too far away but it only took about 20 minutes, via 3 easy to navigate subway lines, after stepping outside the hotel. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, Convienient! I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: RioAdelaide
Reviews.Content: When booking a hotel on the internet you're not always sure what you are going to get, so imagine our surprise when the room that we were staying in looked exactly like the room in the photos! We had a beautiful view of the eiffel tower, our rooms were impeccably cleaned (we could see our faces in the drains and taps) the fittings in the bathroom were new and the bed was comfortable. The service was always friendly and the location is awesome. We didn't try the breakfast as there was too many other places in Paris to try, but from what we saw it looked good! The free internet in the foyer as well as free wireless was also a pleasant touch. We will def be staying here agian next time we are in Paris!! Cheers Rio and Scott

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with great service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lojo34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Muguet for 6 nights. Iâ€™m not sure what room type we got, but we paid 140 euro/night and our room was HUGE compared to other European rooms we have stayed in. The bed was king-size (very firm mattress) and there were 2 closets, a couch, and a nice size bathroom. The room was very clean and well appointed. Catherine and her entire staff are very friendly and helpful. We did have a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower as well. Having the view of the Eiffel Tower is fun, but it also means that your room faces the street. If youâ€™re a light sleeper and the view is not important to you, consider asking for a courtyard view as I think it would be quieter. The traffic noise is NOT horrible by any means, but there were a few times we were woken up in the night by trucks or motorcycles. We did, also, find the walls to be a bit thin. Our neighbors the last two nights left their TV on all night and we could hear it in our room, which was somewhat distracting. The breakfast is 10 euro/day each. It is cold cereal, hard-boiled eggs, meats and cheeses, a large croissant and a piece of French bread. There is also coffee, tea, and hot chocolate available. The neighborhood is fantastic and very convenient. Ecole Militaire and Latour Maubourg metro stops are both very close. We even walked to Invalides metro stop to catch the RER train to Versailles and it wasnâ€™t that far (about a 15 minute walk).

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Chicago2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two hotels in Paris for basically the same price. They were in different neighborhoods (our other was near the Bastille), but this one was remarkably better. The rooms are very big and the bathroom was spacious. I would absolutely recommend this to any who is slightly budget conscious however not willing to sacrifice location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: sarah_rae20
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took a vacation in Paris and had to stay at 3 different hotels due to availablilty problems. This was the last one we stayed at and was for sure the best one. Be sure to book far ahead of time because this one goes fast. I loved the hotel and the location.

Reviews.Title: “High ranking is well deserved!”
Reviews.Author: Morstan
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at Catherine Pelletier's Hotel Muguet for 12 days this month; we frequented this establishment on two previous occasions. Marvelous in every way! Friendly staff, clean, well-appointed rooms & reasonable prices. We opted for a superior room, at 195 Euros per night; this came with a small balcony with an unobstructed view of The Eiffel Tower! The location is perfect, close to the aforesaid tower, rue Cler, Les Invalides, Musee Rodin, Pont Alexandre III & the river Seine. Currently this hotel is rated 57 out of 1,893 Parisian hotels, in the top 3%: Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Izzi36
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Muguet for our honeymoon. We had a regular double room as the price was the top of our budget anyway (140euro per night) In general it's a very nice hotel with an excellent location and a good service. The room and a bathroom were quite small, but apparently that's something to be expected in every Parisian hotel. The only thing that I'd complain about is that the walls seem to be rather thin as we could hear pretty much everything from our neighbours. Overall it was a very positive experience and I would strongly recommend Hotel Muguet. Rue Cler is very close by and it's great! Our favourite place to eat was Cafe Central, very good for vegetarians as they have a few fabulous vegeterian dishes on the menu which was sometimes an issue with other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Pay no mind to the few middling reviews about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kenster42
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from Hotel Muguet. If you are coming to Paris and you want to be in the center of it all and you like saving money you should stay here. I researched about 100 hotels through Tripadvisor and Eurocheapo before selecting Hotel Muguet. It was totally worth it. I ended up paying 110 euros per night, which is awesome. Yes, the room is small. But why are you in Paris, folks? To stay in the room all the time? Heck, no! It's a place to store your body in between the times you're out having fun in the City of Lights. The room is clean, well appointed and has everything you need, including free wifi (woo hoo!). It's in arguably one of the best locations in Paris to get to everything. The first day here I was able to easily walk to Les Invalides, Tour Eiffel, Grand Palais, Louvre, Musee de Quay Branley, Mars Gardens. And to the dude from San Francisco complaining about the price of Parisian hotels, I have 3 words for you - pot, kettle, black. Try staying affordably in your own hometown lately, hoss? I have, and this hotel is cheaper than anything I could find in SF that wasn't a dump. Book it, love it and write a good review.

Reviews.Title: “Gem Near Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: Cyranno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Muguet in September 2009. It is a little gem (43 rooms) near Rue Cler, and within about 10-15 minutes walk of Rue Cler. It had a greehouse breakfast room and small garden courtyard. The rooms were clean with comfortable beds. We paid 20 euro extra for a "view" room. We did have a view of the Eiffel Tower, but didn't feel the extra fee was a good investment. The view was Ok and you spend little time in your room on this type of vacation anyway. The bathroom was well equipped, including a hairdryer, albeit the hairdryer was in a funky location-in a drawer in the main room. There was free internet access. Overall, a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cozy”
Reviews.Author: celloflo
Reviews.Content: I am still stunned that Parisan hotels can command $200 USD per night for such small rooms. However, we had a cozy and private little room at the attic level. The shower door leaked like crazy, which was the only annoying thing. Everything was reasonably well maintained and the staff was very helpful and friendly. A 3-5 min walk to Rue Cler's main street, and about 1.5 blocks to the metro. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower in approx 30 min.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_buff_Vanc
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, newly renovated, great breakfast menu of eggs, meats, baguette, bread, very good coffee. Access to internet very handy. Very quiet street steps away from metro and Rue Clar (for splendid restaurants and food specialty shops). Book many months in advance to avoid disappointment

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel near the Eiffel Tour”
Reviews.Author: Katie15
Reviews.Content: We returned to Hotel Muguet this past September after having had a wonderful stay there in May 2008. It was just as lovely as we remembered it. Very close to so many wonderful Parisian sights--Eiffel Tour, Champs Elysees, Invalides, Rue Cler--and very reasonably priced, we found it a perfect place to stay. The area is lovely and quite residential therefore very quiet. Catherine and her staff do everything possible to make your stay wonderful. The location and value make it a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessNthePea
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 8 nights at the Hotel Muguet and fell in love with it. The location is great (7th arrondissement), just around the corner from the Rue Cler area. Lots of little local restaurants, patisseries, etc. It is down a little side street which is nice and quiet, so you do not have road noise at all. The hotel is also close to the Metro. The room, while small by US standards, was very comfortable and well appointed and it was spotless. The front desk staff was extremely cordial and helpful. The hotel also provides a nice little "petite dejeuner" in the mornings for an additional fee. They had a computer in the lobby for hotel guests who did not bring their own as well as wifi. It is a nice area and we felt very safe. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Magical view of Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: tahoetravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet on the recommendation of friends, as well as based on reviews here on TA. We were not led astray. The location is convenient, close to a Metro stop and within walking distance of many of Paris' attractions. The rooms were impeccably clean and spacious, at least by European standards. We had a triple, witha large king bed and a small single bed in a separate alcove (room 41). The room has a view of the Eiffel Tower -- by day lovely, by night beautifula nd when the lights twinkle on the hour -- absolutely magical!

Reviews.Title: “Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: vetgirlSBAC
Reviews.Content: We really had no idea what to expect when our cab pulled up the the lovely little tucked -in hotel. Such a well appointed location so very close to everything we wanted to see. This trip was our first and it has to be the best! We love the Rue Clare and all the businesses. Very close to the Metro and seems very neighborhood friendly. The staff is very friendly and the internet service was important to us. Love the colours of the rooms with the rich textures of the bedding. Stepping outside and being able to be at the Eiffel Tower in less an 10, minutes walking was amazing. It just made our 40th wedding anniversary the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Room Was Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: worldcats
Reviews.Content: We did not have high expectations but this room was way too small. We are not large people but had to sit on the bed to get past each other in this room. The bathroom was ever smaller with a low ceiling shower that you could hardly fit into. Our window opened to look directly into someone elses window that was maybe 6 feet away ... so we kept the curtains closed. The bed was comfortable but there was alot of scratching noises behind that big beautiful headboard at night. We put in our earplugs and tried not to think about it. We found the breakfast usually picked over and very basic. Coffee was usually all gone and we had to request fresh. The breakfast staff and room staff are not too energetic. The front counter staff were friendly and helpful. I wish I could say better things but unless we were just the unfortunate people who got the smallest room in the place...I'd say this is just not worth it and definitely skip the breakfast and go somewhere in the neighbourhood instead. At 10 euro per person its just not worth it. Won't stay here again and wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: scasperqueen
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 2 nights alone at Hotel Muguet two weeks ago. Hotel Muguet is the best hotel that I have stayed in Paris. Safe and Good location with a short walk to the metro station and also with some view of Eiffel tower from window. Very helpful service and also very nice double standard room (no more single room). There are many restaurants and cafes around and strongly recommending "Le 7eme Vin". They are just 2 streets away from the hotel, small, cosy and with excellent service, wine and food. The small market area just a 3-5 min walk from the hotel is another nice place to visit. There fruits store, flower shop, supermarket and also a few very nice but quite crowded restaurants. I will definiately stay there if I go Paris again. Keep it up, Hotel Muguet!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Paris retreat”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly727
Reviews.Content: We've been to Paris a number of times, always staying in different neighborhoods. After our stay at Hotel Muguet, we've found a place we would be happy to return to. The location is fabulous, on a quiet street that's an easy walk from the Ecole Militare metro, the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler. Our triple room was clean and a generous size, as was the bathroom. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The hotel has wireless as well as a computer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagomomchicago
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Muguet. The triple room was very clean, and a good size with a cozy alcove with the twin bed, in addition to a comfortable Queen. The AC worked well and the bathroom was modern and functional. Great view of the Eiffel Tower from our window. Nice, quiet street, close to the metro. Breakfast at the little cafes on Rue Cler was a better value than eating in the hotel. The staff was friendly and accommodating. overall, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, large rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Helen S
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Muguet. The location is perfect -on a quiet side street, but close to 3 metro stations, rue Cler neighborhood, cafes and patisseries. We were welcomed warmly by Catherine Pellitier, the "hands on" owner who spoke English. Our room ( #41) was delightfully large with full bath and view of the Eiffel Tower. Rooms and public areas of the hotel were both very clean. The hotel offers optional breakfast for 10 E which at first we though rather expensive, but after going out on our own, decided it was a great bargain. The free coffee refills thrilled my husband! The croissants were the size of footballs and yummy! We would definitely stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff, residential area”
Reviews.Author: NVG27
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice, clean, and quiet hotel, this is it. Small rooms, but that is Paris for you. Close to Eiffel Tower - 15 minute walk. Close to metro - Ecole Militaire. Safe area, no need to worry if you travel alone. Close to Rue Cler area, great affordable French restaurants. Staff friendly and helpful. Would definately stay again. Price was right - 106 Euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Make_It_A_Large_One
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet is a clean tidy hotel in a good location in Paris. The rooms are not huge, but clean and tidy and as long as you only want to sleep there, they are fine. This is not a hotel in which you want to spend time relaxing, it's functional and a good base for exploring the city. The breakfast is overpriced at 10 euros per person. We went out and on one day sat in a cafe overlooking Notre Dame and had a French beakfast for 5.5 euros each. You can do much better than the hotel if you try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Accommodated our family of 5 very well”
Reviews.Author: danryan62
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet was an excellent choice for our family of 5. We had rooms 61 and 62 on the top floor, both with views of the Eiffel Tower. The staff was friendly and very helpful for our first visit to Paris. Located on a quiet street only 2 blocks from Rue Cler (for Rick Steves fans). Air conditioning was a big plus in August. I would highly reommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, updated and clean”
Reviews.Author: Azniv
Reviews.Content: Great location a block away from the main Rue Clair area, close to metro as well. Thought it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, quiet location, very clean, tasteful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: catsinthebelfry
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect for my girlfriend and me. Good value too... In June 2008, we paid 100 Euros per night per single room. Not bad considering it's a nice hotel. The rooms are very tiny, as can be expected in Paris. There is not much room to walk around the double bed, and when you are sitting in the bathroom, it's difficult to close the door! However, our 2 rooms were spotless, recently renovated and tastefully, (albeit simply) decorated. We thought they were ideal for one person. We might have found them a little tight if we had been 2 per room. My girlfriend had a view of the top of the Eiffel tower from her window. My view was of a courtyard and rooftops. Nothing interesting. But very quiet. And when you are jetlagged and want to sleep, that is more important than a view! The Hotel Muguet is located on a quiet side street, but one block away (a 2 minute walk) you will find shops, a small supermarket and restaurants as well as a metro station. We never tried the hotel breakfast because the dining room looked more like a school cafeteria and we preferred to eat outside, at a nearby cafÃ©. A big plus, when you have luggage, is the hotel elevator. Once, just as we were about to check out, it stopped working for a couple hours and the hotel staff immediately offered to carry our suitcases down for us. That was a nice touch. My parents went here in 1964 for their honeymoon and loved it. When they recommended the place to me, I expected to find an outdated hotel. But I was pleasantly surprised by the inviting, updated rooms (with very modern bathrooms and internet access) and the welcoming receptionist. I'm definitely staying at the Muguet again when I go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, clean rooms, iffy staff.”
Reviews.Author: alliesun98
Reviews.Content: Location - about a 5 min. walk to nearest metro station (Ecole Militaire). A few cafes and restaurants near metro stop. Rooms - We saw three different rooms during our stay and all were clean with new bathroom fixtures. One of the rooms was a bit cramped, but not out of the ordinary for a European hotel room. Had a great view of the Eiffel Tower from 2 of the rooms ( 41 and 42). A/C, free WiFi in the room, flat screen TV (which we never watched), and I thought the beds were quite comfy. Breakfast - 10 euro, which I thought was reasonable. Pastries, cheese, yogurt, and they would make you an omelette if you asked. Staff - This is where I think they lose a star in my book. The staff that greeted us when we arrived was pleasant, but not overly so. The woman who handled our check-out was not pleasant at all. I don't remember her smiling once. Our situation was a bit confusing because we had to change rooms the second night (long story, but it was because we requested to stay an extra night at the last minute and the hotel was nearly booked...) and one of the mornings we did not ALL have breakfast, plus there were four of us between two rooms and we wanted to pay separately. ANYhow...she seemed rather peeved at the situation, and then when I mentioned that my husband hadn't had breakfast one of the days she rudely said, "well why didn't you tell me that before?" Overall - I'd probably stay here again. The rooms really were very good for the price. Perhaps some of the staff could just work on their people skills a bit :)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, comfortable, convenient, quiet and clean hotel in Rue Cler area”
Reviews.Author: Sidewinder192
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple recently spent 8 days in Paris and stayed at this hotel on two rooms on the 6th floor for the entire stay. This was our first trip to Paris and other friends had recommended this hotel as good value and comfortable. We were not disappointed and quite pleased with the stay. First one minor note - the 3 person lift only goes to the 5th floor so you have to hand carry any luggage up to the 6th floor if you stay there. The 6th floor has some nice views - our room faced Napoleon's Tomb our friends faced the Eiffel tower. The free wifi was very convenient and worked well in the rooms. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Relatively small by US standards but typical for Europe. The location is convenient to two Metro stops (Ecole Militaire/La Tour-Maurborg) so you can readily get to where ever you need to by the metro. Rue Chevert is a very quiet one way street that seemed to have very little auto or pedestrian traffic. As Paris was bustling with energy this time of the year, it was refreshing to have a place to relax a bit away from the teaming masses. The location is also very convenient to the rue Cler pedestrian area - two blocks or so away. This area has all the basics one would need - small restaurants, cheese, chocolate, wine, deli's, bakeries etc. We would most days start our journey from that area - get our provisions for the day and off to explore. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful - they made restaurant reservations for us, called taxi's as needed and gave us directions to sights. Water and coffee are relatively expensive here at 2 euro per drink. After the first day, we found bottled water on rue Cler at Leader Price for 0.98 euro a 6-pack and we were good for the rest of the stay. On our next visit to Paris we plan to definitely look into staying at Hotel Muguet again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jurij
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 7 night stay at the Hotel Muguet. The room, albeit small, was comfortable, very clean and air conditioned. It is located on a quiet street and is convenient to metro stops, rue Cler and other major avenues. We found a number of restaurants withing walking distance. It was close to bakeries, super markets and an outdoor market. The staff was very helpful for advice and directions. I would stay there again without question. After dinner, we had options where to walk, including the Eiffel Tower. The weak American dollar made the hotel more expensive but that did stop us from enjoying our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: rendejo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the positive reviews I found on Tripadvisor and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this 2 stars hotel. I have stayed in many hotels in Paris before, but none of them could beat the Muguet in terms of cleanliness, quietness, friendliness and location. Our room was very clean, tastefully decorated, and the bathroom, although small, was very practical and well equiped (inclding a rain shower). Add to this a flat screen TV and free wireless in the room, to indicate that this hotel definitively deserves more than a 2 star rating. Breakfast is served in a nice and bright veranda, which is quite a difference with the common breakfast cellars in many hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: havefuninthesun
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our London/Paris 10 day vacation. We are 3 generations of women: Grandmother, Mom, and a 16 yr old daughter. We booked this hotel because my mom had stayed there before and knew the hotel was conveniently located to various sights: Eiffel Tower, Seine River, Trocadero, Rue Cler, Invalides, etc. The only issue we had was that there were no triples available here for us, so we had to get two rooms, 1 single, and 1 double at a considerable extra expense per day. We did like this hotel and it was very clean(immaculate) and I like clean and it was very close to the Tour La Marbourg metro station(very convenient). We spent 5 days at this hotel and met many other Americans who also traveled with their families. My teenage daughter thought the beds were a bit hard for her liking, but she survived. Our favorite restaurant (Brasserrie) nearby was called La Source. We ate almost all our late lunches or dinners there as we watched the Parisiens walk by. We also observed the children in the park nearby playing soccer. A salad or special plate at this restaurant would be about 11 euros - 15 euros, not bad for Paris. This restaurant and others were close by the Metro Tour La Marbourg. We never ate the breakfast at Muguet, it was 10 euros pp and didn't look that special to us. All in all, we would definately stay at this hotel again, but would book early to insure a triple room if needed. It is very difficult to find hotels for 3 in Paris. Also, we want to mention that the staff here was really nice, especially Martin who we met one day in the Jardin du Luxembourg and he was so happy to see us we got lots of hugs and kisses. Thank you Martin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: abalko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights while in Paris. We really loved the Rue Cler area, it was any easy walk to great food, shops, the metro, and the Eiffel Tower. The hotel was very nice. Newly remodeled, very clean, and on a quiet street. It has air conditioning and free wi-fi. The rooms are small by American standards, but normal for Europe. The staff was very nice and all spoke English well. We enjoyed our stay here and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: welv2trvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 8 different hotels during our two week trip to France and the Muguet was one of the best as far as location, value, size of room, friendliness of the staff and proximity to most of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Classy bargain”
Reviews.Author: callyjsl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a European trip that included four nights at the Hotel Muguet. The location is amazing and the price was an incredible value. The room was quiet and always clean and the staff was quite helpful. We plan to stay again at Hotel Muguet in the future and will highly recommend the hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Charmer!”
Reviews.Author: andiamo
Reviews.Content: Third visit to this hotel since 2001 and it just gets better! Couldn't be in a more convenient or quiet location in the 7th....love this family owned hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: stella8888
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. I loved staying in the 7th District; it is relatively quiet but has plenty of great restaurants/cafes and convenient to most sight-seeing locations. The hotel rooms are no smaller than other Paris hotels in its class, but it was clean, safe, and nicely decorated (not luxurious, but not cheesy, either). There is a high-speed internet service in the lobby, which was very convenient for checking my emails, etc. Also, the front-desk staff was very helpful in term of making reservations for restaurants, etc. They serve gratis breakfast, but there are a few cafes nearby that serve excellent croissants and chocolate chaud, so I would venture out, if I were you. There is also a wonderful fresh-produce market nearby, which is a great to check out.

Reviews.Title: “great location for a gastronomic experience at restaurants nearby”
Reviews.Author: LiewSe
Reviews.Content: Charming room - small, quiet and clean. Very polite and discrete service from its staff. A stone's throw from Metro. Plenty of restaurants around serving great food. Recommend Florimond, around the corner highly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Davyboy69
Reviews.Content: Traveled with family members for a wedding. Stayed for 2 nights. All of us were pleasantly surprised with this hidden gem. Cleanliness is a must for us especially mother-in-law (she's a housekeeping manager for a large hotel chain). She gave a huge thumbs up. All rooms were recently renovated. Bathrooms were clean. location was a 15 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. Hop On Hop tour bus had a stop 2 blocks away. Great breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yago1
Reviews.Content: From the check-in to the departure the hotel and its staff met are every need. This beautiful little hotel is clean, comfortable and well located. The staff are attentive and most speak some english. The rooms are well laid out and the bathrooms are modern and spotlessly clean. Well situated and close to one of Paris's best markets. I would recommend to both business and leisure travelers. The manager, Catherine, is an elegant and charming host.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a hidden gem, I almost don't even want to share the secret!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adorable, convenient, and one of the nicest little places we've ever stayed in Paris. It's cute, clean and comfortable and as others have mentioned the location can't be beat. We even had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our room, which was super romantic. Only thing that we didn't love, however, was the breakfast. First of all, we had to pay for it. Second of all, it wasn't too great. I mean, you're in Paris, just walk out onto the street and get a croissant or a crepe! It will be better than the breakfast here. Otherwise, we loved it and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my stay in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: CyndySings
Reviews.Content: I read hundreds of reviews before choosing Hotel Muguet. The one thing that all the Euroean hotels had in common were small rooms so that's what I was expecting. I was happily surprised that my imagination was wrong! We had a nice room with a king sized bed and yes, it was small, but not nearly as small as some of the hotels in NYC! The one thing that did hamper my enjoyment at the room was seeing a blow drier was provided I didn't bring mine. That was a mistake. First, the rooms blow drier is in the bedroom, not the bathroom. And it is fixed into a drawer. There's a large mirror that you can turn and look into, but it is still awkward. Add to this that the on/off button must be pressed the whole time you want it on and you end up with a stiff neck and sore finger/thumb. I have long hair and it takes some time to dry it so this was inconvenient to me. That said, I'd still recommend this hotel to anyone! Just bring your own blow drier!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: WryterGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Muguet twice, once for a week and later for two nights, and found it to be a great base for exploring Paris. It's close to Les Invalides and the Eiffel Tower, with several very good (and reasonably priced) eateries within a few minutes' walk. Our first stay was in the attic room that looks out on the front street and the Eiffel Tower â€” great lightshow at night! The room isn't huge and the ceiling slopes around the window, but is very comfortable and the bathroom is wonderful. On our second stay we had a larger room one floor down, which looked out toward the rear of the hotel and over the rooftops. Also very nice. There are certainly more luxurious hotels in the city, but for location, value and comfort, I'd happily recommend the Muguet. One thing to bear in mind: The elevator doesn't reach the top floor, so be prepared to climb one fairly easy flight of stairs if you book the attic room.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good hotel, but we won't return”
Reviews.Author: STC
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the late entry here. We stayed at Hotel Muguet on June 19 and 20, 2008 (last summer). We were traveling with our extended family of 14 people. The hotel is located on a quiet street, within walking distance of the Eifel Tower and the Champs d' Elise. For dinner, there is an excellent restaurant at the end of the block, just 50 yards away, called Pasco. Unfortunately, we arrived just in time for a heat wave, and the hotel's A/C really isn't A/C, or it wasn't working. We had two very uncomfortable nights sleep. The petit dejuner was fine, with all the basics, and if you ask, they will prepare an omelette or scrambled eggs. Overall, the staff was helpful, but really didn't seem to enjoy the profession of hospitality, i.e. we were not as welcome as we were in the 4 other hotels we enjoyed while in France. The twin bedded rooms are the larger rooms, but as we expected, all the rooms and bathrooms are very very small. Even if we were traveling as a couple, I would recommend reserving a twin bedded room, just to get larger square footage. We won't return to the Hotel Muguet because we ended our trip back in Paris at the Hotel Britainique, which was superb, and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gb1967
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 year old daughter and I stayed for a long weekend at the Hotel Muguet. I paid the extra 10 Euros a night for a view of the Eiffel Tower. It was great to sit in the room and watch the tower twinkle after dark, and to see how the look of it changed from early morning to afternoon to night. The hotel is perfectly located near two metro stops and near the Rue Cler which is a great place to find restaurants. We had a triple room which was large by any standard. I've already recommended it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique stones throw from Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: connor200
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 08 during bug European holiday. Found the hotel online and booked directly with them. Had a few emails from the owner confirming the reservation which made it feel like very personal service. I found the hotel pretty expensive, but pretty much all of Paris was the same. Hotel is beautiful and has more of a 5 star feel to it. Stayed in a beautiful renovated room which had glimpses of the Eiffel Tower - it was very cool seeing the lights on the top of the tower twinkling at night. Never ate at the hotel but there is a breakfast room for guests. One thing I found annoying was that you couldn't take food into your room and I felt this should have been noted on their website. Location is great, just 10 minutes walk to the Champs de Mars and Eiffel Tower and loads of transport options. But you'll probably want to walk everywhere to take in all the Parisian sights. Just a note - taxi drivers screwed us on both trips to the airport so if you can handle public transport with luggage, it's worth the money you'll save. Paris is amazing and this is a great hotel to use as your base.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: goofrider
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room but as it turned out, the single room has a double bed. Nice! Everything is great about the hotel, charming, clean, decent sized room, friendly staff. unfortunately the free wifi didn't work, but there's a public computer to get online. About 3-5 min walk from the Ecole Miltaire metro station. 10 min walk from the Eiffel. 10-15 min on the metro to most of the other tourist landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: amybatt
Reviews.Content: A bit belated, but wanted to add my feedback. My sister and I stayed two nights at the Hotel Muguet in the 7th for a change in scenery at the end of a longer stay in Paris and Vienna. Location: This hotel is about 2 min on foot to rue Cler, which we only went to the morning we left to buy cheese (Iâ€™d been before) and about 10 min on foot to the Eiffel Tower. I hesitate to recommend this location to first time visitors because I think it is out of the way for â€œeverything elseâ€� (other than the Tower) and I think you can do better in terms of accessibility on the metro and to restaurants that are easy to walk to. Rooms: We had an interesting room set up that I think was meant for a triple. We walked into an anteroom with a sectional sofa meant to be a third bed. Our two twins were comfortable, but the room was a bit cramped with just the two of us in it. The bathroom was good sized and bright though. Cleanliness: This is where things started to go wrong for us. I didnâ€™t think highly of the staff as the bathroom looked as if a landmine hit it after it was cleaned each day â€“ our belongings on the counters and in the shower were all over the place: floor, trash barrel, not on the counter where we'd left them. No care at all went into keeping our things safe and organized. And the second day there was hair (not mine or my sister's, as we are both blond) in my razor. Ugh. That was enough for me. Breakfast was 13 euro and had the fewest offerings on the trip. I would not return here due to location/accessibility to everything I am in Paris to see and the problem with our bathroom cleaning. You can find much better locations for a better price (see my other reviews).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: adlor
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at the Hotel Muguet and it was wonderful - great room, clean and fantastic location near the metro so close to everything. It was everything I wanted and more, excellent value!!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in a great area of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Hockeymom2009
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through an article written by an American journalist who stayed in Paris often and described it as "cheap, stylish, and with lots of character". He was right. We were a five minute walk from the Hotel des Invalides, a six minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and in a classy, safe neighbourhood, filled with real Parisians, not just other tourists. The hotel was impeccably clean, stylish rooms, on a quiet side street with huge windows in each room that overlooked either a classic Paris street or the Hotel des Invalides -- either way, gorgeous. We booked through the hotel's website, and received prompt responses to all our questions, and clear directions from the train station (if travelling from Britain) via the Metro. There were lots of reasonably priced and good quality restaurants nearby, my husband needed a Starbucks and that was within five minutes too! Our kids had a twin room which had ample storage for them (two wardrobes) a clean, modern bathroom, and two twin beds. My husband and I were next door in a queen room, which was equally comfortable though a little less storage space. Either way, the rooms were the right price and size (only 135 Euros per night) and the small courtyard breakfast area was perfect for a quick breakfast before sightseeing. Hotel staff were very helpful, had free internet service on the computer in the lobby, and were more than willing to make suggestions on restaurants, etc. This is a quiet, privately owned hotel, so if you're into a "big chain" feel you won't like it. If on the other hand, you can't wait to "feel" Paris, are looking for a place to lay your head between outings in Paris, then I'd highly recommend it. From the grandfather clock in the lobby to the winding staircase to your room, you'll know you're in the City of Lights.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: alongtheroad
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 14 year old, so it's hard finding a hotel that can accommodate three people, but this was perfect. It provided an additional twin bed on the other side of a half wall for him to sleep. The hotel is in a quiet residential area of Paris, very close to Rue Cler, a wonderful street with delicious pastries and fresh fruits and flowers. We had the pleasure of seeing the Eiffel Tower right from our window, even though it was a little bit of a walk to get there. We were also very close to the Invalides. Great location, nice little gathering area with internet access in lobby. Although it was a bit of a walk to the downtown areas, we still managed, and took the subways if we did get too tired. This was also more reasonable than those hotels closer in. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Isabella211
Reviews.Content: After many years of trying different reasonably priced hotels in Paris, I finally found The hotel of my choice .The Hotel Muguet is warm and friendly, very comfortable, sparkingly clean and the staff is welcoming and helpful. The rooms are small as they all are in Paris but beautifully appointed, nicely decorated and extremely well planned out to maximize the space. The bed is comfortable and so is the bathroom with a shower that you can actually turn around in comfortably! The location is excellent with Metro and bus stops within 1-2 blocks away. A lovely neighborhood where you can feel safe walking late at night coming back to the hotel. One might be able to find a hotel to stay for a little less but as far as I am concerned, I don't mind paying a bit more to feel as good as I did during my 3 day stay at the Hotel Muguet this past weekend! Thank You, Hotel Muguet staff!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: lsl5144
Reviews.Content: Great location! It is under two blocks away from two different Metro stops (Ecole Militaire and La Tour Maubourg) and a nice walk to Invalides. It is in the heart of the 7th close to Rue Cler, Napoleon's Tomb and the Eiffel Tower. Great value and helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “not too great of a choice”
Reviews.Author: frederick08
Reviews.Content: Contrary to some positive reviews on this website, Hotel Muguet is not a good choice for a stay in Paris. The rooms are a bit worn, the lobby with its vinyl couch and chairs is not impressive, and pay heed to errors in billing when you are leaving. The hotel is listed as 2 stars, and that is generous. The breakfast, which is a separate 9.50 euro charge, consists of a cold croissant and half a baquette, some coffee, and a Dannon yogurt. Hardly of what is to be expected during a stay in Paris. Anyone reading this review, I plead with you to consider someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: merlinandme
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet is an absolute gem located in the seventh arrondisement. Slip through a nearby alleyway and you are on the Rue Cler where you can eat with Parisians from a delightful array of options or just purchase some fresh fruit and bread and prepare for picnic. The Champs de Mars is nearby, so a spot to munch is close at hand. The rooms are lovely, beautifully appointed and very conveniently laid out. There is a very nice little laundry nearby where you can wash your clothes and meet other travelers and locals. The hotel is close to a Metro stop, near the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides, and convenient to a batobus stop near the Tower. I loved this place and would certainly stay here on a return to Paris. Oh, and yes. The nearby La Terrasse is a lovely restaurant that offers good food at fair prices.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaF
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at Hotel Muguet after a Viking River cruise from Paris to Le Havre. Had stayed there 6 nights in Oct 2005. Hotel rooms have been refreshed--new flooring, furnishings, AND electrical. Can now use 110 outlet in bathroom to charge cell phone or iPod plus there is a 220 outlet right by the desk. Front desk was very helpful--except with the minor problem of receiving a message to call home immediately. As my father is 91--I was pretty upset. But the message was in error! Hotel is located with in close walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Rodin Museum, great restaurants and markets, and two metro stops. Rooms are typically Parisian small--but as Rick Steves says it is a three star hotel at a two star price.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: monetsgardens
Reviews.Content: An amazing place to stay. Read the reviews on line and felt quite comfortable booking for 7 nights Correspondance by email was answered promptly. Booked online and it should be noted that my credit card was NOT charged for the room until check out time. This is not always the case abroad. The lobby is lovely with a much appreciated computer available for guest use. We did not have the breakfast being we had heard so many wonderful things about Rue Cler (2 min. walk) that we decided to try somewhere different each day. The elevator is small but still held 4 suitcases and myself. The room was lovely and exactly as shown online. The beds were very comfortable and the extra pillow in the armoire was a blessing. The bathroom was a nice size and the room in general had plenty of moving space for the two of us. Everything was in excellent shape and appeared to be recently renovated. The TV had several channels and CNN was in english. We had a lovely window looking down on the street at the front of the hotel and could see the top 5 feet of the eiffel tower which was plenty being we did not ask for a room with a view of the tower and we saw the tower twice daily since it was only a 10 min walk away. Easy access to the hop on and off bus and metro. I feel we had the best location for someone who has never been to Paris and wants easy access to everything. The staff was friendly, helpful and wonderful. I cannot find one thing to complain about. They made us feel like we were VIP guests from the day we arrived to the day we left. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Experience”
Reviews.Author: xalbguy8
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel, on a quiet street close to Rue Cler. The rooms can be tight, depending on location, but vary in size considerably. Would recommend those with a view of Invalides over those with a view of the Eiffel Tower because of size as well as the view itself (Invalides is much more impressive at night). Regardless of size, the rooms are well furnished and spotlessly clean. The people at the front desk are all very pleasant and anxious to answer questions and help with any needed advice. The area has numerous good restaurants and shops, as well as services such as pharmacies and a post office. Two Metro stations are nearby, and many sites are within a 15-20 minute walk. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: travel_princess12
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at Hotel Muguet and it definately wasn't long enough. The location of the hotel is wonderful, close to the Eiffel Tower and Invaldes as well as restaurants, public transport and tourist bus stops. The staff were friendly and helpful. I arrived 2 hours before check in and was just going to leave my bags, but my room was ready. It was immaculately clean, tastefully decorated and incredibly quiet. The bathroom was small, but lovely and the bed so comfy. My only negative comment about my stay was that the internet connection in the lobby was playing up and I was unable to check in for my flight, and really that is a very small detail to complain about. Can't wait to stay here longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: likestovacationTampa
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Hotel Mugut. The rooms are spotless and decorated tastefully. There were 6 in our group including 2 teenagers so we required 3 rooms. We found the same standard of excellence in all 3 rooms. Booking was easy by email and there were no problems when we arrived. Everyone at the hotel was helpful and professional. The location was convenient and a short walk to sightseeing buses. We ate breakfast in the hotel 2 mornings and the other mornings we strolled 5 minutes and took advantage of the wonderful crepe stand in the Rue Cler. THis hotel really delivers we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jp43
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a great location. It was close to the Eiffel Tower and to a subway stop. It was also close to the Rue Cler neighborhood, yet on a quiet street. The staff was very friendly, they had internet access in the lobby for guest use and the room was clean, spacious and comfy. We booked based on trip adviosr reccomendations and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Clare077
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on the way to ~Switzerland. Its a good choice - big rooms compared to normal Paris size. Very friendly English speaking staff. Very comfortable and close to metro. Ten mins walk to the river (Eiffel Tower) where you can catch a bato bus into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - gem of an Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyespy2004blue
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel following previous reviews on Trip Advisor and I wasn't disappointed. The Hotel is in an excellent location, literally a few hundred metres from the nearest Metro Station, in a very safe and quiet area. The hotel staff were welcoming, helpful and efficient, the rooms of an excellent standard and exceptionally clean. Previous reviews have queried the no eating in the rooms policy. They do ask you not to eat in the rooms however, they make the breakfast area available 24/7 for you to use and only ask that you leave it how you found it. i.e clean and tidy. Not too much to ask. There are a multitude of good restaurants within easy walking distance and range in tastes from traditional french to japanese, chinese and italian On the whole the nights were quiet. Just one point to make. The rear of the Hotel looks down onto a small garden area and faces on all sides private apartments. Not a problem unless you have some very loud American guests partying at 1.00am with the windows open and no regard to the fact that every shouted word was being echoed around the back area - I have no objection to people enjoying themselves but it would be an idea to keep the windows shut so that the rest of the guests could get some sleep. Some Spanish guests did comment in the morning that it was no wonder that Americans are not very popular outside of America. A little unkind as the Americans we chatted to were really nice.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TresJolieMarie
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. The hotel is quaint with a lovely garden. The staff was helpful and the rooms are comfortable and clean. I would definately stay there again and will recommend the hotel to all my friends. Get the shuttle from and to the airport...works like a charm!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Muguet”
Reviews.Author: SueBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Paris, and we decided we wanted to stay on La Rive Gauche (left bank) and we were recommended Hotel Muguet by other accommodation which was fully occupied. We love this boutique hotel and the location is sensational! Reception are fantastic and offer all the assistance you could possibly require. First impression of the hotel is wonderful, the decor is very pleasing and great detail has been paid. We stayed on an upper floor with a view of the Eiffle Tower and we were not disappointed when we looked out of our window and could see a clear view of the Eiffle Tower both day and night. The room was wondefully big and we were fortunate to have a small sitting room near the entry which meant we could have somewhere to store our things. Whilst breakfast wasn't included in our room rate, we did have breakfast and found that it was great value. The Hotel is located a few blocks from Les Invalides (Bonaparte's Tomb) and the Eiffle Tower in the opposite direction. There are loads of cafes, restaurants, shops etc. however the street the hotel is located in is very quiet. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Muguet and we would definitely stay again in the future. Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: izziet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Muguet in September. After quite sometime reading reviews on Tripadvisor I chose this perfect hotel. If you plan to stay in the 7th arondisement I can recommend this hotel. Our room on the top floor was extremely comfortable with a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. The bathroom was large and included a bath. There was a large cupboard for hanging our clothes and a safe to keep our passports etc. The bed was very comfortable and the noise from outside negligible. The room was serviced everyday and extremely clean and fresh. Catherine and her staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. We checked in early in the morning and our room was ready. After 30+ hours of travelling this was fantastic. The policy of no food/drink in the room we adhered to as there is a pleasant space on the ground floor where you can bring food/ drink to. The computer terminal on the ground floor was an extra bonus and we used it everyday. A word of caution. Monday is a very quiet day in Paris with many of the shops closed as are the art galleries and museums. Also be aware of the scam involving the gold ring. We were approached outside Dorsay Museum and having read about it on Tripadvisor were forwarned. All in all I agree with many previous reviews on Hotel Murget and recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate, Updated & 5 minutes from Rue Cler / 15 minutes from Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: Chablis28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located on a quiet side street about 5 minutes from the ever fascinating Rue Cler market and about 15 minutes from Eiffel and the Seine. If you choose to buy pastries at Rue Cler for breakfast ( about 6 Euros total for 3 of us) every morning as we did there is a Starbucks about 3 minutes from Rue Cler. If you're not a big breakfast eater I'd suggest this as you can save about 6 Euros per person vs. a hotel breakfast and enjoy the walk to Rue Cler. Muguet has spotlessly maintained rooms with up-to-date designer touches in warm luxurious colors. The rooms are excellent, if slightly small, in a typical major city way these days. This hotel does feel like you have a room in a 4*+ hotel but none of the bigger hotel bustle. We had a small Eiffel view which is fun but probably not worth the extra money since the tower is about a mile away as the crow flies. If we had been one room closer to the intersection the Eiffel view may have been slightly better but hard to say since the tower isn't just 1 or 2 blocks away. The 2 - maybe 4 person max lift was a fun ride. We ended up using the spiral staircase most of the time. I would say if there was one area for improvement it might be in front desk attitude. We got scolded one day for walking out without leaving our key. The problem was the front desk person was helping another group check in and didn't make any quick eye contact to acknowledge we could drop our key safely so we took it with us. That led to a scolding when we returned and not much interest in our explanation. The front desk always seemed a little economical with their assistance on directions and questions and slightly annoyed if you wanted it repeated or clarified. Still, all in all, I think they were pretty decent but I prefer a more eager to help-eager to please front desk. That said, not a big deal since our priorities are nicely appointed and meticulously clean rooms. We'd come back in a heartbeat and continue to give the front desk the benefit of the doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Happyhubby&Daddy
Reviews.Content: I go to Paris twice a year for 4 days and have stayed in four star hotels and two star hotels..honestly, I now prefer most two stars. I am however, quite picky and have very high standards when it comes to the following: Cleanliness, location, and free wifi. Hotel Muguet excels in each of the three above mentioned qualities. The rooms are VERY clean..moreover, the bathrooms are super clean! The shower is incredibly small..maybe the smallest of any hotel I have every stayed in..but entirely manageable unless you weigh over 275 pounds! The free wi-fi worked great! The location is incredibly close to metro, taxi stands, great restaurants. 103 euros is a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Meli25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in September for 5 nights. The hotel is located on quiet residential street. It is also conveniently located near two metro stops (Ecole Militaire and La Tour-Maubourg) and is very close to the Eiffel Tower as well. The rooms are small, but there is plenty of room to throw your luggage around and walk around. Free wifi is offered in each room as well. Ours worked perfectly. The bathroom is the major plus. Looks as though they have been newly renovated. There is a rainfall showerhead that is excellent. The shower doors are a little tricky. There is a method to keeping them closed all the way, and once we learned it, we were able to spare the floor from water. However, if you knocked into the door while showering, the doors would open up a bit again. The towels were nice and huge! Another major plus...the windows opened up! We had a window in the room and in the bathroom. It was nice to get fresh air in both the mornings and the evenings. I would highly recommend the breakfast. They charge for the breakfast (I believe it was 9.50 euros), but it is worth it. You get a large croissant and large slice of a baguette. On top of that, you have your choice of cheese, ham, salami, eggs, cereal, yogurt, applesauce (which was delicious!), orange juice, coffee and hot chocolate. We had breakfast out of the hotel the first day, and realized that the hotel breakfast was much better, and a much better deal. You must leave your key at reception any time you leave. It was a little strange at first, but it ensured we wouldn't lose our key, so we were fine with that! The only complaint I have is that we were not allowed to eat in the room. Sometimes you just want to take a little pastry "home" with you for later!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gtrotter
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the hotel for a week. It's my second time in Paris. I stayed at the Paris Hilton for last year. I actually prefer this hotel over the Hilton. The room is very small but it is extremely clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom is newly renovated. I'd highly recommend having breakfast at the hotel. 9.5euro is definitely a bargain. For 9.5 euro, you get cereal, eggs, ham, cheese, baguette, croissant, chocolate croissant, orange juice, hot chocolate, coffee and tea. The hotel is in a great location. Ecole Militare Station is just a couple of minutes away. Rue Cler is about a minute away from the hotel. Check out Cafe Central. The risotto there is so creamy and delicious. The daytime staff at the hotel was very helpful. Unfortunately, I could not say the same about the guy at night. Despite the night time staff, I truly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Muguet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location, proprietress needs adjustment”
Reviews.Author: keith2i
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern room on 1st floor (2nd floor in USA) & great location. Concerning communication between staff: They sent us up to our rooms when arrived but were not ready so had to slog our stuff back down to the lobby & wait. Receptionist was very nice and helpful. Proprietress was very effiencient in the arrangements prior to our arrival but bordered on rude & non-helpful when trying to check-out and ask for transporation advice to the Austerlitz train station. If given helpful advice, could have saved ourselves about 2 hours sitting at the train station waiting when we didn't need to do so. Proprietress seemed to resent that the receptionist gave us some usefull advice as opposed to her non-commital answer (paraphrasing in English: "taxi could take 8 hours to cross town to Austerlitz station. who knows" [oh come on, i could walk there in much less time; she seemed pleased with what was perceived as a '[-]' answer]

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lala1020
Reviews.Content: Two gal pals and I decided to see Paris, and we stayes here at Muguet. This was a simple yet awesome hotel! Good rates, clean, professional ... all with a good location. We took the train to Ecole Militaire and walked to our hotel! (note: no escalators or elevators at the train stops). Like everybody else, we loved Rue Cler, where we ate most of the time! We paid for the room with the view and ablsolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Rooms are Small but Clean”
Reviews.Author: re_gftr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well kept and quite clean. We had initially booked for our 5 night stay as per a friend's recommendation, and I am glad that we did. When we had arrived we decided to bump up our 130 EU room to a 180EU, which the hotel considers as a 3 person. This room was much more spacious, with a double bed, chaise lounge, good-size washroom and shower. The other room barely had enough walking room, and I mean this literally. It is in very close proximity to a Metro and the Eiffel Tower which was a huge plus as we were able to locate and move around quite efficiently and quickly. The area surrounding the hotel is the best part; excellent restaurants, bakeries, and is a quiet upscale residential neighbourhood. We would definitely stay again if we went to Paris. The owner is a bit of a...difficult and strong woman, but the rest of the staff is friendly and kind. Do utilise the breakfast as it is cheap and ample. Free Wifi available in all the rooms with additional access to their printer and computer in the lobby if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Quality 2 star hotel with a view!”
Reviews.Author: KateM54
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this website, and were not disappointed. Our welcome was warm, and when we opened our room door, found we had been upgraded to a room with a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower and a small balcony. The airconditioning was a blessing with the hot days. Although compact rooms, they are spotlessly clean, with quality furnishings. The bathroom is big enough, with a wonderful rain shower rose, as well as a hand held shower attachment. We had the biggest, fluffiest towels of our entire trip in Europe - luxury! We ate breakfast in the hotel 2 mornings of our three, good food, with no one smoking around us, which is what you endure in Rue Cler. We were offered hot egg breakfast as well as the varied choices. Although eating in your room is strictly prohibited, we noticed guests bringing food back to the hotel in the evenings, and using the breakfast area, with assistance from the friendly concierge. Coffee is available all hours at the hotel, and the internet service is free. Very quiet, so close to all attractions, a wonderful view both day and night of the Eiffel Tower, this hotel has it all. Try Pascoes restaurant 20 metres further down the road for a wonderful meal, but you may need to book. This hotel deserves all the praise it gets, and congratulations to the management for such a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The delightful Muguet”
Reviews.Author: alaskanwanderers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in July 2008 at the Hotel Muguet. Wow, what a gem!! Everything about it was great, from the amazing breakfast (not included but very reasonably priced) to the wonderful staff, beautiful room and excellent location. We were within comfortable walking distance to everything we needed, sights, train, etc. I can't say how much we enjoyed our stay here. It was purely luck that we ever found it and will recommend it to anyone we know heading to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel/Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gmb27
Reviews.Content: My wife and I experienced our first time at the Hotel Muguet and only booked it due to the reviews on this website. So we went in a little blind and a little unsure. For those of you want a hotel that offers value, cleanliness, comfort, location and friendliness then look no further. What a gem!! You can no doubt get better but you'll also pay a higher rate. We had a Queen room which was very comfortable - if you wnat something bigger then pay more but this was quite sufficient. We would stay again although our next visit to Paris would probably be in another district - only because variety is the spice of life!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience - never again!”
Reviews.Author: foodie_tourist
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in May 2008 for a 3-night stay. When I booked the hotel, the service was fairly reasonable. However due to change in plans, I emailed the hotel to cancel my reservations, just before leaving for Europe and some 10 days before my reservation. However my emails kept bouncing (about 6 times) and I had no choice but eventually called the hotel when I reached Paris to inform them, 3 days before my check-in date. Even getting through to them on the phone was difficult. The phone was either engaged or unanswered. When I finally got through, they refused to hear me out and simply insisted that I send them an email which of course I could not instantly since I was on the road. When I eventually got through to them, they claimed that I was late and proceeded to charge me for 1 night. On the contrary my experience with another Paris hotel was so much better. The staff at Hotel Castex was so helpful and patient. I will never book Hotel Muguet again despite all the good reviews about them.

Reviews.Title: “For "Clean", this is a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: AltaPat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Muguet from June 4 to 17, to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. If you like a spotless room, then you can't go wrong here. The bedding, linen, towels, carpet and bathroom were immaculate. I believe one of the reasons the room was so pristine is that eating in the room is forbidden, as is smoking and ironing. We both missed being able to bring back a quick bite after a busy day or having a snack in the evening. If you want to iron, you have to make arrangements to do so elsewhere in the hotel. You' ll see from the pictures I am attaching that the room, while attractive, was small and would be better suited for a shorter stay. For example, if one of us was sitting at the desk, the other would have to vault over the bed to get to the bathroom - this gets somewhat tedious after awhile - especially when you're over 60 :-).
