We should have paid 180 euros per night for a superior room instead of 135 euros for the queen room, but lesson learned. Our quiet room looked out over the courtyard and the windows opened up, both in the bedroom and bathroom - very pleasant to get the fresh air and hear the birds chirping in the morning. The bathroom had a shower - no tub - but there was good pressure and lots of hot water. Included toiletries were shampoo, conditioner, shower cap and tissues. A good make-up mirror attached to the wall in the bathroom was helpful. A hair dryer with a very short cord was attached to a drawer in the desk in the bedroom, making it awkward to stand up, look in the mirror and blow dry your hair but where there's a will, there's a way. The room had lots of closet and storage space but we didn't care for the bed - too hard, and the pillows were small and lumpy. The only English T.V. channels you could get were BBC and CNN but that didn't matter too much to us as we usually were out all day so were too tired to watch much T.V. in the evening. As the cost for the breakfast at the hotel was 9.50 euros per person, we usually picked up some croissants, beignets, etc. at a boulangerie and went to Starbucks on Rue Saint Dominique, total cost of about 7 euros for both of us - quite a savings. You could get coffee at the hotel for 2 euros a cup whenever you wanted it. The staff was always pleasant, courteous and very patient with my garbled French. We did miss being able to get ice although you could get coke, etc. from a machine in the lobby. You also have free access to Internet in the lobby but are restricted to 15 minutes, which to me is fair, so that everyone gets a chance to use it. A policy that we haven't encountered in ages was having to leave your key at Reception every time you went out and claim it when you came back, though I suppose this is good for security. The same card that was used as the key had to be inserted into a slot in the room to enable the lights to work. The hotel itself was in an excellent, safe location, close to the Rue Cler, the Eiffel Tower and many cafes and boulangeries. La Tour Maubourg Metro was at the end of the street so we were able to get around everywhere we wanted to go, either by the Metro (and transferring) or walking. Its about an hour or so walk to the Louvre from this hotel if you want a little exercise to help wear off the calories from those delicious French pastries. For something a little different, after you've looked at many of the museums, monuments and attractions, take the metro out to see the Grande Arche de la Defense, which is the last stop west on the No. 1. We were astonished to see the high rise buildings in this area, some quite spectacular in design - modern Paris that you never see in the guide books. There's a Hilton Hotel steps from the Metro at the Grande Arche, and a shopping mall across the street, so a person could tour traditional Paris in the daytime but sleep in modern Paris at night. In summary, we had an enjoyable stay at the Hotel Muguet, which we recommend for a short stay if you book a simple Queen room.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: FancyDay
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at other Paris hotels of same size, price, amenities, but Hotel Muguet won our hearts. The location in the 7eme arr. on the quiet rue Chevert is a huge bonus. The hotel itself and our room were exactly what I expected. Yes, the rooms are small - no surprise. The bathroom was quite new with better towels than I've found in other properties. We never eat breakfast, but the Muguet's breakfast buffet is exceptionally bountiful for the price. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “close to Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: cnkSeattle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two young adult children stayed 3 nights at Hotel Muguet. Our rooms were comfortable and spacious. We had one double with a king size bed and a twin room with two twin beds. Breakfast was not included in the hotel charge. We ate our breakfast on Rue Cler the first morning, but decided to purchase the Muguet breakfast after that. We found it to be generous and tasty, with a basket of bread, croissant, and pastry for each diner, cold cereals, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, and fresh fruit from a buffet. Hotel Muguet is in walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, close enough for us to walk to the park east of the tower to view it at night. It is very close to Rue Cler with its fresh produce, restaurants, and stores. Though it is close to a Metro stop, we did not like the transfers at the Invalides station which is quite large.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Below Average Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Blake C
Reviews.Content: Bottom Line: The location alone almost makes it worth dealing with the staff at Hotel Muguet... almost. I would definitely recommend the area and if this is the only place you can get into, go for it! Cons: - The staff is condescending and ridiculously moody. I'm not a big fan of annoying tourists so, for the most part, I usually side with hotel staff in most instances; but the staff here are just unpleasant. - The rooms are very small, but personally, small doesn't bother me all that much - Couldn't access WiFi in my room (they advertise as having such) Pros: - Location! Close to the Eiffel Tower and across the street from the Rue Cler neighborhood. - Bathrooms are remodeled - WiFi and computer in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JPTravel2008
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and would definitely go back. The room itself was very clean and even spacious for Paris. To note that there is a no food policy in the rooms which also means no tea or coffee facilities in the rooms. We thought this was a good trade off for having such a clean room and considering the price this was not an issue for us. You can always sit in the breakfast room any time after breakfast with your own food/wine if you like. We ate most of our meals al fresco in the gardens surrounding the Eiffel Tower (5min walk). There is also a very good wine shop right next to the hotel with a very good selection. The 9â‚¬ breakfast was a bargain considering what the overpriced cafes in the surrounding area were charging. We did a Paris bike tour which was the highlight of our trip and I can see why it is the no1 attraction on trip advisor! On the tour guides recommendation we ate at a excellent restaurant on the corner of Rue de l'Abre Sec and Rue Saint-Honore near the Louvre. Just perfect if you want some reasonably priced French fair. I canâ€™t remember the full name but it had Rue de l'Abre Sec in the title. The Steak Tar Tar and Lamb casserole was excellent and I will be returning there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: jimlin99
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our first visit to Paris. We are of the younger retiree set and speak practically no French. We chose the Rue Cler neighborhood for our stay, did extensive research on hotel offerings before selecting Hotel Muguet where we spent 5 nights - a truly wonderful experience. The hotel itself is beautiful, the staff friendly, helpful and accommodating with the location and price great as well! We spent 135 euro per night for a double with a large comfortable bed, a large desk area, ample wardrobe/closet, safe, bathroom w/shower and while not tons of extra space, we were very comfortable, had room for all our luggage (and we overpacked so had BIG luggage), AND it was spotless! There is a beautifully decorated and welcoming reception/sitting area as well as computer for guest use. Though many suggested opting for a bakery or cafe for breakfast, we chose the morning buffet at Hotel Muguet which is served until 10:30 for a little over 9 euros and consisted of many choices, including omelets, in a charming enclosed garden area where it afforded the opportunity to eat with other guests in a relaxing, homey atmosphere. We were within walking distance to such sites as the Eiffel Tower, Seine River, Army Museum, Napolean's Tomb, Rodin Musuem and within a couple of blocks of a taxi stand for all others. The neighborhood was very inviting, safe, with many wonderful cafes, markets and other shopping. Even a laundry a couple of blocks down which we used prior to leaving for the next leg of our trip. Someone, knowing we tend to be a bit "fussy" about our accommodations, asked wasn't there anything about Hotel Muguet less than wonderful....all we could come up with was the elevator is small but that's the case most everywhere outside the US.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - will be back”
Reviews.Author: djhskh
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for two nights in June. We booked and received two triples with views of the Eiffel Tower. They did not disappoint - just beautiful. Regarding WiFi -if you have your own laptop you can connect in your room for free so I never bothered with the computer in the lobby. We ate breakfast both mornings - though it was expensive, we ate enough so we didn't have to have lunch. It is a quick walk to the Eiffel Tower and to La Tour Marbourg metro stop. Yes, the beds are hard but I liked them. BBC World was on the tele as well as various French channels, CNN and one station that showed National Treasure in Italian - our kids liked that! Reception is not overly friendly with the exception of Catherine who was quite nice. But I'd read not to expect exuberence from the French so I wasn't offended by their reserve. We will definitely come to Paris and when we do we will come back to Le Muguet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: freckle1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, less than 10 minute walk to the Eiffel tower. rooms were very small but lovely modern decor and immaculately clean. Staff were helpful and polite. Breakfast not included which is a pity as there was a lovely breakfast room, which had a retractable roof and courtyard garden, for those wishing to pay extra. There are plenty of lovely cafes around for breakfast in any case. No facilities to speak of, which explains the 2 star rating but the location more than makes up for that. Highly recommended and i will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Westwinds4
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Muguet a good base in Paris, on a quiet street in an attractive area. The decor is sober, but smart. The rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Free internet, though you have to fight to get on the machine. We enjoyed the breakfasts at â‚¬9.50. Refills of coffee and additional choice were worth the extra for us. The lift failed one morning, and had also done so the previous week. This might be an issue for some travellers. Now quite expensive, with the rise in the euro, but probably as good value for the quality as you are going to find. We would certainly choose it again. We liked the hotel and the area. Restaurant Pasco, at the end of the street, was the nearest and best we found in our stay. We got Paris Visite passes and cracked the bus system. Buses are great for a tourist who is not in a rush. Near the hotel, Bus 28 goes from Avenue de la Motte Picquet to the Champs Elysees. Bus 69 from Rue St Dominique or de Grenellle to Bastille, Bus 80 from Rue Bosquet to Montmartre. There is a route map at each bus stop. And you get a chance to enjoy French driving as a spectator sport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, it, loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 1SGTommy
Reviews.Content: Catherine Pelletier, the owner, has created a little gem. She completely remodeled the place three years ago, and her excellent taste is evident. First-class decor, large bathrooms with thick towels, big tubs, flat panel TV, Wi-Fi, the works. We had a triple room and the third bed was actually in its own separate area. All in all a quite charming little inn. The Muguet is convenient to the Eiffel Tower, the Metro, and the Rue Cler (my wife's favorite morning stop). We walked virtually everywhere from there, including the Louvre and other museums. The only negative I can possibly think of is the relatively expensive breakfast (9.50 Euros), but I just usually skipped that anyway to hit the streets. I highly recommend this hotel and sill stay there again next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: SpikeDaisy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Muguet. Our hotel room was clean, tastefully decorated, and average in size by European standards. The bathroom was small, modern, and upgraded. The staff were friendly and helpful. Internet use is free, but as another reviewer noted is spotty. The location can't be beat in Paris. It is close to the metro and the wonderful little street of Rue Cler. Also a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides. The hotel serves a breakfast in a charming dining area, but at 9.5 euros is quite expensive. A better option is to grab some pastries, cheeses, meats and wine from the shops and bakeries on Rue Cler. Beware food is not allowed in the hotel rooms. Only complaints were the bed was pretty hard and no fridge in room. We would definitely stay here again, but may consider other hotels in the area near Rue Cler that could be a better value.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: ocmglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: Good and affordable hotel close to the Eiffel Tower, Napoleon's Tomb and across from the Ecole Militaire. Highlights of this hotel were that it was 2 metros close by (5 mins from hotel), a grocery store (Shopi) and a very good french bakery for fresh croissants and ham and cheese baguettes. Post office was also down the street for anyone who likes sending out postcards. About the hotel itself: good size, clean rooms, compact washroom. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside was that everything seemed to close at 9:00 PM so if we wanted late night entertainment or food, we'd have to take a cab to the L'opera (1ere arrondisement). Would recommend to those interested in a quieter, less hectic part of paris that is still within close proximity to all the touristy attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and a bonus: Great Bath sheets!!”
Reviews.Author: annied01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Muguet on our honeymoon in May 2006, twice : once upon arriving in Paris for a few days and again after the Loire, before heading home, so altogether more than a week. We loved it! It was in a nice quiet neighbourhood, walking distance to everything we needed, close to the Metro, and a really good deal as well, even the breakfasts which were extra were great value for the money. We were spoiled for other France hotels after this. We loved it so much, we bought 2 bath sheets from the owner for our home before heading back. She had never had such a request! I did find like most places in France that the staff were friendlier once we were there for a few days. Careful with the internet code they give you though, other ppl might be using it. We were charged a few times for usage at times when we were out of the building. They weren't that keen on fixing it but did in the end. We would definitely stay here again when we go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Beautiful, Super Clean and Well Appointed”
Reviews.Author: funmegg
Reviews.Content: Charming and comfortable hotel. A little expensive with the horrible exchange rate right now, but I imagine if you're not counting that its a really great bargain. The rooms are tiny, of course, but beautiful. Everything is new and clean, and operates properly. Very quiet hotel, quiet street, and near a bunch of restaurants. We found the breakfast (9 euro each) to be out of our budget, so we simply ate at the many markets on Rue Clar throughout the week. You cannot eat in your room, but there are many park benches on which to enjoy your breakfast. Also, the breakfast room is open for use by all guests, except in the morning. It was quite popular for guests to bring sandwiches, takeout and wine and enjoy it in the lovely room for dinner. Great neighborhood, too. Front desk staff were helpful, and someone was always around. Romantic, clean, great location, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: happymama123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 5 nights in April 2008. We arrived late via Gare du Nord, and the check in process was the easiest I have ever encountered. They simply asked us our name and gave us a key! I guess since we had reserved with a credit card they had no need to make a copy of it. The hotel is a wonderfully appointed 2 star hotel. When you think of a 2 star in the U.S. you think of a roadside motel, but that was not the case with Hotel Muguet. Everything in that hotel was immaculately clean. Yes, the rooms are small but thatâ€™s what you get everywhere in Paris. The rooms were well decorated and very clean. The bathroom looked quite modern and as if it had just been remodeled. My husband did not like that the shower door was a half a sheet of glass, but I think that is standard in most European hotels. From our window you could see a partial view of the Eiffel Tower. Our likes were the free wi-fi, the close proximity to Rue Cler and 2 metro stops, the cleanliness of the rooms and the friendliness of the staff. Our dislikes were the half sheet of glass shower door and the small size of the rooms. We would definitely stay here again. The location is perfect for Rue Cler and close to 2 metro stops so you can go anywhere in Paris. We had dinner on Rue Cler most nights and walked to the Eiffel Tower in the evening a couple of times as well. It is also very close to the Rodin Museum and that was one of our favorites as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: August12Mexico
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there on our honeymoon trip last year and we loved the hotel. We arrived pretty early in the morning so the room wasn't ready yet, but they kept our luggage so we could start our vacation. We returned at checkin time and our room was ready. The room was very well decorated, super clean and very comfortable. I had been reading reviews of hotels in Paris and they all said they were very small, but the room we got at this hotel was big enough for both of us, we never complained of not fitting or having to stump on each other....the only complaint I would mention is that on our arrival the elevator did not work and we had to go several floors up thru the stairs with very heavy luggage. But the elevator got fixed the next day and everything was fine. I would strongly recommend this hotel since its also very near cafes, restaurants, grocery stores, etc....We had a lovely time there, consider it if you are on a tight budget but still want a clean, comfortable and spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again.”
Reviews.Author: Tellytubby
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days (one single and one double). Rooms very nicely decorated and clean, maybe on the small side. Flat screen tv, although it only had two English -speaking channels (CNN and BBC World). Double room had good shower and bath, but the single only had a shower and the bathroom was VERY small and an average-to-large size person would have trouble getting into the shower because one half-door could not open out. No tea-making facilities in the room and only expresso coffee available from reception at night. The room key passes were a bit of a pain - they were the sliding 'credit card' type and we frequently had to have several attempts. Breakfast was a choice of four cereals, unlimited self-served coffee, lovely fresh bread, cold croissant-type offerings, a limited supply of cheese, fruit, etc. All good. The breakfast area was fairly small, but nice, so there could easily be delays. No bar, but there was a drinks machine.There was free internet use of a computer in reception - although it was often occupied. Three minutes from the Metro and handy for restaurants and bars in Rue Cler. 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. The hotel was very quiet. Lift was very small - room for three people without luggage. Don't go if you want warm refreshments away from breakfast times, or alcohol, or English TV. Otherwise - definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, Not Bad, Not Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: bluejoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights last week-end and found the hotel to be nothing special. The decor is tired in Reception/Breakfast Room (somewhat more up-to-date in the room) and the service was no better than fair for most of my stay. I'm not sure what others have seen that warrants such a high ranking on Tripadvisor.com, but I have to say, I did not. My room was quiet, the wi-fi worked, but the connection was so low that I couldn't use it reliably. The room and all I saw of the hotel was clean and the lift worked well. The room was not spacious but comfortable and large enough for one (it might have been a little too cozy for two as the door to the toilet/shower was close to the bed and was small as well. The location is good and I haven't stayed in this part of Paris before, so I was able to get acquainted with the neighbourhood, which is very near rue Cler (pedestrian street). It was a little inconvenient to get to the 6th/5th, and most Metro trips I took required at least one change. It is an easy walk to either La Tour-Maubourg or Ecole Militaire. Breakfast was okay and less expensive than other hotels (9,50â‚¬).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobLethbridge
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in the last few years and found not only the accommodation to be superb, but the owner and staff to be of exceptional. The price of accommodation is I believe very good value.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JLaing
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a great location. Friendly and helpful staff and spotless rooms. There is a computer available in the lobby. Easy walking distance from many attractions and only a couple of blocks from two Metro stations. Breakfast was an extra 9.5 euros but it was a full buffet and worth it for us. We enjoyed dining at Pasco, Florimond and Le P'tit Troquet in the neighborhood. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Little Sanctuary in Paris”
Reviews.Author: OmakaseSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this little gem during the 3rd week of March. We had room 33, which has 2 twin beds, a shower and a view of Rue Chevert over the entrance to the hotel. We had a little street noise, but not anything that would prevent a good night sleep. The property is immaculate, comfortable and cozy. Our room was small, but we were there mostly to sleep anyway. When we pulled out the chair to the desk to use our laptop, the other had to walk across the beds to get to the bathroom. The room was well appointed and decorated. There were plentiful extra linens, blankets and pillows. Our mattresses were very comforatble. The bathroom was spotless and modern with a heavy soundproofed sliding door to help keep from disturbing light sleepers. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Rue Cler, major tourist sites and two Metro stops. If you're driving an Avis car, there is an office within 2 easy blocks and 2 gas stations nearby to refuel your tank. There are plenty of cafes, bistros, brasseries, and restaurants nearby. A convenient laundromat is at the far end of Rue Chevert. There are plenty of grocery stores and bakeries for snacks and drinks. Two of the mornings one of us went down for coffee to bring back up to the room for 2 euros per cup. The last day we had the breakfast for 9.5 euros and it was well worth it. It included the usual bread basket (croissant, chocolate croissant, part of a baguette), and self-service yogurt, boiled eggs, cereal, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, milk, sliced ham & salami, jams, cheeses and more. You can request a cooked to order omlette (plain, cheese, ham) that's ready in minutes. We loved it and felt it was a great value. We had giggles about the ladies at the front desk. They were efficient but didn't smile often. We took them some snacks one day and their smiles just lit up. Another, who stopped us from having coffee one morning, we dubbed the "coffee Nazi", but we ended up finding a way to melt the ice there, too. The owner, Catherine Pelletier, is a charming and beautiful host. With the weak dollar, we're not sure when we'll have a chance to get back to Paris. When we do, we'll be happy to stay at the Hotel Muguet again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: PES389
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that we have used the comments in TripAdvisor as the selection basis for a hotel and I would observe that, on the basis of our experience, all the positive things that have been written about this hotel are true. The adjective that comes to mind to describe the Hotel Muguet is impeccable! It looks impeccable from the outside, the entrance hall is impeccably furnished, the staff are impeccably dressed and your room will be as spotlessly clean as other visitors have commented. The rooms are adequately sized by European standards and the majority look out over a calm, light, airy courtyard. If you want a view of the Eiffel Tower ask explicitly for such a room and expect to pay significantly more for it. We enjoyed the breakfast that is served in the delightful glass-topped courtyard breakfast room. The choice includes ham, cheese, yoghurt, fruit and eggs as well as the traditional bread, croissant and jam and the hotel will prepare an omelette on demand. The price is only 2 euros more than we have paid for a similar quality breakfast in the French provinces and we consider it good quality and value for Paris. The only negative consideration about this hotel would be if you had an aversion to lifts (elevators) and steep stairs. The lift is modern and big enough for 2 people but the stairs are quite steep and they curve. They are very well lit with banister rails and we had no problem with them but I could imagine that someone with a fear of descending steep stairs might find them intimidating. That is the only downside that I can envisage with this hotel and it did not impact our stay at all. We would endorse all the positive comments made about this hotel and would be very pleased to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay, not as great as thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: roop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Rick Steve's recommendaton. It was a convenient location near Rue Cler. The staff are not friendly and don't seem to know much about tourism to assist with daily needs. I do recommend the breakfast, you can get a better breakfast here than elsewhere in Rue Cler. The one nice thing, is that this is a non-smoking hotel, so if you have allergies, then it may be worth the price. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, charming and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: erin_japan
Reviews.Content: My family and I just stayed at Muguet the weekend of March 7 - 9, 2008. Being our first time to Paris we relied on Trip Advisor and others for a recommended hotel. Be aware that hotels in Paris are hit or miss. Muguet is a 2-star hotel, but it was much nicer than some 3 star hotels. Hotel impression: The Muguet is very comfortable and clean, clean, clean. The furniture and decor is very warm and looks new. Flat screen TV, large mirror, and desk. I would wake each day well rested and since the weather was cold while we were there, the heater was always on, which works very well. It is a very cosy place to stay and rest after a day of sightseeing. Hotel rooms and bathrooms: My room: Queen Size bed. Our room had 2 double windows and a larger bathroom because it had a tub with overhead shower. My parents room: Queen Size bed. The room had 1 double window, but their bathroom had another window. There was only a standing shower. Advice - if you want a larger shower area, request a room with a tub. Hotel staff: they are decent, but not the most forthcoming in helping with directions. Wish they were more friendly. Hotel food: We did not eat there. Pricey for what it is for 9 Euros. The breakfast was a little fruit, yogurt, cereals, hard boiled egg and omelet if requested. I recommend eating at Cafe Central on Rue Cler - delicious Nicoise Salad and foie gras... Location: The hotel on Rue Chevert is not easy to find the first time. From the Metro 8 line, when you exit at Ecole Militaire station, take a right. You will pass Rue Cler on the left side (great street with many restaurants and outdoor market). Cross the street to your right side. You will come up on Rue Boullagerie ( spelling?) make a right down this little street and you will dead end into Rue Chevert. Make a left and you will see Muguet right in front. Eiffel Tower is within walking distance, but can be a bit confusing. Also Versailles can be reached if you take the metro 8 and change at Invalides. Get on the RER C line that goes direct to Versailles.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Very clean room”
Reviews.Author: WNY_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: Good location in the 7th arrondissement near the Eiffel tower and Les Invalides. Near 2 or 3 metro stations. A little hard to find at first on Rue Chevert. Nice neighborhood with a good selection of restuarants. The hotel is modern with no signs of wear or tear. The room is immacuately clean. The bed is firm like other reviews mentioned but I found it just fine for me. The room is small and the desk is effectively useless because of the closeness to the bed. The bathroom is also very small and the shower booth is too small for most people. But the water pressure was great and I like the choice between the rain shower head and the hand shower head. Nice LCD TV with good channel selection. The free wifi is a *major* plus. I didn't have the breakfast as it did not seem to be a good deal at 9 euros. Pros: * Free wifi * location * very modern/clean room Cons: * Small Bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Overall A Decent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Raeleanne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 2 nights in February of 2008. We chose this hotel based on Rick Steve's recommendation and the reviews on this site. PROS - Location. Although we did have some inital difficulty finding the hotel that was more my poor sense of direction than anything else. We really liked how close to the metro station and to the Rue Cler it is. - Furnishings were nice and the look of the hotel was very tidy and clean. The bed had a nice foam mattress that was comfortable. The wardrobe was small and I closed my fingers in the slidding doors a couple of times, not sure that is the fault of the wardrobe though. - The bathroom, although small, was nicely appointed. I liked the option of the rain shower head or the handheld. The towels were also nice and fluffy and the towel warmer is a very nice touch. - The hotel room was VERY quiet. And for tired travellers this was a key feature. CONS - The bed was comfortable but the pillows were not to my taste. They were kind of hard and small but my husband didn't mind them. - The bathroom was very tiny and as such it was difficult to move around in there. The shower doors did not shut properly so water either poured out on the floor or the doors were pointed into the already cramped stall. Neither my husband or I are very big people so it was ok, but if you were a larger person you might find this a problem. We did not take part in breakfast so I can't comment on that. But there are great breakfast options a short walk away. The staff was fine. They did not wow me in any way but they didn't offend me either. I did find it odd that they took our room key away every time we left the building, but maybe that is a common thing in Paris, I don't know. And it did make me rather uncomfortable but we didn't have a problem. Overall a good stay though and I would consider going back to this hotel. Not a slam dunk but good.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: qtypie617
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 2/28-3/3 and chose this hotel partially because of the reviews from this web site. I can tell you that we were looking for a true small clean Paris hotel, convenient to sites and the Metro and not too expensive. Hotel Muguet is definitely a charming hotel that met all the above. The rooms are very nicely decorated, exceptionally clean and for the most part quiet. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel we decided we love the little bakery around the corner and were frequent visitors (Chocolate Amande...awesome!). The beds in the room are very hard for my taste (I am used to a soft pillow top). It was also very warm while we were there and really were glad to be able to open the windows for some fresh air. Yes the room was small but we were expecting that. For those of you that want an idea think a little bigger then your balcony room on a cruise ship. The bathroom was decent size and no complaints there. There is a hairdryer in the desk drawer and yes can be a little awkward as you really can't move far with it, it is fastened to the drawer but definitely good that I didn't have to pack my own. The bathroom was very nice and exceptionally clean. The shower was fantastic, love the rainfall shower or the option to use the hand held shower head. Our shower did tend to leak though on each of the corners but nothing a towel couldn't fix. The towels are wonderful and big you can wrap yourself up in one with plenty of fabric to spare. There is a towel warmer that is a wonderful touch dries the towels fast and nice to get out to a warm towel. Some downsides to the hotel. Yes my husband and I did try to plan out each and every day but there were times being newbies to Paris we would look for some help from the front desk but I was very sad to say the are not the most helpful with the exception of the night receptionist a gentleman, sorry I can't recall his name but went out of his way to help us use a calling card and help me with the computer. On our last day there my face wash also went missing from the shower. They clean so well that I thought it may have been mixed in with the towels or accidentally thrown away. I immediately went down to the front desk and explained that I didn't think anyone took it but that it could have gotten mixed up. The lady at the desk at the time kept thinking that I was saying that the chamber maid stole it. There is a little sweet elderly woman that is at the hotel from time to time she helped me look everywhere including digging through the garbage on the street and downstairs in the towels and it never turned up, makes me wonder. I was very disappointed in the way this was handled by the front desk clerk. In all I would consider staying here again. I am not one to let the latter experiences keep me from staying in this cute and convenient hotel. I do hope the staff learns to be more friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming, lovely and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Suzeeq2u
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here two nights. The hotel is extremely convenient to transit and the area itself is ultra charming. We specifically requested a room with a view of Eiffel and it was well worth it. The room was a very nice size with a sitting area. The weather was very nice for February and we even opened up the window to get a true feel/view. It's easy to walk to the Eiffel Tower as it is such a large beacon--but make sure to have a map or know your way back because it can get a little confusing and we did get lost! I would highly recommend this for anyone, particularly adults.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character!”
Reviews.Author: RBtwinky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Muguet based on a guidebook recommendation, and we couldn't be happier. We paid a little extra for a room with a partial view, and were treated to the lights of the Eiffel Tower every night on the hour. We had a little balcony outside our windows with living plants. The staff was incredibly helpful and kind. We left our bags the morning that we checked out, and then came back that evening to pick them up and had some time to kill. The staff insisted that we stay in the breakfast area and make ourselves comfortable. The whole place was impecibly clean. The Rue Cler area is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: keroppiNyc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Muguet is a great hotel in a great part of Paris. My husband and I went for our third anniversary and had no complaints about the hotel. The room was large by European Standards and super clean. The staff was very nice and accomodating. They helped us arrange for a car back to the airport during the rail strike. The location is very good also - near the Rue Cler. The Creperie on Rue Cler is very nice - we found better dining on other areas around Rue Cler. Due to the transit strike we ended up walking almost everywhere - but we like to walk so we did not mind.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: simulcrum
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in mid December 2007. Room was small, very clean (as everyone notes) and good bathroom (shower only for us). We had a charming view of the Eiffel Tower, which sparkled at us as we drifted to sleep. That makes up for a lot. That said, though, the beds are very hard. Both I (57) and my neice (27) tossed and turned a lot, so if you are sensitive, be warned. I know many may prefer that firmness. We loved the location, particularly easy access to Rue Cler. I picked the 7th because I stayed in the 1st last year and wanted a different orientation. If it's your first trip, I'd still recommend the 1st, but if you are picking a new area to explore, I recommend this one -- the area and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: lfos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December for 1 night - it was my first time in Paris and I count myself very lucky to have found such a wonderful little hotel. It wasn't cheap (150 euros including two buffet breakfasts), but not too expensive either, and well worth the money. The room was small but adequate, clean, peaceful and very comfortable. Everything was well decorated throughout the building, even the outside is pretty. The location, just excellent - it's so close to the Eiffel Tower, and seconds from a metro station. I would recommend it to anyone spending a weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel in Paris for evermore!”
Reviews.Author: fool4travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 10 different hotels on our blitz trip through Europe in September '07. Hotel Muguet stood out. This is the absolute cleanest hotel room I have ever stayed in. And, yes, I have stayed in the Westin, Sheraton, etc. And, yes, I still say it is the CLEANEST!! I felt like it was MY room. And that is just the beginning of my compliments to Hotel Muguet!! Location is superb! So close to the Eiffel Tower, Rue Claire, yet off the main streets so it was quiet. Very clean and very safe! It is close enough to other major attractions as well. We walked everywhere!! Staff was very welcoming, helpful and patient explaining directions and other French things to me! We were there for almost a week and I never once was bothered by housekeeping! They were so stealthy in cleaning the rooms! Our rooms were cozy but quite large by Paris standards, I am certain. I could go on and on. I was so pleased, we are planning to return yet again sometime next year with my parents to slow down and really soak up that wonderful French culture!! I recommend this hotel for anyone except partyers wanting a loud, wild time. Way too quiet and peaceful for that!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: surfbeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Muguet late December, early January for 5 nights, we had a room with a view of the Invalides, which was lovely when lit up at night. The hotel itself is charming, spotless and in a super location. Lovely and quiet, even on New Years Eve, but easy to get to other places as the Metro is just down the street. Also a very short walk from the Eiffel Tower, believe there are some rooms which have views of the Tower. Our room, although small, was beautifully decorated, and had plenty of closet space. The bathroom was large enough in size and it was obvious that it had been recently renovated, as had our room. We ate breakfast there 3 out of the 5 mornings, and actually found it better value than going to Rue Cler, if you consider that you not only get your pastries and bread, confiture and butter, you get yoghurt, cereal, meats, Cheeses, Juice and of course coffee, and can go back for seconds, as it is served buffet style. It is possible to use their iron, between certain hours, and there is internet in the foyer for 2 euros per half hour. Think there is 2 English speaking TV channels. Now, our only negative observation was the reception, we arrived on the Friday night, and right through the weekend, the reception was far from enthusiastic, in fact it was decidely cool. There was a distinct change in attitude from Monday morning with a change of staff. This area could be given some concentration by Management, because other than this, it is a really super and charming hotel. I would stay there again, and the location is lovely in a very nice part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Love Paris, Love Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: kjw123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 5 nights in early December with my wife and 2 year old son. Some aspects of this review are biased to those with a similarly aged child since I would have been grateful for this sort of information before our trip. Apologies in advance if this is not relevant to you. I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and it does live up to expectations set by the reviews here and by its classy website. We were originally going for a hotel in the 90-100 Euro range but couldn't book the one we wanted (even in December). The Hotel Muguet was the next one in the overall ratings for Paris (#24) although it was a bit more expensive at 130 Euros per night. With hindsight, it was a very good decision and well worth the extra 150 Euros in total - I've already forgotten the extra cost but the memories of the trip will last a lifetime. The Hotel Muguet is classy, clean, cosy and comfortable with very friendly staff. We ended up in room 36 which I think is normally a triple room but we only paid the 130 Euro rate. I think we got it because of needing space for a cot for our son. That might not happen in high season but it was most welcome. The bed was huge and the room very large too. There was plenty of room for us, our luggage, the cot and our pram. The bathroom was also a decent size too - not palatial but bigger than I had expected based on reviews of most Paris hotels. There are places to have breakfast in Rue Cler (1 minute walk away) for 6-8 Euros but we chose to have breakfast in the hotel (9.5 Euros). It has a very pleasant dining area with extremely friendly baby-loving staff. We found it was a nice relaxing start to the day and we appreciated not having to rush out to have breakfast. Our son had juice and some bread and yoghurt each morning but we were not charged for his breakfast. One word of caution though - there were no baby chairs in the dining area. The chairs wrap around so they were fine for our 2 year old but I'd check with the hotel in advance if you're taking a younger child. In fact, we found baby chairs elusive throughout Paris - except in McDonald's ! We got a taxi from (Monday evening) and to (Saturday morning) the Eurostar at Gare du Nord and both trips cost 14 Euros which we thought was very good value for money. Definitely recommended over hauling the pram and luggage though the metro system. There were no child seats in the taxis but the drivers didn't drive fast so we didn't feel it was a huge risk. Not ideal but I'd do it again. We would highly recommend using the excellent and underrated bus network. We tried one trip on the metro and that was enough - no lifts and very crowded, so no fun with a pram. The buses are very frequent (every 10 minutes or less), each bus stop provides lots of route information and a live system indicating how long the next bus will be and, best of all, each bus has double doors which are great for prams and there is a large dedicated space inside for prams. Get yourself one of the RATP daily or weekly passes. There are several bus stops within a 2 minute walk of the hotel serving several useful bus routes. One goes all the way to Montmartre (past the bottom of the Champs ElysÃ©e), another right past the Arc de Triomphe (at the top of the Champs ElysÃ©e) (great fun in a bus with all the traffic converging !) and another all the way along the Left Bank past St.Germain des PrÃ©s. In addition, you can get just about anywhere with one or two easy connections. You also get a good view of the city while you're travelling and you meet lots of friendly Parisians who seem to love making faces at babies. The neighbourhood around the hotel seems very safe. Since we were there in December, we were often walking to and from the bus stops, Rue Cler (restaurants, supermarkets) and the Eiffel Tower after dark and we always felt very comfortable and secure. So, overall, a great hotel with great staff in a great location in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ree-Travels
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple for a girls vacation in Paris. This hotel exceeded our expectations for the price we paid. The room was clean and modern. I'd post my photos, but they look exactly like all the others posted! It was small, but had enough room for us to move around. The staff was very helpful, and the location was perfect. Close to the Metro. Within walking distance to many great restaurants and shops, not to mention the Eiffel Tower. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: mzsunnyblonde
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I got engaged in Paris! This hotel was amazing. My fiance mentioned that the website was hard to book through though. If you have never been to Paris before book the room with the view. This hotel is clean. The staff were very pleasant. Each morning we got fresh croissants and breads. The nearby metro had some glitch so we always got in for free! The hotel location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: midwestm0m
Reviews.Content: We returned from a trip to Paris just over a week ago and stayed at the Hotel Muguet, recommended by the RS guidebook. Even though the metro was down, we were able to walk to the Eiffel Tower, stroll through the Rue Cler neighborhood and even walk to the Louvre. Our room was small compared to US rooms, but tasteful and clean, with free wi-fi and partial view of the Eiffel Tower, at a reasonable rate. Nice breakfast in a "garden" like room off of an enclosed garden/patio area. Because of transportation problems, they scheduled a van service to bring us back to the airport. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: roundtowngirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for four nights in October. This is a wonderful hotel. It has a true Parisian feel and look. We arrived around 11:00 am and were greeted cordially. We were given a place to store our luggage and took a few moments to freshen up in the lobby WC. It turned out that our room was ready and we were able to check in early. We were in a room on the third floor - I believe it was room 36. The room was nicely decorated, very clean and large by European standards. We did not have a view of the tower or Invalides, but our room did look out over the hotel courtyard. The people who run and take care of the hotel were very friendly. The lift was able to accomodate both my husband and I and two pieces of carry-on luggage. The lobby was nicely decorated and very clean. Breakfast is offered in the morning, but we chose to eat at cafes instead. There is a drink machine in the lobby and coffee is available throughout the day. I needed to press some clothes and was allowed to go to the basement and use the iron. There is a computer in the lobby and internet access is available for a couple of Euros for a half an hour. Location is key with this hotel. We were in Paris during the transportation strike and we were able to walk everywhere. The Eiffel Tower is about a 10 - 15 minute walk. The neighborhood was very safe and relatively quiet after dark. Rue Cler is a 5 minute walk and the Metro is very nearby. There is also a velib (bike) rental stand less than a block away. I would definately recommend this hotel to travelers who want to stay in a quiet, conveniently located neighborhood. The hotel employees are very friendly and helpful. Our hotel was one of the many highlights of an amazing trip!

Reviews.Title: “High quality base for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: Alibongo42
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews, we were not disappointed with this hotel. We stayed in one of the cheapest rooms. It couldnâ€™t be described as spacious, but also wasnâ€™t tiny. For the purpose of a base from which to explore Paris, it was excellent. We were very impressed with the quality of the furniture and dÃ©cor. The hotel serves breakfast (which we didnâ€™t try), and coffee is available at all times from reception. Make sure you have a map that actually shows the street the hotel is on. It wasnâ€™t on ours, and we only found it by accident! It is on a quiet residential street, just around the corner from some gorgeous bars and restaurants. For those who are happy to put in a bit of longish, but easy walking on a site-seeing weekend, you can walk almost anywhere. The metro station (Lâ€™Ecole Militaire) is only a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel is also quite close to the Lâ€™Ecole Militaire stop of the hop-on/hop-off bus tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelero65
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first visit to Paris and I am in love!!! Now I understand why people go back. Stayed at Hotel Muguet 10/15-10/18. The 7th is an upscale residential area. Beautiful and very safe at nights. Our room was 170 euros per night, very nice queen bedroom with a separate sitting area, reading nook and very large writing area. Bathroom new and very modern. Very hot water and strong shower pressure. Plenty of large towels, wash rags, etc. Three large windows. Soundproof room. Very, very clean hotel. From our arrival to departure the staff wanted to please. We were very impressed with all staff especially the receptionist. The owner Madam Catherine was outstanding. For example, our departure on the 18th coincided with the transportation strike. The receptionist and owner worked tirelessly to arranged for a taxi to pick us up and take us to Gourd de Nord on the 18th so we could get the Eurostar back to London (we had to fly from London to Barcelona to get on our cruise ship). Breakfast was 9.50 euros and was worth the price. Tea, coffee, 4 different cereals, o/juice, boiled eggs, ham etc, omelets (cooked to order), assorted breads (so good), jelly, butter, fruits - and you can eat and drink all you want . We breakfast out second day but if you want more than one cup of coffee, you have to pay and husband has a large appetite (although not a large man),so had breakfast at the hotel the other days. Room had a safe and more shelves and hangers than we could use. Very good lighting, many lamps, at least four. Restaurants, supermarkets, metro within a few minutes walk. The negative (if you call it that) very small elevator. We would most definitely return and recommend Hotel Muguet to others. When we learn how to post the pictures we took, we will do so.

Reviews.Title: “Not memorable”
Reviews.Author: escapeaway
Reviews.Content: Satisfactory, sufficient, unimpressive, average and alright are words that all come to mind when I think of this hotel that we stayed in after travelling around Europe for 6 weeks. Of all the places we stayed, we liked this the least! The website of the hotel promises a peaceful and friendly atmosphere, neither of which were our experience. Our room was noisey at night. One of the reasons we booked was because the website says it is airconditioned. This is only true in summer. At other times of the year, like when were there in September, we had to open the window facing the street which meant lots of traffic noise and talkative passers-by! Usually being a light sleeper, I was up and down several times a night opening and then closing the window because of the noise! Recommended by Rick Steve, the hotel seemed to be full mostly of Americans. This may or may not be different at other times of the year. We found the staff polite and efficient but cool. Certainly not particularly friendly. On the second day of our 6 night stay we asked for help as our room safe had been locked open. The staff member who came to assist, indicated that since we hadn't complained earlier that we must surely have locked it open ourselves despite our protests that wasn't the case at all. This didn't leave a nice taste in our mouths. While the location is close enough to the metro, the Eiffel Tower and the Rue Cler markets to be convenient, we found it disappointing that not even tea or coffee facilites were in the rooms. It's a disadvantage to have to pay 2 Euro downstairs for an instant coffee rather than be able to make it yourself. We didn't eat breadfast there as it was an additional 9.50 Euro per person. Our family of 3 were able to have a delicious breakfast elsewhere for 12 Euro all up instead! Our room had comfortable beds and a lovely bathroom although it came with lots of rules such as no eating in the rooms and no ironing. Irons could only be gotten between certain hours. Once again quite restrictive. All in all I wish we had gotten an apartment in the area instead for the same money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwedeJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 6 nights at the Hotel Muguet this month. The hotel was very nice, the room a typical small European hotel room, comfortable with a queen bed, bath and shower with plenty of pressure and hot water, and a friendly staff. Breakfast was served in the hotel as an extra, but worth it. It is conveniently located to two Metro stops, and an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a quiet location which is easily accessible to the city, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Silvamint
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Muguet and found it perfectly charming and comfortable. We didn't get a room with a view of the Eiffel, but then again, we didn't ask for one, as it wasn't important to us. We did have a queen-size bed and a good-quality (if cramped) shower with a door. The place is entirely nonsmoking. We didn't eat breakfast there, but the Rue Cler market is close by with plenty of cheap choices. Aside from Rue Cler, there's not much going on in the neighborhood (the 7th, between Les Invalides and the Eiffel). But it's a safe, upscale residential area that's easy to get to at night by metro from anywhere. And being out of the more "happening" 5th and 6th districts is probably what makes this hotel more affordable than you'd expect. The only complaint I can come up with is that the free WiFi service in our room was very intermittent, but who wants to spend their time in Paris online anyway? Don't stay at the Muguet if you want to be right in the middle of shopping, nightlife, etc., but otherwise I'd recommend it in a second.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: KATEBEC
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights last week. 2 forty something women travelling together. found the hotel through tripadvisor & were not disappointed. situated down a quiet side street but easy to find & in a safe location,we were returning to hotel at 1am & still felt safe & welcomed by the night porter. hotel is spotlessly clean with towels changed daily. breakfast was fine also with a selection of cereals/pastries/cheeses/juice/yogurts/fruit etc. staff very pleasant & helpful not that you have need to bother them much as nothing to complain about. travelling to paris again in december & booked the hotel again which says it all really. TOP MARKS HOTEL MUGUET.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: tiny79
Reviews.Content: We (me with my significant other) stayed there 2 nights in July. There was no suprises and staff was very friendly. Room was very nice and cozy. Staff was able to talk english. We enjoyed breakfast outside because hotel was just walking distance away from little markets, where you can have bagels and fruits. This was great location to Eiffel and rest of the town. However I would suggest that you still you use metro if lot's of activies are planned in same in same day. It's so close to Eiffel you can just go there safely in night time to sit in a lawn and just enjoying the view. Head to the Latin Quarters for food and to see other side of the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BetsySolomons
Reviews.Content: Heard of this little hotel from a friend who checked the web. We were not disappointed. They were very friendly and the hotel is in an area which you can walk everywhere. We even came home at 11:30 p.m. from the Eifle Tower with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jitaly
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Muguet is very nicely decorated and is in a convenient location. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and it's right next to the metro. It is located on a side street. The only negative thing that I found was that they turned off the air conditioning during our stay (in September). It was still a little hot outside so we had to open our windows at night. There are no screens on the windows so bugs can come in and there was an occasional loud car or moped that would drive by and wake us up. Other than that we enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ducky51
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Muguet and were impressed with the quality of the room and loved the location. We had a triple room that had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. A 15 minute walk took us right to it. The room was spotless and very comfortable. The staff was helpful and professional. Martin was especially cordial. Quiet neighborhood close to the Ecole Militaire metro stop. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: R&RWales
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this great little hotel in central Paris. We usually saty in much larger hotels owned by groups and this was the first time we had decided to stay in an individually owned hotel. We were NOT disappointed!! (we did upgrade to a superior room) In fact if you woke up in the bedroom you would not know whether you were staying in a 4 star Hilton or in Hotel Muguet! The staff were very friendly, helpful and spoke good english. The room was very clean and toiletries were replenished daily. The decor was of an exceptionally high standard for a 2 star hotel! The location is great for exploring Paris. The hotel is only 10 mins from the Eiffel Tower and has numerous pattiseries and restaurants nearby. There is also a supermarket around the corner! It seems to be in a semi-residential area which felt very safe even late in the evening. Also there are 2 Metro stops within 5 mins walk of the Hotel. For this to be a balanced report we felt we should mention a few negatives (which were very small!) When we arrived we were given a room with 2 single beds instead of a Queen bed - however this was sorted out straight away and we were moved to another room. The second room was smaller because it was in the roof... but it did have a nice view of Invalides. The air conditioning made all the right noises but didn't really cool the room down! Opening the window was quite effective though!! All in all this is a great hotel. We feel it represents good value for money and would definately recommend it!!!! P.S. we did not take the Hotel's breakfast but we recommend getting some pasteries from one of the pattiseries and taking advantage of the close proximity of the Hotel to the Eiffel Tower gardens by having breakfast by the tower!

Reviews.Title: “A truly lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: keefco
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in Paris.We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 4 nights, had hoped to stay for 7, but could not get a booking for 7 nights and we had booked 4 months ago! This is a great hotel. The service is excellent. Very pleasant stay. It was my second time to stay there and would highly recommend it. R. Keefe, Vancouver, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Freindly, Classy and not stuffy”
Reviews.Author: PhilipGreenwood
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. Small and close to the Eiffel Tower. The service was attentive and we felt very welcome. Thank you to Catherine Pelletier who also, after the Paris City Passes did not arrive at the hotel, spoke to them at length to ensure our passes arrived the next day. Our room was very clean, modern, great bathroom and a very good view of the Eiflel Tower. Excellent casual food for breakfast and good wine shops on Rue Clare about a two minute walk from the hotel. We walked to Rodin Museum, Eiffel Tower, Champ de Elyesses and Bonapatre's Tomb. We are healthy mid 40's and able to make the trek. You are close to the metro to take you to Gare de Nord (North Train Station) that can take you to the north coast and the WW2 beaches near Caen. Over all (and I write this one year later) the trip was very memorable for my wife and 14 year old son and have absolutlely no regrets about our choice of hotel and recommending and staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Muguet”
Reviews.Author: lmolnar65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 3 nights at the end of July. We arrived in Paris at 10 am and check-in wasn't until 3 pm, but that was no trouble as we were allowed to leave our luggage at the front desk until our room was ready. The hotel is very clean, nicely decorated and staffed by friendly and accomodating individuals. Most speak English quite well, but did appreciate my attempts to speak/understand French. Our room was very small, typical of European hotel rooms, but since we did not intend to spend much time there, were not concerned by this. The bathroom was also very small and my husband, who is an average sized man by North American standards, had some difficulty closing the shower door behind him because it was a bifold 'in' instead of 'out'. Also, the shower stall was not caulked where it met the wall; if water sprayed there, it leaked out over the floor of the bathroom. That said, the rooms were spotlessly cleaned each day. The location of the hotel is perfect - close to the river, to the Eiffel tower, les Invalides, the d'Orsay, rue Cler and really everywhere you want to go (we walked to all of the above places, as well as to Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Latin quarter, etc, etc, etc,). If you return to your room very late and the front doors are locked, just ring the bell and the night person will cheerfully open them for you. At the end of the street, in the direction of les Invalides, there is a very good restaurant, on the corner, same side as the hotel ( I can't remember the name of it). We ate there on a Sunday. Both of us had the set menu (formule dimanche); it was delicious, cost only 36 euros each and included a 1/2 bottle of wine each. When dining out in Paris/France, the set menus offer very nice choices and are far more reasonably priced that ordering a la carte. Anyway, we strongly recommend the hotel Muguet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ozarkfolks
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to find this small, wonderfully updated hotel easy walk to Eiffel Tour, Invalides (Napoleons Tomb) and Musee Rodin (The Thinker). Hotel staff were pleasant, offered area map, locked storage and bathroom to freshen up on early morning arrival. We didn't try the breakfast as we wanted to explore the area. Stayed 3 nights and used the Paris Visite pass for transportation including from CDG airport, to Versailles, and the Nord station to catch the Eurostar to London. Overall fairly easy to use the RER, subway/light rail and bus (all included in Visite pass, we purchased 5 day 1-6 zone passes on arrival at CDG station). We also got Batobus passes which we didn't use as much, they take more time to stop, unload and load but nice to see Paris from the Seine, should have done only a one day. The hotel rooms are small but nicely decorated, bathrooms sparkle with white tile throughout. Has been noted previously, hair dryers are furnished but plugged in through dressing drawer, must stand up to see the mirror (in room), also need to keep on button pressed. Room card needs to be inserted in slot as enter the room for electricity, no trouble. Pleasant quiet side street location, one room had view of front street with geranium window box, second room next door had view of garden area in back. This hotel is clean, charming and the staff were helpful. Rooms are very small with a couple of feet between twin beds and other furnishings. 2 wardrobes with shelves, room safe, luggage rack, dressing table with a few drawers though not much room to sit there comfortably. Flat screen TV (BBC, CNN in English), reading lights, spa towels with bath mitt washcloths. We traveled with our 17 year old son and 10 year old daughter. Felt very safe and enjoyed the area, Rue Cler is a charming street to enjoy during the day with fresh markets and cafes, evening with dinner choices. Ecole Militaire was the most convenient tube stop within a couple of blocks. Small elevator (lift) will carry 2 people with suitcases. Well priced and though we thought we wanted to stay in one room, it was wonderful to have 2 bathrooms. Perfect for our needs. So glad we stayed close-in to experience Paris for the first time. We look forward to a return to Hotel Muguet!

Reviews.Title: “What a little Parisian hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: KellyWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Our family of seven adults began our 2-week Europe trip here at the Muguet for three nights in late July, and the reviews we read here beforehand were accurate. We found Muguet to be a terrific value. We enjoyed the fact that we could walk to the Eiffel Tower whenever we felt the desire to see it twinkle at night - this was one destinations we didn't have to plan into our daytime itineraries because we knew it was in our neighborhood. We used the Ecole M. subway station every day, and it was an easy 5-minute walk. If you're looking for an exciting neighbhorhood with walkable nightlife, though, you should probably find another part of the city. If you want nearby conveniences, the close Rue Cler offers a lot. We skipped the hotel breakfast and ate heartier options in Rue Cler each morning. We picked up some essentials - bottled water, snacks, etc - at the Rue Cler supermarket - on our first day. And before we caught a train to Belgium, we bought wine, fruit, bread, and cheese in the Rue Cler market for lunch on the train. Know, though, that some businesses on the lovely Rue Cler were closed in late July/early August when we were there. The rooms were more stylish than I remembered from the website's photos, with attractive fabrics, wood furniture, and a modern TV. All three rooms and bathrooms were impressively clean. We needed a hotel that offered triple rooms, and that narrowed our search considerably. Muguet's triple offered my mother-in-law a bit of her own space with a night stand and lamp, a place to put her suitcase, and a small wall between her area of the room and ours. The bed was a bit low and cot-like, so it is not for the difficult sleeper, though she didn't have any problems. The bathroom was small for three people, but not small by European standards. We had to keep our toiletries in our suitcases until it was our turn to shower. Service was efficient and professional. Checking in and out happened in a flash. We were surprised that a young man sleeping on the lobby's couch had to let us in when we returned late, but that's how a small hotel has to be - at least there wasn't a lockout time nor a lack of security. If you've chosen the 7th as your home in Paris, you cannot go wrong with the Muguet.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lizpaul
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real gem. Located near Les Invalides and the Rodin museum with the Rue Cler makrket and restaurants close by. The Metro was also near. Get a map from the front desk when you arrive as we got lost without one the first day as the hotel is in a quiet back street. Room was big by Parisienne standards with a good size bathroom and functional shower. No tea coffee facilities or fridge but hair dryer is in room Front desk staff were very helpful about day trips and restaurants. Catherine seemed to work there as well as in rooms helping clean them though she is the manager. Internet access was not always possibl;e but not vital on vacation. Breakfast was extra with bagettes and pastries but a cold area to take hard boiled eggs, yogurts, fruit and fruit cups plus cheese. We took some with us for lunch. Small elevator with room for 3 people which I found claustrophobic so used stairs. Would I go back? Yes most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel with nice quiet location close to Eiffel Tower.”
Reviews.Author: xenonian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H. Muguet in Room 61. this was a good sized room for a small hotel. This particular room on the top floor had a nice view of the Eiffel Tower. The elevator only goes to the 5th floor and you have to walk up some narrow. slightly winding stairs to get to the rooms on tthe 6th floor - so note this if you do not travel lightly. THE ROOM: beds are not that comfortable - rather hard foam 4 inch mattresses and seem to be low to the ground and short - maybe twin length (we are tall people - so this may account for our discomfort with the height and length of the beds) ;beds are two twin beds - we would push together at night and the maids would separate again when making the beds - not a big deal - but thought I would mention it here; room is decorated very nicely and the bathroom is a good size with all modern plumbing. (Ladies note: they have a hair dryer available - but it is hard wired into the vanity desk by the beds and has a VERY short cord.) There is a small armoire in the room and a safe. the armoire was fine for the 3 of us and our clothes for the week. (oh and we realized a day or so into our stay that lamps could not be moved - they were somehow "glued" down to their spots - we thought this was both hilarious and slightly annoying and you could not turn off and on the table lamps individually -the switches were also somehow "glued" shut). The lights in this room are controlled by your room card - (you'll see what I mean if you get here) THE STAFF: cordial but not particularly friendly - unusual for a small hotel - and striking since we had travelled to Amsterdam and Brussels before this during our trip and stayed at large Marriotts - and I have to say - the staff there were much more accomodating and friendly. They helped, but did not generally go out of their way for much. One morning , my 18yr old son got up early and went downstairs because we told him there was breakfast available - - we forgot to tell him that it would be charged to the room . He went down the 1st morning we were there and started helping himself to cereal - well I guess the "ladies" spooked him as 3 of them came over to him and kept asking him what room he was in & telling him there was a charge .....needless to say - he never wanted to eat breakfast there again - -which was fine - as there was plenty of small cafes open in the morning within a less than 5 min walk., a supermarket and bakeries.... THE HOTEL: has a small, but nice main floor wating lounge; there was a garden breakfast room which looked nice but we really did not use at all; the location has enough small cafes nearby, a supermarket and a laundry. They have a PC in the main waiting room that you can use for 2E per half hour. It has limited functionality - but can get you online to many functions you would need it for while you are travelling anyway. It is in easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Invalides and Rodin Museum. Within less than 5 minutes is a post office , metro stop, bus stop and taxi stand. (HINT: if you are taking taxis - take a card from the front desk with you to show taxi drivers - none of them knew Rue Chevert - but most had GPS in their taxis and could punch in the address and find their way there easily)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gwhizrd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located, clean and a good value. The room was very comfortable and the staff helpful. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Mtngrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet in june 2007. We had two rooms, #61 and #63. One had a king bed as well as a daybed, with a spactacular view of the Eiffel Tower and the other direction a peak of Sacre Coeur. The other room had two twin beds, and a view of Invalides. Both rooms were spacious, and extremely well kept. One of our rooms had a regular stall shower while the other had a bathtuve with a shower (and a half glass wall). The beds were very comfortable and there was ample room in the armoires to unpack. The lift only goes to the 5th floor, but there is a staircase that leads up to the 6th floor where there are only 3 rooms. We had breakfast only once at the hotel. Standard hotel breakfast with breads, yogurt, cereals, etc. The breakfast room is nice and light and is just off the lobby, but in a quiet area. The hotel is in a great location. Easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Invalides and Rue Cler, among other places. The street it is on is very quiet, but safe. The metro station is only a block away, as is the taxi stand. There are many restaurants, pharmacies, and various stores within several blocks of the hotel so you do not need to venture far for anything. The owner of the hotel and all the staff we encountered were very helpful. It is obvious that they take a lot of pride in the Muguet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: BelleScotland
Reviews.Content: We arrived for 4 day stay as a surprise present from our family for our 50th wedding anniversary. We could not have picked a better hotel ourselves, as right from the moment we entered the manageress Catherine made us feel so welcome. We were a bit early so left our luggage and went out to have a look at our surroundings. We were pleased to find that we could walk to the Tower in about 15 minutes. We never thought we would be so central for everything, bars,restuarants, supermarkets, metro stations were all within minutes of the hotel. After eating we went back to hotel as our room was now ready. The room was small but adequate as we did not intend spending a lot of time inside when there was so much we wanted to do. The linen was lovely as were the towels which were changed daily. Also the safe which you operated by choosing your own numbers was a good help in keeping passports money etc. as your mind was at rest and you didn't need to carry all of your money about. We had breakfast in the hotel 2 days which seemed as good a value as outside, and was nicely laid out in a very attractive dining area. A good start to the day. We had been booked on a dinner cruise as the day we got there was actually our anniversary but Catherine was unable to get us a taxi when we were due to be there for 7-50pm so she asked her husband to take us in his car so that we would not be late. We have been in many countries over the years and many hotels but we thought this was really going out of their way to please people staying with them. We were very gratefull as we got there in time and had a wonderful evening sailing down the seine with good food ,Champagne, Nice wine and violin and piano players serenading us all evening. A great start to our holiday. We also had passes for the Tour bus and the hop on hop off boats, we certainly used them. We would recommend this small hotel to anyone, and hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jim007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a total of nine nights at Hotel Muget in July. During our first stay of six nights they spoiled us & upgraded us to a deluxe double which had more room, a larger closet, larger bath, & a second window for increased ventilation, even though the a/c works fine. The final 3 nights we were in a std double/ a more typical European room, which was still nice. The location is hard to beat, with two Metro Stations, a laundry, atm, supermarket, bakery, many cafe's & restaurants, all within a 5 minute walk. This includes my favorite Paris restaurant Leo le Lion, which is excellent. The breakfast offered is very fairly priced and includes coffee, juice, yogurt, bread, croissiants, fruit, meats, eggs, & cereal. We opted for it during 1/2 our stay & went to the bakery on Rue Cler for the other half. I must say that bakery is also Excellent with both great breads & great pastrys, including the spinich quiche. All of my contact with the Hotel has been very pleasant. I found the owner Catherine, everyone at the front desk, & all employees to be helpful, courteous, & very nice people. This is the place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “Management Cares, And It Shows”
Reviews.Author: Florimond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Muguet during the first week of July. Having stayed in the same neighborhood on our yearly Parisian visits, this was our first time at the Muguet. We left the last hotel we frequented because the prices had gotten way out of line. For the same price as the cheapest closet-sized room at the old hotel, we got the best room in the house at Le Muguet. We had a spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower and, off to the right, we saw Sacre Coeur church. On the opposite side, looking out the window in the hallway, we had an equally spectacular view of the gold dome of the Invalides. The location was perfect! Everyone, from management to maids, was friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were fine and actually in line with what we've paid at nearby cafes for the same amount of food. The restaurants in the area are wonderful, especially Le Florimond, which is right around the corner from the hotel. The neighborhood is peaceful and safe but you're just footsteps from the Metro and Rue Cler. We will definitely return to Le Muguet next year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: offto
Reviews.Content: What a little gem in Paris! It is a cute hotel on a wonderfully quiet street. The room for European standards was nice and big, very modern, and amazingly clean. It has the charm of an old beautiful building but once you enter your room it feels crisp and new. We traveled with our 7 year old and the location was close enough to walk everywhere we wanted to go (and boy did we go!).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location-Great View”
Reviews.Author: TamnDave
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Muguet in July 07 for three nights. Had the triple room (three twin beds) with a fabulous view of the Eiffel Tower.
