The hotel was quiet, clean, newly-remodelled and comfortable. You *cannot* beat the location in the Rue Cler neighborhood. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to walk Paris and be close to the sites. I would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Experience ruined by staff”
Reviews.Author: traveltime37
Reviews.Content: Very well maintained hotel in a nice quiet part of Paris. The rooms were small but immaculate, nice bathrooms, good A/C. We felt the breakfast was a little over priced but good and very convenient. The only negative was the daytime front desk staff. Not a place to stay if you need any assistance with directions, restaurants, tours, etc. Stay for the room or location but don't expect any assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Will choose another hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: FuldaFan
Reviews.Content: We selected the Hotel Muguet based upon location and the most favorable cost/recommendation rating. Our room was very small and would not handle two suitcases. It was clean, the mattress firm, the street quiet and the a/c a plus. But the staff was cool and somewhat indifferent and caused some guests some problems. Also, it not a hotel for those seeking to be among Europeans (we are American) while traveling in Europe. The guests at this hotel are almost exclusively American. Just a personal preference. We'll look for another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: stcolfax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Muguet and the beginning and end of our 2 week Europe trip. The hotel is very clean and the location is excellent. It is a 3 minute walk from Rue Cler and a 5-10 minute walk from the Invalides and the Eiffel Tower. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quiet and comfortable. Our first room had a view of the Eiffel Tower! The only glitch we had was that on our second visit we had booked one room as a double and one as two twins, and we got two doubles. They offered us several options, including a third room, or to move the next day. Neither of these worked for us, so they made our internet usage free. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: member21
Reviews.Content: Paris was the last stop on a two week European vacation. We saved the best hotel for last -- the Hotel Muguet. The 7th arrondisement is a great location for anyone coming to Paris. The room was clean, well decorated and beautifully appointed. Staff was friendly and helpful. Classy place and a good value for the money. Will defjnitely try to stay here on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jan_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: We were at the Muguet five nights in June 2007, our second time here. The hotel has been remodeled, is very comfortable, and in an excellent location. It's a busy little place so the staff can be a bit to the point at times. Despite the horrible value of the 9.50 Euro breakfast folks just lap it up. You can take a very short walk to Rue Cler and do better and the hotel will fix you up with coffee or tea for 2 Euros. It's a non-smoking hotel but the staff sort of ignore that sometimes for themselves. If you are particularly sensitive to cigarette smoke you may want to take this into consideration. Indeed this is a good value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: mars000210
Reviews.Content: <<Hello, I just got back from Paris and our stay at the Muguet was wonderful. I wanted to experiece a hotel that felt like I was in Paris, not just a room to land in at the end of the day, and the Muguet fit that experience. The hotel was located off the main boulavard ( which also fit the bill for what I thought Paris should be like on my trip) on a small side street, in a neigborhood. The Lobby was charming. The room we had faced the back of the hotel, and we had a quiant view of other peoples homes and courtyards. At night , as we had been told, a neighbor ( a few streets away, played music that wafted through the night so we could hear it in the distance. Again charming. The bed was comfortable,with clean linens daily, the decor was also nice. The room was small , but we expected that. The bathroom clean, the shower, no tub, also very small with a rain shower head, tile was intact and looked cute as well as the sink and fixures. We liked our room., The water was hot as well.The rooms matched the pictures on line. We didn't need to use the air conditioner, so I can't say how that worked. Hair dryer was IN the drawer of a table in the room, the only thing that was funny was the cord ran to the back of the drawer to a plug beneath the table, so you couldn't move it to do ones hair and the line was short, good thing the mirror was juat above the table. ( I assume they did this to prevent theft of the hair dryer, but it worked ok, small hand held dryer. The staff was great and helpfull whenever we needed assistance. It was also quiet at night for sleeping. There is also a lift to the upper rooms, or one can climb the stairs. All carpeted. If one is disabled and needs a wheelchair it would be a good place to stay, if you you can still walk some, as there are no ground floor rooms ,and one would still need to be able to walk to the rooms from the lift on the upper floors, yet there is storage room on the first floor for an electric or regular wheelchair. Just thought I would add this for those who come here and may need to know this. The entrance way also had two steps to enter the hotel. We noticed the other guests ate the morning fair , which looked good 9 Euro's, but we chose to stroll to the little side streets nearby and buy our breatfast at the bakeries nearby, there were several to choose from. The guests also used the dining and lobby area to sit at night and chat about their day. I sat up one night and read a book when I couldn't sleep. Felt like I was at home in the lobby. There was staff from the hotel on duty 24hr a day, thought the night staff, single person, was cat napping on a sofa at night, but woke up when guests needed him, he was very nice. Short walk from the hotel lead us to a wide boulevard with everything one could want on a trip to Paris, little resturants with outside tables, different types of resturant fair, the italian restruants were wonderfull, when we wanted a change of pace. Grocery store near by as well, if one wanted to buy some wine and snacks to take back to the room. Other shops included candy store, flower shop and the Invalides Park is nearby for a stroll at night as well. The Eiffel Tower is 10 minute walk through a charming park, , as well as the Batobus ( best deal going). So the hotel was convient location for doing our day trips arround Paris. The hotel even had a locked room where we stored our luggage when our train didn't leave till after our check out time. No charge for this at all. Safe in every room for valuables, no refererator, NIce TV with remote and cable ( if you need to wind down after your day, CNN and BBC for those who need a dose of english speaking TV). SHampoo and complentary soaps too. I would stay again at the Muguet. I will try and figure out how to post some pictures this week of the hotel. We took several. Barbie

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ATLboundAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on a quiet street located next to Napolean's tomb and a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel tower. Room was air conditioned and hotel had been recently renovated . Room size was reasonable by European standards, all in all the hotel was what was advertised .

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SCreisende
Reviews.Content: I found the positive reviews to be very accurate during our recent stay. The rooms are small but the space is well used and very nicely appointed. The staff was always helpful (but not overly friendly). The location is excellent. Enjoy this jewel while it lasts as the last hotel we found like this is now 4 stars and prices out at $500 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Muguet tres bien”
Reviews.Author: Manto1
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in a twin room at the Muguet this May during a three day trip to Paris. The hotel is not as close to the Eiffel tower as their website would have you believe, and you pay extra for a room with a view of the tower, however, that famous attraction was only around a 15 min walk away. My sister and I don't mind a bit of a walk, so on the first day we walked to the Louvre, a beautiful walk along the Seine, about 40 mins, and the second day we walked a bit further along to Notre Dame and then on to the Pompidou Centre, about another 10 mins walk. The room itself was, as I am led to believe is typical in Paris, very small, even though our twin beds were crammed so close together that if either of us rolled over too far in the night we'd have been in the other bed. There was also a bit of a problem with the street noise, as our room was at the front of the hotel. I solved this with earplugs. Also, during our stay we had a bit of an early summer heatwave, and the airconditioning is not turned on until June, so the room was quite stuffy during the night. This didn't stop me from sleeping, as hardly anything ever does, but my sister didn't sleep well during our stay, partly due to the noise and the stuffiness of the room. During summer I expect it would be much better, as you'd close the window and rely on the airconditioning. Having said this, the recent renovations (last year I think) were very obvious, the ensuite (no bath, but a fabulous shower) as well as the room itself was spotless, and there were two wardrobes with plently of hangers for both of us to hang up all our clothes. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but the coffee and tea are available for a small charge in the lobby, as is internet access. The room had a flat screen digital TV, however, there were only the two obligatory English channels, CNN, and BBC News 24. There is no iron/board in the room, an iron is available during the daytime in the hotel laundry in the basement, and when we went down there the walls were hung with creepy animal skulls (hunting trophies, I hope!). Worse, the lady who showed us down there absent mindedly turned the light off on us when she got to the top of the stairs, so that my sister had to go back up in the pitch dark to ask them to turn the light back on. For a moment we thought we'd landed in the middle of a horror B-movie. We chose to eat breakfast at the hotel, which was an extra 9 Euros. It was an okay continental breakfast, with baguette, pastries, cold meat and cheeses, yoghurt, cereals and fresh coffee. I don't mind a continental breakfast but would have liked some toast. Overall I think we got good value for a hotel as centrally located as this one, but may consider somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sparky73
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Paris or Europe I researched on Trip Advisor and trusted the feedback. Glad I did. For a North American, the size of the rooms in Europe, particularly Paris, could be a disappointment, if you let it. Yes they are small, yes the elevator only held myself and our luggage. But at the Hotel Muguet, the room and the hotel are very tastefully decored and immaculate. I emailed my reservation and spoke directly online with Catherine Pelletier the owner who I met on check in. Talk about direct ownership! The quality of the hotel reflects Catherine's management. The hotel is 5 minutes to Rue Cler, 10 minutes to the Metro hub which will get you anywhere in Paris very quickly. 20 minutes to Eiffel Tower. We ate breakfast on Rue Cler but the breakfast at the hotel was both bountiful, excellent quality and fair value. I would recommend for the difference in price, any room at the Muguet as opposed to an Eiffel view. I visited and saw other places I considered. I'd return to the Muguet in a heartbeat, for price, location and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful Place in Great Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: karobski
Reviews.Content: We hope this review helps someone experience this great hotel. The location is the best in Paris for walking to the Eifel Tower even at night and getting to other places as the metro is close by. The room and bathroom were clean and it was very quiet. We never heard anyone around us. We were impressed by the size of the room and were definitely expecting smaller. At first we went to cafes for breakfast but after we decided to have breakfast one morning at the hotel we never went out again as the value and variety was better than anything we had found to say nothing of the comvenience. We spent a lot of time at Rue Claire and this is another plus for the location of this hotel. Staff was friendly and we never had a language problem with our French and their English. Internet was available at a reasonable charge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel in a Great Area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Al_Q2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 3 nights, May 15-17, 2007. We absolutely loved this place! We were looking for a smoke free environment which really poses a challenge in Paris - Hotel Muguet is a rare NON-SMOKING property. Ms. Pelletier (owner) and her staff were charming and friendly. The room itself, typical size for a french hotel, was very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was immaculate with very nice new fixtures. We were up on the 5th floor with a view of a courtyard below and Les Invlides church dome - heard virtually no noise from adjacent rooms. Air conditioning was working but it was just as easy to open the window. Nightly rate for what you get can't be beat. Hotel Mugeut is located in a wonderful area of Paris known as the rue Cler. It is an upscale area with very nice restaurants and shops. Our sense was that the price for food, etc was more reasonable in this area than say St. Germain or the Opera quarter. Not a lot of night life but still a great location to use as home base for visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: juleshPerth
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel - especially for Paris. The area has plenty of restaurants, cafes and fresh food stores. It is very close to the Eiffel tower and near a metro stop. The staff were helpful and polite. The rooms were newly renovated and very nice, especially the bathroom it was stunning. We had a triple room with our teenage son. His single bed was seperated by a half wall and there was plenty of room - very unusual for Paris. The air conditioning doesn't get switched on until May and in April they had a heat wave - which was a litttle stuffy at night. But this is a common problem all over Europe. I did some ironing and had to go to the cellars - a bit bizarre but it was a super powerful iron. There is some noise from the lift and other rooms doors closing but the only serious noise problem we had was when some very rude guests decided to have a noisy conversation outside our door at 1am. We never had the breakfast as there are at least 6 patisseries nearby but the range for their breakfast looked very good, and the breakfast room is gorgeous. We would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel and neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: blanck444
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and enjoyed everything. The rooms were lovely, closets large and bathrooms tremendous. The beds could have been softer, but not a deterent. We ate many meals at outdoor cafes on Rue Cler and to our delight the food was wonderful and priced well. We had a divine meal at Le Maupertu just 2 blocks away. It was @$50.00 per person including wine. The food was exceptional and we only had a leisurely stroll home later that evening. I would go back to Hotel Muguet again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view????”
Reviews.Author: akaent
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Hotel Muguet. I had booked directly through their website and had requested and paid extra for a room "with a view" of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel itself is lovely and extremely clean. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. Although our room was not overly spaceous it was more than adequate for the two of us. The bathroom however was extremely small. Breakfast is 9.50 euros but they had a variety of food and we enjoyed the breakfast there every morning. The hotel is close to Rue Cler and it is a lovely walk to the Eiffel Tower. There are numerous restaurants and cafes in the area and directly behind the hotel is Les Invalides. The dome lit up at night is magical. The only complaint that I had was the so called "view". Believe me you had to look real hard to see the Eiffel Tower from our room. So that being said if you are thinking of staying at the Hotel Muguet don't bother paying extra for a "room with a view", it just isn't worth it. However the Hotel itself is well worth staying at and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit, still very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFtoSD
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Muguet for four nights. This was our third stay at this hotel and we still have no major complaints. This is a great location- quiet, near several metro stops, the Rue Cler, Eiffel Tower, etc. Good breakfast, nice staff, nice remodeled bathrooms. For this trip, it was just my husband and me, but we've stayed here with our young son before and it was good with kids, too. Only two minor complaints: the price has gone up over 30% since our stay four years ago (and that's not counting the exchange rate) and the rooms are small (oh well, it's Paris).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paris54
Reviews.Content: A group of ten friends stayed at the Muguet for 6 nights in late April.. This hotel couldn't be nicer. The rooms were very, very clean and well appointed. The staff was more than helpful. They recommended restaurants, called taxis etc. We were a group of ten and tended to be very demanding. The hotel is in a very safe neighborhood. It is on the residential side with many good restaurants and the ever popular Rue Cler. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: AveragefamilyGB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel after reading reviews on Trip advisor. All the good things that have been said before I agree with. I was only prompted to write when I read the staff were unhelpful. I found they went out of their way to help and advise us on our first trip to paris. The restaraunts they reccomended were superb. Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a 2-star”
Reviews.Author: leeandb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet is as good as a 2-star can get! My husband and I stayed for 130 euro per night. A little off the beaten path, so ask for directions before you get there, the little street is not on most maps. Very close to Rue Cler which hosts several quaint cafes and bistros. The best was the nearby supermarket and open air markets to pick up a quick breakfast, sandwich or picnic items. We were there is in April and the picnic on the Eiffel tower lawn is the thing to do. The hotel is close to the Ecole Militaire metro station and we could partially see the Eiffel tower from our room. This super-clean place had only one complaint. If you are travelling in the Spring, they do not turn on the air-conditioning until May. The weather was quite hot so we cooled our room by opening windows. The only problem with this was the street noise down below (we didn't hear it w/ the windows closed). The hotel has a nice breakfast room (we didn't try breakfast) and luggage storage if you are leaving or arriving before/after checkout. Though the room was small, it was adequate for folks that don't plan to spend a lot of time in the room--and the price can't be beat for Paris!

Reviews.Title: “a late, but great, review”
Reviews.Author: beePittsburghPa
Reviews.Content: We are taking kids back to Paris this summer, and today I emailed the Muguet to see if they could handle us....my husband and I stayed there two years ago for four nights and had a great experience; the room was lovely, clean and quiet--the bed was comfy and the temperature was fine--we had a nice view. There wasn't a peep from the street or from within the hotel. There was not a huge amount of space in our room, but was adequate. The bathroom had a solid shower and plenty of room, nice towels. Other guests were quiet and polite. The desk service was fine, despite our toe-curling attempts to stick to our moldy, ancient french (I'm sure it was hard for her to keep from bursting into guffaws), and recommendations reliable. The location is magnificent for local color and access to metro, markets and the champs de mars and so on..... would stay there again anytime. apologies for the delay in the feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CaptDad42
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Muguet from April 2 thru April 6th, 2007. The location was excellent, in the 7th district. As for the facility itself, it was immaculate, from the lobby to our room on the 6th floor that had a spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower. Our room was spotless every day when we returned from sight seeing. The staff was always available to respond to our questions; assist with transportation; restaurant recommendations; which were fabulous; and anything else we needed help with. When I take my next trip to Paris, the Hotel Muguet is where I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in every way”
Reviews.Author: tonymsrad
Reviews.Content: A wonderful, wonderful hotel. Mme Pelletier welcoming, and runs a tight ship. All of breakfast staff, front desk staff was great. There's internet easily available in lobby for minimal fee. Good location ( a few blocks from Invalide, one block from subway), great rooms, immaculately clean. Good value for money. Recommend staying here without any reservations whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: AZTraveller26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 5 nights in March. The property is very nice, everything seems to be recently redone and the it was very nicely decorated. We were upgraded to a superior room and the room was absolutely perfect. It had plenty of space and a king sized bed. The bathroom was a tad small but still pretty perfect. I was very impressed with the room and the general appearance of the hotel. It is also in a very good location, close to the Metro, restaurants, Rue Cler, etc. The only slight drawback is the staff, while never rude, sometimes made us feel like we were bothering them and it was difficult to communicate at times, I attributed this to nonfluent French. I had everything pretty much planned out so we didn't rely on them for many directions or suggestions, I would recommend the same. They did help us book a taxi to take us to the airport and that worked out pretty good. Go for the location and the niceness of the property itself, just don't expect tons of help from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: FIO
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of February. hotel clean and tidy and informal. Rooms nicely decorated and seem newly done our room was small but adequate, bathroom was lovely, again clean and new. Beware of the rubber backed sheets on the bed they make sleeping a nightmare, unless you take them off as we did. Reception staff did not go out of their way to make you feel welcome (as stated on a previous review). only ate one breakfast which was good, plenty to eat and drink. we paid 130 euros a night for a standard room. breakfast was 9.5 euros. it is in a very quiet area but easy reach of the metro, if you're arriving at night get a taxi it's almost impossible to find in daylight never mind at midnight (as we did).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Wibecke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nigths and found the staff to be very helpful and we loved the hotel. It was in a quiet area, but still very close to whatever you need. They have a map of Paris at the front desk for free. The breakfast consists of baguette, croissants, eggs, ham, orange juice, coffee ("all you can eat)." It is definetely good value for a 2 star. We were impressed with how clean the rooms were and the shower was very nice (a bit small). The pictures on the web page are actually what the hotel and rooms looks like. We spent little time in the hotel, because we were always out and got home late. It was no problem because they have someone at the front desk all hours. It is very close to metro stops. The first nigth we actually walked our way to Champs Elysees, Arc de Triumph, and even managed to go to the Eiffel tower that nigth. Beautiful at nigth with the ligths and safe to walk around. It was not far if you are used to walking. The next 2 days we bought "the carnet" tickets for the metro (10 trips) which lasted us for the rest of our stay. We took a walk along the Seine river and crossed some bridges. The most impressive sigthseeing we did was the Sacre Ceur. More impressed with that than the Notre Dame. The Louvre was too much for me, and it was stuffy in there. But (window) shopping at the Lafayette Gallery with its impressive interior was fun. I highly recommend this hotel to couples who want to spend a quiet and romantic weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Muguet”
Reviews.Author: mc582
Reviews.Content: This 2-star hotel is excellent value for money. During Christmas holidays we paid Euro 125 for a double room which had all the characteristics of a good 3-star: very large bed, new furnitures, nice decor, plasma TV, and a bathroom which looked like it was used for the first time. The view was on a lovely Parisian street and the double gazed window kept the room extremely quiet. Last but not least the location is excellent: just a few steps from Les Invalides, and very well connected to the rest of the city through the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect French Hotel For Us!”
Reviews.Author: Phamer
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for my wife and I to celebrate our 7th anniversary. For many reasons, this was the perfect hotel for us: * Our room was beautifully decorated , with a comfortable queen-sized bed, and had air conditioning * We were on a quiet street, in a fantastic location in the Rue Cler. We were within walking distance of everything, including the Metro and RER stations, and wonderful cafes and restaurants * The price was right (125 Euro) * It had a nice little lobby, with internet access for only 2 Euro per half hour * Overall, it felt very romantic This hotel comes highly recommended by Rick Steves and TripAdvisior members, including myself. Check out our pictures and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Oui, oui, c'est sympa .... (That means it was good ...)”
Reviews.Author: glbtrttr
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay at Hotel Muguet through their website based on positive reviews from other Trip Advisor-ites. 140 Eu/night for room with "a view" - which I think were off-season rates (normally 165 Eu). Having stayed in a number of hotels, I was skeptical of the "with view", but come to find out, we were on the 5th floor (out of 6) in room #52 with a nice view of the Eiffel Tower. Room was typical boutique European (read: small), but did have a queen sized bed and just enough room for our 2 weeks worth of luggage (we were in Egypt prior to France). Bathroom was tiny but upgraded with a nice shower enclosure and vanity area. Small flat-screen TV was a nice touch. The 7th arrondissement gets a bad rap for not being "in the mix", but we liked it - the hotel is on narrow side street, very quiet, but you are 2-5 min walk to Motte-Picquet, Rue Cler, etc where there are a number of brasseries, cafes, patisseries, etc. Staff was very nice. Hotel was CLEAN! A nice French-style breakfast (coffee/tea/hot chocolate, breads, yogurt, cereal) for 9 euro each made it easy to eat when we weren't motivated to hunt down breakfast or had enough of grabbing a pain au chocolat on the run. You can probably find slightly less expensive comparable accomodations in a noisier area, but we thought the location was convenient. As others have mentioned, you do need to leave your room key at the front desk whenever you leave the hotel, they say so they "know when you're not in your room" (?), but we never felt unsafe about it - there is a small safe in the room if you're concerned. And there is staff 24 hours so you don't need to worry about returning by a specific time. All in all, a great choice - although I can't speak to rooms on the lower floors.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwb55
Reviews.Content: Pleasant staff, small rooms, of course, but lovely modern decor. Excellent location near Tour Eiffel, metro stops. Went out each day, so didn't try hotel breakfast. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Omer22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Muguet from Oct. 28-Nov. 01. It was everything we expected. Very nicely done rooms, lobby and breakfast area. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Close to subway stop, nice restraunts, bakeries, shops, the beautiful Eiffel Tower. There is a laundry mat close by as well as numerous pharmacies. Napoleaon Tomb is just across the road. We would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: sailingaway1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three night stay at Hotel Muguet. The hotel is clean, safe reasonably priced, and in a excellent location. The rooms were small, the bathroom was the tiniest I've ever seen, but we were comfortable for our short stay. My only complaint is that the wall were so thin that my husband and I could hear everything that went on in the room next to us e.g. their alarm clock going off, coughing, talking, TV noise... it made sleeping a bit difficult since our neighbors were up at 6:00am- well before our desired wake up time. Would we stay there again? Perhaps. It is perfect for the traveller that spends little or no time in the room. If you want to streach out, relax, and maybe take an afternoon nap during your trip, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Charming”
Reviews.Author: littlepooh
Reviews.Content: After consulting the Rick Steves guide to Paris to find which area of town to stay in we did further research on TripAdvisor to narrow down our hotel search. We decided on Hotel Muguet then contacted them directly to make the reservation. We took a taxi from the airport and upon arrival the hotel staff was very welcoming. We were given the key and shown to the elevator. The elevator is about the size of a restroom stall and we had to struggle to get 2 people and 2 suitcases inside. Once in our room I was very pleased at how warm and romantic it was. We paid extra for a 'room with a view' which turned out to be the backs of other buildings... not exactly the view we were hoping for. Anyhow, the staff was able to reserve space on a fancy dinner cruise and arrange a shuttle back to the airport as well as give directions around town, restaurant recommendations etc. which was very helpful. My husband and I loved the Rue Cler area and highly recommend staying in this hotel since it is so close to the metro, Eifel Tower and many good restaurants. Each morning for 9 Euro you could have a continental breakfast of bread, boiled eggs, yogurt and cheese. It was a little pricey for what it was but we ate at the hotel once because it was raining that morning. I highly recommend a short walk to a cafe or a bakery for a breakfast of coffee and eclairs. The only downfalls to this hotel are the small rooms, the fact the only iron (an old model with only one setting) available is in the dark-ish scary basement. So you have to bring your clothes all the way thru the hotel with you on the way to the iron which was very odd. The hair dryer is bolted into the desk drawer and the cord does not reach the bathroom (and the dryer is a poor model) and for some reason you are required to leave your room key at the front lobby desk every time you leave and although we never had a problem, made us feel that our belongings and purchases were not totally secure. All in all it was a great newly renovated hotel in a great location with a pleasant helpful staff. They seemed to be especially accomadating to American travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paris0618
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 year old daughter and I stayed at Hotel Muguet in August of this year. And THANK YOU to TripAdvisor members who recommended this as it was PERFECT. Upon arriving, we were told to take the tiny elevator to the 5th floor, and walk up a small flight of stairs to the 6th, but not to worry, the view was worth the climb. Was it ever! An amazing view of the Eiffel Tower! The room was small, but quaint and very clean. We had two beds, plus a third just behind a partition for our daughter. The location is fabulous! We walked to the Eiffel Tower daily, often through Rue Cler to pick up a chocolate croissant or two. The staff was very friendly and directed us to taxi stands, bus stops and more. A few recommendations while in Paris: Fat Tire Bike Tour! Our guide was Stacy, from Chicago, and she was great! We loved biking through Paris, getting a feel for the city, and a boat trip is part of the tour! Red wine included! Take a bus to Monmartre and Sacre Coeur for the day. Free fashion shows at Printemps and Galleries LaFayette (great for a teenage girl!). Restaurant close to our hotel: La Tour Maubourg. Monet's Water Lilies at Musee L'Orangerie. And did you know the Eiffel Tower twinkles every hour on the hour? What fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great little Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TallTonyUK
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews, and I must say that it actually exceeded my expectations. It is very Parisian in style and was comfortable, clean and a perfect location. The Metro is a 4 minute walk, the area is safe and there are some good restaurants in the near proximity. I originally booked their standard queen room but was upgraded to a 5th floor with King size bed and a view of the Eiffel Tower. Very comfortable bed, flat screen TV, little balcony with flowers and a very effective shower. The reception staff were very pleasent and helpful. At â‚¬9 the breakfast was dear for a non-buffet selection but the food was good quality. Only other downside in my mind was no iron or tea/coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “a very solid value in a great section of Paris”
Reviews.Author: radio71
Reviews.Content: A small Parisian hotel, with small rooms and tiny elevator, yet clean, charming, and well-situated. Very near the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler, with two metro stops nearby. Nice resturants close. In a clean, charming residential neighborhood. All staff speak English. The self-service breakfast is nice; it's basically "all you can eat." There is a public computer with high-speed internet access in the lobby (for a nominal charge). Our room had a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower and was exceptionally clean. The hotel's rates are very, very reasonable for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: LesleySusan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 2 nights Oct 10 & 11. We had a triple room for 3 adults. The rooms are much more charming than they appear on the hotel's website! We paid â‚¬165 for the room from the hotel's site (did not include breakfast, that was â‚¬9 each). The location was good, walkable to many sights and close to the Ecole Militaire and Invalides metro stops. We could see the Eiffel Tower out the window! The staff were lovely and attentive, the breakfast was nice. Overall a great value for the service and location. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the room”
Reviews.Author: danzy
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel in October. Check in was very efficient - only in Reception about 10 seconds! We were impressed with the room, which was VERY nicely decorated, with large double bed and flat screen TV (only BBC World and CNN in English). The bathroom was also very clean, bright and airy. We were plesantly surprised with the size of the room - however when I looked at the plan of the hotel it seemed like we had one of the larger rooms. We overlooked the coutyard which meant the room was very quiet. We loved the area and found two Metro stops within a few mintues walk. The area felt very safe, even at night. Two minor issues that stopped us from rating this hotel as excellent... 1. On our first night there was no hot water. Mentioned it to Reception who said that it was being fixed but no apology. No big deal. It was working again the next day. 2.On our first morning we were woken about 7am by the fire alarm. We made our way downstairs with the other guests only to be told that it was a false alarm but the bell couldn't be switched off for 5 minutes! No apology. Overall, highly recommended and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic and Authentic”
Reviews.Author: kayebear
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over New Year's Eve and had a wonderful time! The rooms are a bit small, but it's Europe and that's how it is everywhere. We had a terrrific view of the Eiffel Tower and a lovely room. The breakfast was delicious and traditionally French with baguettes and hard boiled eggs, croissants and juice. The front desk people were friendly and always welcomed us warmly. Catherine, the owner or manager was very nice and accomodating. This hotel is easy to get to and close to EVERYTHING! We walked everywhere even in the freezing cold just because it was so convenient. We asked the front desk for a restaurant suggestion and they sent us down the street to Pasco which was also really great and the manager helped ud translate the menu. We highily recommend both places. If we ever go back to Paris, we will stay at this hotel again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: highflyer80
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel during our trip to Paris in August 06. We found the hotel to be clean and tidy with lovely rooms. The location was an excellent place to base ourselves, it was walking distance to most of the major attractions. Walking is great in Paris as it gives you time to look around. The hotel offers breakfast but we were only in Paris for a short time so we usually got a croissant on the run at the bakery near the hotel. There is also a few little supermarkets which were great as we would buy a baguette and some cheese and have that as our lunch each day. The staff were also very helpful and friendly. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “too small and picky”
Reviews.Author: PlatoWinn1
Reviews.Content: A friend booked the Muguet for us, for our first visit to Paris. Situated just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower and the Seine River at 11 Rue Chevert, the location is convenient for walking to most of the city's main attractions, such as the tower, the Louvre, and so on. The hotel is clean enough and pretty enough, and the staff are cordial enough, but the rooms are just too small. Our room had a very firm king size bed, and it took up all the space. There was only room for one suitcase. I had to put my luggage under the desk. The desk could not be used without blocking the bathroom from the front door. All in all, the room was best suited to a lone traveler, despite the king sized bed.. The bathroom is so small that the hair dryer is in the desk drawer! Bizarre! The on-off switch and fan speed buttons for the air conditioner were actually hand-written. All of this was inconvenient enough, but the worst part of all was the hotel's policy on keys. The keys are the encoded plastic strips so popular around the world, but the hotel will only issue one per room, and requests (but does not insist) that you leave your key at the front desk each time you go out. I don't understand the logic behind this, but bottom line: I couldn't leave the room while my wife was sleeping, without troubling the front desk clerk to let me back in. We dropped our key off as they requested once or twice, until we realized that when we came back, they did not ask us for any identification to get the key back. So theoretically, anybody could walk in after the shift change at the front desk, claim to be us, and get our key. We were not happy with this security arrangement, and kept our key with us the rest of our stay. The price was very economical, considering the convenience of the location, but if I could do it over, I would spend a few dollars more for more satisfactory accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Muguet even had a sparkling view of the Eiffel Tower!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsygirl1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in July and it was a quiet, cool (air-conditioned!), clean and comfortable home base. We asked for a view of the tower when we booked (far ahead of time ---February, I think!) and we got a sweet room in the attic with a skylight. The breakfast was basically unlimited 'serve-yourself' American-style (eggs, cereal, coffee, fruit and cheese) in a bright, cheerful breakfast room and the baguettes were fabulous, of course. The service was mixed; I didn't expect much fawning or smiling, to tell you the truth. The front desk clerks were more helpful than the breakfast ladies, though. The rooms are small, in general and so is the elevator, but this is Paris after all! The location was good: close to the underground and within walking distance from the tower and many retaurants as well as Invalides. I would highly recommend this hotel as great value for your dollar!

Reviews.Title: “It's nice to have a hotel you can call your own in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CentralButtegirl
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I have stayed at this hotel 4 times since 2000. It never fails to meet our expectations - the triple rooms are spacious (the doubles are quite a bit smaller); the decor is impeccable (and newly renovated); the bathroom is sparkling and spotless; the air conditioning works and is very quiet (important this hot July); the staff are very professional. This is a small, family run hotel, presided over by Mme Pelletier, who has every right to be proud of her establishment. The location is superb - on our first day, after a long flight from Vancouver, we head for rue Cler for a bite to eat at an outdoor table. Then it's off to see the Eiffel Tower. This year the people are allowed to sit and play on the grass fields! Formidable! The neighborhood is calm and prosperous, but full of interesting sights, shops and places to eat (something like the Upper West Side in NYC). The Rodin Museum, the Gare d'Orsay, the Pont Alexandre, the Invalides, Trocadero, and of course the Tour Eiffel, are within easy walking distance. And just 2 blocks away there is the very useful rue Cler - a quintessential Rick Steves sort of place - a market street full of food shops and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steve's was right, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Noles79
Reviews.Content: Since we had never been to Paris before, we took the advise of an expert, Rick Steves. He highly recommened this hotel and he was right. The hotel owner, Madam Peletier, was very helpful as was the rest of the staff. The hotel is very close to two Metro stops, and a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. There are great restaurants all around the Rue Cler neighborhood (we followed Rick Steve's recommendations and never had a bad experience). We really appreciated the air-conditioning as Paris was experiencing a heat wave during out time there. The hotel is extemely clean and our room, though small, was very comfortable. The street on which the hotel is located is one-way with little traffic so we slept very well. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel - Would Return”
Reviews.Author: Suite2100
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel due to good reviews on Trip Advisor and in Rick Steves guide. Positives: -- Great location in a good area with close metro access -- Good value for the cost relative to other options -- Clean room with nice, clean bathroom -- Small feel - ie not huge tourist box -- Staff was friendly -- Breakfast food available at a reasonable fee Watch out for: -- There is no early check in (was told there was but could not). They will hold your luggage however until you can check in -- Wifi in the hotel is free - but they are using encryption that is a bit tricky to figure out and the front desk was clueless about this - I am pretty tech savvy and they should have had better instructions Bottom line: -- My wife and I enjoyed the hotel and would return -- We would recommend this hotel to a close friend

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a few catches”
Reviews.Author: brerbruce
Reviews.Content: We were ther for a week in early July '06. The rooms are very clean, well decorated and comfortable. The one thing that really bothered me was the wireless internet access was not working the whole time we were there. There were a few other patrons who said they could get on for an hour here and there, but the the access was very spotty at best. The people at the hotel said it worked well and werent much help with it. We know it wasnt working, I have considerable experience with computers and it was NOT our computer or settings. There was, coincidentally enough, a computer in the lobby you could pay 2 Euros for 1/2 hour to use. This would be the one thing we didnt like. We find internet access very helpful when traveling and it was a big dissapointment to be without for our stay. If one doesnt care about such things, the hotel is excellent and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Our Fave - Well almost”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in three Paris hotels over the past 5 years and Muguet is our favourite. Main positive is its location - Safe & near to main sights - We love walking Paris (day & night) & to walk to Arc de T (cross town) is only an hour by foot. Don't miss Rue Cler, which is just round the corner - Great for just sitting & watching. The hotel itself is small & in a back road - very little street noise - close to Metro, laundromat & main avenues. Hotel was very clean with an efficient front desk, internet & small breakfast room serving standard b'fast fare. Plenty of Americans around so the word has got out. Rooms are very small (typically Parisien), tiny lift & narrow corridors. Luggage room was available to leave luggage during the day. Unfortunately check-in was very late (3-ish). Overall our favourite for Paris so far.

Reviews.Title: “Just as expected”
Reviews.Author: HammerheadMontana
Reviews.Content: A reasonable walk from public transportation, even with backpacks. Easy walk to the tower, and other sites. No need for taxis or trains at all if you can walk a little bit. Staff friendly, room very clean and comfortable. Passed on breakfast- some of the best food we had in europe was the bread and pastries we found at bakeries within a few minutes walk of the hotel. Spent about 3 euros each morning for outstanding food. Very quiet location, would certainly stay here again without hesitation if we ever return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris Secret”
Reviews.Author: DonSanders
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (16) and I stayed here for three nights in early June. The hotel is everything we expected, clean, quiet and convenient. The hotel is located 2 blocks from the Metro (Ecole Militaire station) and a short walk to the Rue Cler neighborhood. Our room (#21) was a nice size, having a king size very comfortable bed and a converted couch where my son slept. This couch was seperated from the rest of the room by a wall. There were two closets and a bathroom with new fuxtures. A plasma TV carried 1 English speaking channel (CNN). We did not eat at the hotel as we walked to cafe's, bakeries or crepe places each morning. Numerous restaurants and cafes are with a three block radius of the hotel. The hotel sits on a small side street so street noise was never an issue. The hotel itself was very quiet and the A/C worked very well. An in room safe was convenient for storing passports, cash etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful with information. The hotel stored our luggae on the last day aftyer checkout as our train for London did not leave unitl 7pm and we still had sightseing to do. We have already recommmended the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Decor and Location - desk staff could have been more helpful”
Reviews.Author: herbalsoaplady
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this delightful hotel. Our room at the back was super quiet as requested. Completely remodeled. Small room like most hotels in Paris. But we were thrilled that everything was so new and clean. Our ceiling was painted a pale blue with white and sunset (soft) pink/red clouds. Molding at the ceiling was attractively painted. Bed covers and drapes were new and very nice. Bed side tables with decorative lamps were nice to have. The best part was the reading lamps attached to the headboard. Great for us as we could not sleep on our first two nights. New wardrobe with mini safe, new gilt framed mirror, new table under the mirror. Weird that the hair dryer was permanently attached inside a drawer in this table. Guess there was no room in the bathroom. Bathroom small and efficient - loved the shower. A/C was working even thought it was not June (they still indicate A/C in the Summer only on their web site. Desk staff would not break a 20 Euro note so we could tip our shuttle driver. Had I thought about it I should have charged our coffee to the room as I had just paid in Euros and was then left with no small notes or coins. Seemed rather odd to me. All in all a great place to stay. We walked every where even back from the Eiffel tower late at night. Found cabs easily. Loved having breakfast on the Rue Cler where there are plenty of good places for all 3 meals of the day. Don't miss the pastry shops and do buy a Tart de Citron from the one on the corner with the sandwiches out front. Think I had 3 in 3 days. Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a view”
Reviews.Author: Theresearchers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 2 nights in May in room 62 and can not recommend it highly enough. If we are lucky enough to return to Paris again this will be without a doubt my first choice. On arrival we opened the curtains and couldn't believe our luck to see the Eiffel tower fill our room. When we told a tour operator about our view they were amazed at the price we were paying for such a view, we were told we could expect to pay double the price elsewhere for such a view. I'm sure room 62 won't be a secret for much longer as many Parisians we spoke to from tour companies weren't even aware of its existence. It truly is a little gem at a reasonable price in an expensive city. Yes the rooms are on the smaller side but no smaller than many others we have stayed in.As the hotel has been recently refurbished the rooms and bathrooms were very new, clean and of a higher standard. It definately deserves a higher star rating. Madame Pelletier and her staff were very friendly and helpful,even letting us have our rooms 4 hours early for which we were most grateful. The breakfast was also well presented at an additional cost of 9 Euros per person in a little courtyard. We would highly recommend Hotel Muguet as a charming and small boutique style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BobPrice
Reviews.Content: My wife, 24 year old son, and I stayed at the Muguet for a week over spring break. It was an exellent experience. Our room was not large, but we had a king size bed and a twin. The bathroom was not large, but everything was new and very nicely done. The entire room was recently remodeled and in excellent condition. The location was great. We were close to the metro and within walking distance to good restaurants. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning and found the 8 euro charge to be well worth it. The staff were friendly and helpful and all spoke English. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tres enchante”
Reviews.Author: hollychantal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Muguet from March 19th to the 24th 2006. We chose this hotel based on positive reviews from tripadvisor and they did not mislead us. The hotel was in the process of being remodeled but the workers showed up at about 10:00 am and left around 6:00pm. We were NEVER disturbed by any noise or inconvience. The update to the rooms is well worth it. Upon entering our chambre there was a good size armoire for clothing, a writing desk, a wall mounted flat screen TV, a very comfortable bed(felt like a Tempurpedic matress) and two small nightstands. Two large windows looked out on the street below which is a quite residential street (almost no noise at night). The toilette is also brand new with a showe/bath combo. The room is decorated in tones of browns and blue. Very current. The new bedding,floor, etc look almost modern mixed with antique furnishings. ( I am an interior designer and was VERY impressed). The size of the room was perfect for my husband and I did not feel cramped one bit. Staff and the front desk were welcoming and polite so no complaints there. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the ecole militaire metro stop and very close to the Rue Cler market street for morning croissant and expresso. We were exteremly pleased with the Hotel Muguet and will most certainly stay here again on out next trip to lovely Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet...like falling in love all over again”
Reviews.Author: ton_amie
Reviews.Content: Ahh..Paris and the Hotel Muguet were like falling in love all over again! My husband and I just returned from the Hotel Muguet last night. We had a fantastic stay. Madame Pelletier's hotel business card says, "Calm and Comfort". That is exactly what we were looking for. It was the perfect place for us! We will always remember how genuinely pleasant and accommodating the entire staff was to us. Clean is a biggie for us, and this hotel is immaculate. Our lives are very hectic, so we looked for a hotel on a quiet side street. Hotel Muguet is close to Rue Cler, the Seine, Invalides, and the Eiffel Tower but it is nestled on a quiet, residential side street..and we loved the location! We love to walk and the hotel's location was super for that. We walked the streets Rue Cler and Rue Mouffetard and searched for the perfect baguette and the perfect crepe. We walked to the Seine and took not one but TWO bateaux mouches rides. We walked to the Eiffel Tower every day just for the fun of it. And our eyes were filled with amazement as we watched the tower sparkle each night from our room. We took the time to sit, talk, stare, share, smile and just be together with Paris. We are a fifty-something couple, and we felt like kids again. Ahh..pure magic. Yesterday as we were sitting in the hotel lobby waiting for our van to arrive to take us to the aiport, my husband was taking a few photos of the hotel. Madame Pelletier offered to take a picture of us in the lobby. What a thoughtful gesture and what a special keepsake for us. We will treasure our visit to the Hotel Muguet for a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms with 2 star service”
Reviews.Author: EscapesfromTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked at Hotel Muguet based largely on various online reviews that seemed to be generally positive. Our experience was pretty mixed. Without a doubt, the rooms are decently-sized for Paris and very nicely appointed for a 2 star hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the room was cozy and quiet. The remodeling was only a minor inconvenience in getting around the painters and wet paint. Not really a problem. The service, though, was merely OK. Housekeeping did provide toiletries for showering, but it was fun each day to see what they'd leave. One day it was shower gel and soap, but no shampoo. Next day, you get shampoo but no soap. Kinda quirky, but still not really a problem. The front desk staff was, I think, trying to go for an aloof, professional Parisian image, but unfortunately, they just consistently came off as rude. Even with my broken French, I have always been treated courteously in my other visits to France, so I was not impressed with this visit. The rate was the same as hotels I've stayed in in Paris with higher star ratings, so I didn't really find this to be a value. The hotel is on a residential street with a wonderful market area a block away. Overall, an OK visit, but I'll return to the Observatoire Luxembourg or another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly charming”
Reviews.Author: nycgirl1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Paris and stayed the last two nights at Muguet. We were in a remodeled room on the 1st floor (which is actually the 2nd floor) and while our view wasn't anything to write home about, the room more than made up for it. Beautifully redone, enough space for the two of us (although we're from NYC so aren't big on space to begin with). We didn't hear a peep from the remodeling that was going on down the hall, and only saw a worker once during our two days there. There's an internet connection in the lobby, and the little breakfast area is cute...though we never ate there due to oversleeping (tail end of our two week honeymoon and we were over the whole waking up early to sightsee thing!) Very close access to the Metro, although if you stay out past 1am when the Metro stops running, it can be hard to find a taxi ride home. Especially if it's raining. HIGHLY recommend eating right down the street at Pasco's. The parmesan risotto dish was to die for, and the restaurant is beautiful and romantic. You can make reservations earlier in the day when you walk by, as you will a million times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: denada78us
Reviews.Content: I spent only one Saturday night at Hotel Muguet, and I plan on spending many more there. I've visited Paris probably 15 times now and for the value, location, and service, this hotel is tops. My room was on the 5th floor, and I had a view of the Eiffel Tower out of my bedroom. The marble bathroom was large for Paris standards, and it was well-appointed. A nice treat was the wall-mounted flat screen TV which allowed for more table space. The staff aimed to please. I had my elderly parents with me on their first visit to Paris, and the staff arranged for a taxi with a "friendly driver" to take us around the city to see all of the landmarks. Staying on the weekend, there was no noise associated with the rennovation. It looks as though they may be near completion, so I would ask when making reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Chad_and_Ang
Reviews.Content: As first time travellers to Paris, we really didn't know where to base ourselves, and now that we've been - we'd say near the Eiffel Tower is not the best location. Probably better to make the trip there than to stay nearby. The Muguet is a decent Parisian hotel - small, comfortable, and small. We couldn't both fit in the elevator with our bags at the same time (and no, we're not big). My brother has since stayed in Paris and we found him a fantastic hotel in the Latin Quartier (The Sully-Saint-Germain), which had similar rates. (We've been told to recommend room 5).

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but may be more than you need”
Reviews.Author: qirex
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here in March in one of the redone rooms. I had a good experience overall despite the construction [see below]. My room was always clean, there was always someone with good English at the front desk. The room was fairly well appointed if not cramped. It was a big bed room with 2 cabinets, a desk, TV and radiator heat. The windows were new and didn't draft at all. There isn't a tremendous amount of hanging clothes storage but there's lots of shelf space. The safe is a digital combination model rather than the more typical type that gets keyed to a credit card. Cleaning was typically done in the 1-3pm range and seemed very thorough. Overall I had a great experience staying there, my main complaints are geared more towards the neighborhood. If you're a young person the 7th is a bit slow and while Metro access is great there isn't a whole lot of nightlife and affordable restaurant diversity in the area. This has its good side too as relatively speaking it felt a lot less touristy than Montmartre or St Germain and seemed very safe. It should be noted that they are still doing construction/renovation and depending on your room and floor there may be noise and/or inconvenience because of it. A couple times I ended up having to walk up to the 4th floor because the elevator was occupied for 5 minutes+. My room had a few rough spots like an unfinished vent, a loose toilet seat, a slight smell of paint and an access panel that wouldn't close for a while but these all seem temporary. Most of the construction itself was done during normal business hours but if you're very sensitive to this you might want to ask in advance.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay in Paris -- near Rue Cler, the Invalides, and the Eiffel Tower. I have stayed at the Muguet about 15 times. It is on a quiet street; the staff and owner are always very helpful and personable. The rooms are always clean; the rooms are elegant and very tasteful. I have always had a delightful stay at the Hotel Muguet. I do not stay at any other hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Deceitful practices!!!”
Reviews.Author: RBryan1011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet and was not informed that the hotel was undergoing renovation. When we checked into the hotel we were told that this was the only room and that we could only accept this room. The hotel was undergoing renovation and the air and dust was toxic throughout the hotel. We had to sleep with the windows open throughout the entire evening since the air made us sick. My wife returned home with major allergy problems. When we brought this to the attention of the hotel manager, Catherine PELLETIER she outright denied that this was a problem and we were the only guests that complained. I have traveled all over the World and this was the first such experience that I ever had with a hotel. This manager cannot be trusted and also why does the French always think that saying sorry but not making concessions allows them to provide poor services. The room was small and we could barely move around our luggage. Overall a very very poor experience. I do not know what all the fuss is about!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: oltbp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last summer - end of AUgust. Paris was hot, the room air conditioned and for 100 euros a night we thought we got a good deal. The metro is 5 minutes walk. There are a few restaurants close by, even more if you head past the Eiffel Tower. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: NorthShoreAustralian
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in mid December and we loved it. It is close to the Metro station La Tour Marbourg, a great stroll to Invalidies and the Tour Eiffel. The staff are friendly, the hotel is clean and the service is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “good for the money”
Reviews.Author: 65mstang
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Muguet from Jan. 14 to 19. I think the hotel is a good value for the money. My room was small but immaculately clean. I liked the location of the hotel. It was a block from the Ecole Militaire metro stop. Although I would suggest this hotel if you are on a budget, in the future I think I will spend more money and stay in a hotel that is slightly less basic. I also thought the breakfest was overpriced at 9 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Central Location”
Reviews.Author: klr
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Muguet located close walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and Invalides in a quiet street with little through traffic. We had Room Number 1 which is on the ground floor at the end of a lovely planted courtyard so no people walking past and you can fully open the windows with a view into the garden, nice and relaxing with a glass of wine and nibbles after a day of walking around taking in the sights of Paris. We didn't have breakfast as we sampled the local pastry shops and Rue Cler although a little disappointed in Rue Cler after seeing other fruit and veg markets in France especially Versailles on Friday mornings. Close to Metro and staff very friendly and helpful, luggage room to leave bags after checking out before departure later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: kimseystation
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Dec 29-Jan 5th, 2006. I had read all of the reviews on TripAdvisor because I am paranoid of dirty bathrooms and buggy linens, especially on OUR tight budget. Everything I had read on here was absolutely true. The rooms are small (but this was really no big deal for my husband and I). The bathrooms are immaculate and we had towel service everday, which I did not expect. The housekeeping did a great job everyday changing our linens and cleaning up. The service is great, we especially like the two gentlemen who worked the night shift. They had an ELEVATOR! Which seems really important after walking the entire city. I ate the breakfast twice, it is sort of a nice change if you have been eating out a lot, or are just really exhausted. Other advice: Breakfast at the hotel isn't as cheap as going to the bakery around the corner on Avenue De La Motte-Piquet where we would pick up a quiche (chaud) a pain du chocolate (frois) and a baquette for about 6 Euros total. Across the street from that bakery is the SuperMarche where you can pick up some cold-cuts, fruit, juice boxes and bottles of water to fill out the first two meals of the day for another 4 or 5 euros. I recommend the Spanish Clemetines, they travel really well. (You can also pick up a 6 euro bottle of champagne and chill it outside your window at the hotel). Dec/Jan are COLD months in Paris. Pack a nicer jacket than we did (we wore ski-type jackets and stuck out like sore thumbs). Think wool peacoat and the like. An umbrella as well, as it did snow and rain a little. Because of this, we were able to see a lot of sights with out a lot of crowds, so putting up with the rain was well worth it. Don't buy the metro "pass" unless you are staying from Sunday-Saturday. If you buy midweek you lose some value. My husband and I shared "Carnets" and felt that we got the best value that way. Definitely buy the longest possible Carte D'Musee you can. We bought the five day museum pass and it saved us a bunch of time because we didn't have to wait in line, we just marched right up to the entrances marked "Reservee". Always carry spare change for the public toilets! Just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lucyethel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 9 nights in November and had a pleasant stay. The temperature of the room was adequately warm. Yes it is small. And the bed was a only a double, but any larger and you wouldn't be able to walk around the room. They are in the midst of doing renovations to some of the rooms, so you will hear some construction noise in the morning, but we found that it didn't really start until 8:30 am and was never at night. At least the construction noise served as a good alarm clock to make sure you don't over sleep. The front desk were friendly and very accomidating when we first arrived. We were 3 hours early before the check in and they graciously let us store our luggage in their locked closet and allowed us to take our time and freshen up in their downstairs bathroom. We had problems with our shuttle and they would call them for us and give us the messages whenever they called. Everything was very clean. For a budget hotel it's great, b/c usually you sacrafice cleanliness for having paid less. But that's not the case for the Muguet. Our room was about 115 euros. No mini fridge in the rooms which would have been nice, but since we went in November, it was cold enough to stash our drinks and cheese out on the window ledge at night. Awesome boulangerie's very nearby. The best! The Invalides and Eiffel Tower are close by. As well as a supermarket, restaurants, ATM, and metro. Wouldn't hesistate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 Star treasure with a 3 Star heart”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night visit in Paris at The Muguet and it is the perfect cosy (being the operative word!) place to stay for those with champagne tastes but only a vin de table budget. It is of a 3 star quality for a 2 star. The rooms may be tiny but they are stylishly decorated and impeccably clean as are the bathrooms. The beds are firm and very comfortable with crisp clean linens and great big fluffy towels are in supply in the bathrooms. The soap and shampoo are a little rudimentary, however this was not a problem for me as I always travel with my own.(Changing soaps too often irritates the skin). There is no mini-bar in the room and the "faux antique" furniture though charming is not very practical as the drawers are faux as well (they don't open) so one has only limited surface area to put stuff. However the closet was large enough for clothes,luggage..etc. My recommendation would be that this is the ideal place for a three nights or less stop as otherwise the cramped quarters would begin to strain on one a little. The hotel is in a very good, safe and upscale neighborhood of Paris which is also blessedly quiet (I slept like a rock both nights and I am a very light sleeper). I took taxis to wherever I needed to go (Champs Elysee, Moulin Rouge...etc) to save time and never paid more than from six to ten euros (my furthest point was Gare Du Nord) including tip. One can walk to the Eiffel Tower within ten minutes from the hotel going through a neighborhood full of shops, cafes and restaurants. The ladies who run the front desk could not be more helpful (particularly Mme Bonnet) and I can't comment on the breakfast at 8.5 euros as I don't eat first thing in the morning, however I do like my coffee and for 2 Euros you get a pot of it that fills two large cups. I can recommend the Brasserie Bosquet on the Avenue of the same name which is a five minute walk from the Hotel for dinner with a great Menu du Jour which is reasonable. I was given a small room with a small double bed on the 5th floor overlooking the courtyard for a single rate of 70 euros. I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “What more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: SBH55
Reviews.Content: For those looking for a reasonably priced (by Paris Standards!), well located, and CLEAN place to stay while touring Paris this is the place. The rooms are ample sized - quite large for European standards. The bathroom modern. And contrary to other reviewers - we found most of the staff very pleasant and helpful (I do speak French - however they were just as nice to the other members of our party who didn't speak the language). We were provided with a triple room - which is ideal for families w/ children. I will say- the main selling point of this hotel is the cleaniless... AMAZING - and better than most 4/5 star hotels I have stayed in for business! The area is ideal - close to a metro stop and within walking distance of wonderful cafes and shops. I would highly recommend this hotel to others and will stay there again when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet was very nice, friendly, clean and in an upscale areal!”
Reviews.Author: starsitka
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights with another couple at the Hotel Muguet, in December, 2005. The room and bathroom, though small, were extremely clean and well taken care of. The desk staff members were friendly and very helpful. We had our breakfast here for 8 Euros everyday. The breakfast was very good, the bread and croissants were excellent, and the garden breakfast room is clean and pleasant. Madam Catherine Pellitier, is the owner. She is friendly and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were in the Rue Cler area. It is a small, upscale shopping area, with good cafes and nice shops. We walked to the Rue Cler daily to shop at the market and eat at the cafes. The price of the hotel is a good buy and the rooms are in the process of being remodeled. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it, great location, staff”
Reviews.Author: miower
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at the Muguet for two night from the 12th November. I stayed here because of the reviews from tripadvisor, so glad i took your advise. The best thing about the hotel is the great location, it is in the centre of things but not touristy at all. The staff were briliant, the room spotless, there is nothing you can fault this hotel on. The restaurants are also fantastic nearby, and we got to the hotel easily from the airport on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit - great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Paris for our 10th wedding anniversary from September through October of this year. We read about Hotel Muguet on this website and were really looking forward to it. All of the reviews are spot on. The hotel lobby is nice and the breakfast area and small garden are lovely. If you have a room on an upper floor, be wary of the stairs. I am assuming that the stairs are original as they are narrow and a bit precarious when wielding luggage. You can take the elevator, but only one person at a time. Most of the time we took the stairs and it was just fine. The daytime staff was pleasant and spoke English (though we did try to use our abhorrent French with them and they graciously tried to communicate with us without making us feel silly). We also accidentally locked our stuff in the room save and couldn't figure out how to open it back up (boorish Americans!). The owner (?) was quite nice and helped us out immediately. An earlier review mentioned the poodle. They were absolutely right -- mean little bugger!! The nighttime staff was very friendly and helped us find restaurants. The room was quite big with our own bathroom and an extra bed. My only complaint is that the beds were really hard. We woke up stiff several mornings. Other than that, the rooms were large for Europe, the bathrooms were clean and updated. The decor in the rooms is basic. So, if you're planning to hang out in there with views and ambiance, this isn't your place. Otherwise, everything was fine. The area is had much more of a neighborhood feel than the more touristy area where we stayed in the 2nd part of our trip (the 5th arrondissement). There are many great local restaurants nearby--too many to name, actually. And a metro-stop nearby. So, other than the hard beds and lack of ambiance in the rooms, I would definitely recommend this hotelâ€”particularly given the location!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay, a very clean room, a nice view from our window, and kind and excellent help from the front desk. We traveled with our 13 month old son, and they had a very nice pack n' play with a mattress and sheets all ready for us and allowed us to check in early. Everyone was very helpful and so nice. The price can't be beat for Paris (and about 7 minutes walking distance from the Eiffel Tower, and 3 minutes from the Metro). We wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else (unless we got really rich:)!!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: jasonowl
Reviews.Content: Was with my wife and we stayed 5 nights at the Hotel (29Oct-3Nov), wonderful place. Thanks to Tripadvisor and all it's users for having valuable unbaised reviews. We had room 49, and it is at the end of corridor, so we had an extra walkway leading into the actual room itself. The Hotel is spanking clean, the toilet was spotless. Would highly recommend this Hotel for its price, and would stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelMania
Reviews.Content: A great find, especially if you intend to walk or take the metro to see the sites. Rue Cler is only a block away, the metro stop 2 blocks. The Eiffel Tower was a 10 minute stroll. The hotel was clean and pleasant, the front desk staff spoke English and were quite helpful if asked. Our room was quite small (just enough room to walk between the bed and dresser) with no view, but we only slept there so who cares. We would definitely recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, amply sized rooms with bright bathrooms. Having stayed in several other Paris hotels (all ***) during the same trip, this was the best hotel among them. Extremely convenient to metro, an easy walk to Les Invalides and the Tour Eiffel. The elevator actually fit both of us with our luggage. We booked it based on the reviews here, and I'm afraid our collective ratings will either drive the price up or make it full every day of the year. Great for them, but a challenge for all of us to find something as great, convenient, and well-priced.

Reviews.Title: “jewel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this small hotel, located between the Eifel Tower and Napoleon's tomb, for five days in September. As other reviewers have noted the hotel is small but an excellent location and a bargain price. Staff was very friendly and helpful, and the rooms are neat and clean. This is a very quiet neighborhood at night. Highest recommendation, but reserve your room well in advance. ---

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a good little two star hotel in a great location. While it only has two stars the accommodation was more 3 to 4 star. Added to that the staff were very helpful while we enjoyed the breakfast which was set up in a enclosed courtyard with a glass roof so letting in lots of light. A great way to start the day. The loaction was excellent and was within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower with the Metro a short walk away. next to the Metro was a supermarket and not far away a laudromat. Its a good find - although I suspect a lot of people already know that!

Reviews.Title: “Try this one!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! Great location to get all over the city on the Metro, many lovely restaurants, quiet side street but near everything. Room newly refurbished--clean and bright. Loved the help I got from Madame (can't recall her name); when I came in or out each day, she'd help me improve my French. Will definitely recommend this and return when I can.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet: good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good value. We had 2 rooms at the top of the hotel - one looked out on the Eiffel Tower & one on Invalides.
