Beds were comfortable, shower or tub (one each room) were better than average European. Safe in the room was handy. I'd say skip the breakfasts for an add'l 8 Euros and go to the Rue Cler and pick up wonderful things to eat in your room (pastries, fruit, crepes, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AIRTECH
Reviews.Content: Just back from Paris and our 3 night stay at the Hotel Muguet. It was very clean and although the rooms are small, they were very comfortable. The continental breakfast was very good and the staff was helpful overall. We would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler2327
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quaint and clean, but the rooms are simple and small (especially the showers!). Our stay was fine until the day we checked out. The clerks told us that both of our credit cards were coming back as denied. This confused us as they'd been working fine all week. They asked us if we could pay by cash, so we left the hotel to get money and to call the credit companies. When we spoke to Mastercard and Visa they assured us that there was nothing wrong with the accounts and that there had been NO charge attempts on either card in the past 24 hours. When we went back to the hotel and explained this they seem uninterested and only wanted to know if we had the cash. We asked them to try our cards again, but they were reluctant and wanted to know why we just didn't pay with cash if we had it. My husband wanted to be done with the situation so he gave them the cash and we left fuming. It's no secret that hotels prefer cash over credit, but this was a very sneaky, tasteless way to get it. I would NOT recommend this hotel, as I'm sure they try the same on others.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with family from Ireland Friendly staff .In great area not far from lovely cafe's and eaterys.Clean well serviced rooms. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in a Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: WIBadgergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Muguet for two nights in Sept, 2005. Small but very clean rooms with air cond, nice bathrooms and our room had a very limited view of the Eiffel Tower. We found the desk clerks to be brisk and cool to us when booking tours/asking directions/using the internet. If you go out you must turn in your key at the front desk and then they give it back to you when you return. If you are out past a certain time (10 pm?) you have to ring the bell to get in. We didn't eat breakfast there as there were many places nearby. The owner has a dog that was in the lobby area each day we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in a wonderful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Samejesse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Muget on our very first trip to Europe and Paris. It was great. We read about the hotel in Rick Steveâ€™s Best of Europe. Our in-laws had a room and we had a room - so we got to see two very different rooms. The neighborhood was just wonderful, you really felt like you were a local! Medium walking distance to the Eiffel tower (after traveling all over Europe I don't know what a short walk vs. a long walk is anymore - all we did was walk!) Close to two metro stations. Breakfast - just skip it, it is over priced and there are a few great pastry shops & cafes a few blocks over on les Invalides. Also there is a little grocery store on the way to les Invalides that sells the cheapest bottled water in Europe. Our room was very clean, new looking bathrooms, plain bed - nothing fancy but fine. We also had a window that opened with a tiny trellis (common in Paris) and nice A/C. Just make sure when you make your reservation to tell them that you don't want the room in the attic - the top level. Our in-laws had that room - the ceiling comes down at a sharp angel - which makes the room smaller and you hit your head frequently. The light also comes through the window in the slanted ceiling pretty harshly in the morning and heats up the place. We would stay here again, (so would my inlaws if they were promised a different room).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a find. I would stay at this hotel any time we visit Paris in the future. Air conditioned hotel at a great price, which was particularly important as we visited in August. The hotel was clean and the staff very personable and helpful. Located on a quiet street near Napoleon"s Tomb and Les Invalides. Very good places to eat a block away on the Rue Cler and surrounding streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: Peppy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for three nights in Paris. The location was wonderful--it is in a residential neighborhood, right off of Rue Cler, and there are a lot of little shops and restaurants nearby. There are a number of markets for fresh produce, meat and fish, a very good chocolate shop down the street, and a number of great boulangeries. We could not have asked for a better location. In addition to the immediate neighborhood, it is also within convenient walking distance to Les Invalides, the Eiffel Tower and the Rodin museum. We were also able to walk to the Louvre, the Musee D'Orsay and the Arc de Triomphe from the hotel. If you want public transportation, it is very close to the Ecole Militaire metro stop (a few blocks away). The room we stayed in was great. It was small, but average for a European hotel. There was no mini-bar, but there was a television and safety box. The airconditioning was very good. The room was very, very clean. There was no do not disturb sign, which resulted in some confusion one time when a maid mistakenly thought we had left our room. Of course, you can always make your own. The people at the front desk were quite helpful, and there was internet access for our use, costing 2 euros for a half hour. We did not eat their breakfast, as it was so easy to walk down the street and buy a baguette. We would definitely return to this hotel--the location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Convenient, Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: ILNDGRL71
Reviews.Content: Nestled in a residential neighborhood, Hotel Muguet is close to everything, but off the beaten path. The staff was friendly, the building was well maintained and the room was very clean and quiet. Breakfast is served in a quaint interior courtyard and there are many bustling bistros within walking distance. We couldn't see the Eiffel Tower from our second floor room, but it and a metro stop are within a few blocks of the hotel. We were completely satisfied during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Liked Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: cchancesare
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days in August. Great little hotel. Friendly staff, very clean hotel. By European standards our room was a fair size so was the bathroom. Trip of a lifetime, never in my wildest dreams did I think I could see the Eiffel Tower while lying in bed. What an amazing treat - Thanks Catherine (even though we never met). This hotel is in a quiet neighbourhood. Close to two metro stops. Close to the Invalides and to the Eiffel Tower. Many pastry shops nearby. We never had the breakfast - it looked good but we were always on the go. We had friends staying at another hotel (too bad - their loss); they were quite jealous when they saw our room. The rooms at this hotel were larger than theirs. So if you looking for a nice clean hotel, good price; friendly service; quiet street - this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife and i just spent 5 nights in this hotel. the hotel was recently renovated. we stayed in a double room with one bed. the hotel and room were impeccably clean and well cared for. the room was small, but typical of other paris hotels we have stayed at (dauphine st. germain, duminy vendome, l'horset d'astor). the hotel breakfast was typical and appropriate for the price. selections included coffee, juice, ham, eggs, cereal, yogurt, fruit, cheese, croissant, french bread etc. serve yourself, no limits. very close to the rue cler, a wonderful street of eateries and food stores. there is also a zagut recommended restaurant right around the corner from the hotel. the hotel is also just a few hundred yards from a metro stop, so the location is fine. the invalides, rodin and eiffel tower are all within easy walking distance. the staff were all friendly and polite and the desk staff all spoke english. for 100 euro's per night it is an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “no regrets, best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got home - 8 nights at the Hotel Muguet. Perfection and comfort best describes this gem. The location is great for everything. I was travelling with my husband, 2 sons and my 80 year old mother-in-law, this hotel made it all work. The quiet, safe street and great rooms, I had the best sleep ever. A cafe on every corner makes eating out so easy and delicious. I would go back in a heart beat, no question about it. The staff and everyone in Paris were fantastic, so helpful and friendly. Just remember your manners, please and thank you (in French) go a long way.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel and a good price”
Reviews.Author: texorker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in mid August. Our room (for three) was quite good sized and included a small alcove for our daughter. The room was well done with great air conditioning, nice bathroom and very large thick towels. The staff was helpful and courteous. I peeked into some other rooms and they also looked decent sized. A lovely hotel in a good quiet location near restaurants and two metro stops. A great boulangerie patisserie nearby on Rue la motte-Picquet . No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: emba56
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights in July and found it to be wonderful. It is in a quiet neighbourhood in Paris and about five minutes walk to the eiffel tower and 2 mins to the ecole militaire metro station. There is also a laundromat in the street if you need to do washing and a nice little bistro around the corner. Staff were courteous and helpful (in contrast to most Paris natives- particularly taxi drivers!) with the front desk open 24 hours. The rooms are tiny (as are all rooms in Europe) but immaculate - this hotel is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet - Highly Recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in paris, we had views of the Eiffel Tower from our room. The rooms were very clean and really nicely decorated, the bathroom was all white and immaculate, every member of staff we dealt with was very helpful and also spoke English which was great for us. The breakfast was gorgeous and set in their lovely conservatory area. I couldn't recommend this hotel high enough and so reasonably priced, my husband and I stayed for one night, had breakfast and coffees in the afternoon and it came to a total of 117 euroes but it felt like we were staying in a hotel which was twice that! A little extra free service they offered us was to take care of our luggage when we arrived in the morning until our rooms were ready and from checking out until our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Sharoninsc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Muguet has so much going for it that I can't think why anyone who wants a mid-priced hotel would stay anywhere else. It's in a great residential neighborhood (not far from the Eiffel Tower), on a very quiet side street, with easy access to more than one Metro station. It's surrounded by so many restaurants you won't know where to stop. It's a block from a supermarket, half a block from a traffic-less shopping district. The hotel has airconditioning that really works, washcloths in the bathroom, good reading lights, a pleasant breakfast room with a reasonably priced and varied breakfast, Internet access (fast and fee-based) in the lobby, and accommodating people at the front desk who speak English. Rooms are adequately sized and beds are fine. I just hope they don't read all these reviews and raise their rates!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidpf
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not disappoint us. We stayed there for 2 nights 7/16 - 7/17/05. The location was excellent and the accomodations were very nice. It was a pleasant surprise. When we go back to Paris this is where we will stay. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant Muguet”
Reviews.Author: whenissummer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 12 nights at Hotel Muguet and it was super. Great location, quiet, great friendly staff (they put up with my 10 words of French) and air conditioned. Rooms are small for american standards but clean, clean, clean, they must have cleaning elves. I would suggest the Muguet to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Botched our reservation”
Reviews.Author: Peddler
Reviews.Content: This looks like a wonderful property, but I am at a loss to explain why they refused to honor my family's reservation made months earlier. The proprietor had our e-mail correspondence, including my credit card numbers and security codes, and had confirmed their receipt. But upon our arrival she tells me she needed a ``confirmation'' as well, so we don't have a reservation and she's full. I asked what she needed beyond our agreement on the room availability, the nights, the rate and my payment information. Same response: a ``confirmation.'' Beats me. She tried to help us find a replacement, but it didn't work out so we found a place on our own. Of three hotels in three cities, two trains and airline tickets, this was the only reservation that had any problem whatsoever. Like I say, it looks like a really nice hotel; just double-check your reservations if you decide to go.

Reviews.Title: “A Jem very close to Invalides and Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, great location, friendly staff and reasonable prices. Highly recommended for Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this wonderful hotel when we had problems with an apartment we had rented. The staff were very helpful and extremely friendly. The rooms were of a really high standard and great value for the price. I can't recommend this hotel enough and the location is great for seeing the Eiffel tower and the Rue de cler. Old men play boules in the park down the road so it is easy to forget you are in the middle of a buzzing city.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal and a great spot”
Reviews.Author: jandtpeters
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muget was the perfect hotel for us. The staff was courteous and helpful, recommending great restaurants and giving directions. Breakfast was a bit pricey, but convienent and filling. We mostly went down the street to the supermarket or stopped at a bakery on our way out for the day. The location is perfect, and not too touristy. We really got a feel for everyday Parisian life, and I never felt unsafe on the streets outside the hotel. The rooms are spotless and comfortable, but fairly small. For couples, I would recommend the Queen room, not the Standard Double. The Queen room is 8 Euros more, but the bed is much larger, and so is the bathroom--we found it to be worth the money. Web access in the lobby is a nice bonus. We will absolutley stay here again when in Paris. It's the best value in town!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little gem in Paris”
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Muguet. It is a lovely small hotel in the Rue Cler area. From the moment we entered the hotel I knew it was the perfect place for our stay. The hotel staff are very friendly and attentive. Our room was a triple room. That room was apparently larger than those for a double or single. The bathrooms were of ample size and included a tub with a shower. The towels were generous in size and it was the only place that we stayed in Europe that actually had wash cloths. There is a hair dryer available in the room. The hotel is very clean and the staff could not have been more helpful. Tours can be arranged from the hotel and transfers to the airport were less expensive when booked at the hotel. There is breakfast available daily for 8.5 euros. We did not take advantage of that, but it was served in a lovely area overlooking a small courtyard. Right around the corner from the hotel on Rue Cler, there are markets and bakeries. We enjoyed going out for breakfast for quiche or a fresh croissant or pastry of your choice. There is also a supermarket close by to buy less expensive waters or other needs. The hotel is within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. There is a lovely area to picnic there and watch the tower as it lights up in the evening. The Invalides is closeby and we were even able to walk to many areas including Notre Dame, ile de St Louis, St. Germain, etc. The metro is very closeby and the RER station is located conveniently if you want to take a trip to Versailles. Thanks to all of those who sent reviews of this Hotel!! It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Muguet”
Reviews.Author: jonyokoseb
Reviews.Content: We just spent three glorious nights at the Hotel Muguet on Rue Chevert in Paris. It was our tenth anniversary, and I must admit to being a bit nervous about the quality of our lodgings. After all, this was supposed to be romantic, and we didn't want some place that felt cheap or dirty. Well, this was just perfect for us. The hotel is on a quiet but elegant street, so the approach to the hotel is one of cleanliness and class. The effort at keeping the place clean is perhaps the most outstanding part of Muguet . . . where did they find such a dedicated staff? And I must say that the staff were incredibly helpful and . . . FRIENDLY! Yes, we did practice the old trick of speaking politely in French to them, so they had the chance to smile and bail us out and gently switch the conversation to English. We just felt that there was nothing they wouldn't do for us, and they looked at us with such interest and respect . . . like we were real people. We weren't sure that we would need the air conditioning in May, but we hit a hot spell (90 degrees Fahrenheit!), so we were very grateful for our cool room. There are individual thermostats in each room, and they work great. The bathroom had blindingly white tile, the towels were generous, the shower worked great, intense birdsong began each day in the courtyard outside our window (lark? canary? one of those exaggerated singers!), and we felt like we were in heaven. The bed was firmer than average, which was great for us -- we like the "stiff as a board" feeling. The sheets / pillowcases were crisp (starched?) and brilliantly clean, like everything else in this hotel. We had heard that some Paris hotels smell smokey, regardless of whether they actually allow smoking, but that certainly was not the case here. We got used to jumping on the subway and getting absolutely ANYWHERE in Paris in 30 minutes or less. Walking to the Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Rodin Museum, the Seine, Rue Cler, etc. was easy and pleasant -- except for the heatwave . . . but that's not Hotel Muguet's fault! In fact, they did everything right, as far as we could tell. We were very happy, and we would recommend this place to everyone. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Price”
Reviews.Author: QUYNH73
Reviews.Content: For my first time in Paris, I was glad I stayed at a hotel like this. The rooms are small but that is what is to be expected of Paris. The bathroom is also a tight squeeze but clean all together! The location is great (near Eiffel Tower) and near 2 metro stations. It's located in a beautiful, quaint, & clean neigborhood with cute shops! It's a few metro stops from the hustling & cute Latin quarters but a quick metro trip regardless. Staff speaks English & was friendly. They stored our luggage during a 3-day trip to London & willingly helped us with directions to our sights around Paris. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doodlebug
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. The staff was very friendly - especially the owner (I thought it was cute to see how her poodle followed her around!). Whenever I needed directions or assistance they were very helpful. I did eat breakfast there because it was convenient - but it was very good too. They had excellent croissants as well as eggs, meat, cheese, yogurt, juice, cereal, etc. The Rue Cler area was lovely and just a short walk away. It was great to have 2 local metro stops nearby - I walked alot, but did use the Metro to visit places further away. My room and bathroom were spotless and well furnished. I especially enjoyed the PC Internet in the lobby! Very convenient and they put the minimal charges on my room bill. I will definitely stay there again when returning to Paris. Viva la France.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: suzbailey
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the reviews here for our 3 night stay in late April 2005 and the hotel did not disappoint. Everything was perfect for the reasonable price of 108 Euro - good location, quite street, very clean, well decorated, friendly staff. The breakfast was average, so spend half as much money for a crepe on Rue Cler around the corner. We had room #63 on the top floor with a view of the dome. It was small as are most hotels in Europe, but very clean. Book early for the rooms with a view of the Eiffel Tower. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: kazarre
Reviews.Content: Situated in a quieter part of town but close enough to the Metro. We didn't partake in the breakfast as we thought it was a bit pricey at 8.50 euros, but this really is a reasonable price in Paris, and the eating area is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The cleanest hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: bostonian
Reviews.Content: And i don't mean just on the day you arrive there. Every day of your stay, your room and bathroom are cleaned to be spotless. The hotel itself and room isn't anything really charming and doesn't have much character as such, but everything works well, is reliable, and feels new. As for the hotel mgr/owner not being incredibly friendly, we went there with that in mind, didn't really attempt to make conversation with her, and just hoped for good service. We got there at 8am to drop off our luggage. To our surprise, they let us know our room was actually open and we could check in right then if we wanted - several hours early. When we needed a cab to the train station, the mgr not only called the cab, but came out and instructed him as to where exactly to take us. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a find! I discovered this hotel by reading tripadvisor reviews, and it was well worth it. The hotel is cosy, in a perfect location. Rooms are normal european standard size and were kept impeccable, we were lucky and got a triple room but only payed for a double, our companions got a double but it was big enough. Located near 2 metro stops. We only used the metro twice and walked everywhere else. With a good pair of walking shoes on you will discover what a treat this hotel is. Located away from the general hussle and bussle and after spending 8 hours in the centre of paris it was nice to retreat back to this quiet little haven. I would highly recommend it. I have absolutely no complaints. Even the dog didn't nip!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: UTgrad
Reviews.Content: After researching your hotel reviews, we selected Hotel Muguet (pronounced MooGay) in the 7th e for a week. We arrived via the Golden Air shuttle, which they recommended, and were instantly impressed with the simple charm and cleanliness of this hotel. The staff at the desk spoke good English and were professionally efficient, i.e. giving directions and advice on restaurants and shopping, making phone calls for us, etc. Our room was indeed small, with twin beds and very little room to move around in, and no seating area. The bathrooms, however, were good sized with a cruise-ship sized shower, hair dryer, and even a make-up mirror next to the sink. If you are particular, you might bring your own soap and shampoo as theirs were not high quality. The fluffy towels were large and replaced daily, as were the sheets. We found the beds to be a bit smaller than US twins, but were comfortable and we slept well. There was also a mirrored closet and safe. Our window faced rue Chevert, which is a residential street with little traffic. The area is clean and feels safe. We probably could have seen the Eiffel if we had been on a higher floor, but we were on the second. The windows keep out the street noise and open for fresh air. The tv worked by remote, and you can get BBC or French stations. It is only a short walk to rue Cler with many shops and restaurants, a post office, several ATMs, and 2 metro stops. We also were able to buy Carte Orange and museum passes at the Ecole Militaire metro station. These proved to be excellent values, saving money and lots of time getting into the museums. The hotel breakfast for 8.5 Euros is not a bad value, although we only ate there once. It is probably the only place you can get cold cereal, yogurt or a boiled egg. With so many other options nearby, we had a wide choice of places to eat. Be aware of their hours (which are all different) so you don't arrive before or after closing. Catherine, the owner, is there daily and maintains a well-run hotel. The decor is simple and tasteful, with calm colors. We felt we got good value for the price and would recommend it for others wanting a very clean, comfortable and convenient room. The hotel is usually full, so reseve well ahead of time. I think they have heat and air conditioning, although neither were necessary while we were there. We liked being able to walk to the Eiffel tower each evening to see the lights. You can also walk eaily to the Seine, Napoleon's tomb and many parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MJosephOH
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Room was small but comfortable and it was clean! Really close to 2 Metro stops, the Eifel Tower and plenty of bakeries and restaurants. The area the hotel is in is really quiet, so noise was never an issue. We didn't eat the breakfast at the hotel, we just walked a block and bought fresh pastries instead. It was a good value, not a lot of charm, but everything you need in a hotel while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “a Value Favorite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would return to this little gem of a hotel. The room is small but the bathroom is large and newly renovated with all new fixtures. It doesn't have a fridge in the room but it has internet in the lobby for 2 Euros for 30 minutes and a great breakfast for 8 Euros (it was worth it), the TV always worked and there were many little amenities. The staff was great. They spoke English with a great French accent and were always very helpful. The location is 1.5 blocks from the Metro and 1 block from Rue Clare, which is a great Market street. There are numerous restaurants close by and the street is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel at an excellent price.”
Reviews.Author: AdamZach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in early April and everything about the experience was top notch. From our arrival late Sunday afternoon on the Eurostar from London to the Friday morning we bid au revoir, we separately rated this hotel beyond our expectations. The location is superb (near the Eiffel Tower). We wanted a very clean hotel with a queen size bed and immaculate and newly modernized bathroom. We got that and more! It is charming in every sense of the word -- amazing for 108 euros a night. I did a lot of research and it paid off at the Hotel Muguet.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nepean01
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great location, superb value. The room is small by North American standards, but you are not in North America, you are in Paris. Why are you spending time in the room? The breakfast was great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Ooblek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Muguet for 6 nights. (2/26/05 - 4/1/05) The first thing that struck me about this place was how spotlessly clean it was! I also liked the quiet neighborhood where it was located. It was so convenient to have the Ecole Millitaire metro stop right around the corner, as well as a supermarket, post office, laundromat, several cafes and the Rue Cler. The staff was wonderful and very pleasant. (The owner, Catherine was extremely "business-like", living up to her reputation. Also, don't try to pet her yippy little poodle. The thing will probably bite your hand off!) I was also lucky enough to be upgraded to a double room for no charge, even though I reserved a single several months in advance. The shower was not as strong as the ones we're used to in the US, but pretty decent by European Hotel standards! My view was kind of cool too - I was on the 5th floor, and looked out at a courtyard surrounded by several other apartment buildings with pretty window boxes. In general, a nice, clean, basic hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient, Lovely”
Reviews.Author: NYCGoogler
Reviews.Content: In the 7th arrondissement and hidden on Rue Chervert, Hotel Muguet offers views of Invalides and The Eiffel Tower from many of it's rooms. Within 2 minutes of Rue Cler, one block off of La Motte Piquet, the Muguet is a bargain at 108 Euro. There is Internet access, a lovely breakfest area, and the staff is very helpful although quite not as fluent in English as might be expected. We had a small attic like room 63 with a view of the Invalides through a skylight window. Through rain and sleep we kept the window opened and heard no sound other than the birds in the Paris rooftops in the morning. The Muguet does not have "charm" but it is very well run, clean, and it's the perfect place and Metro stop (Ecole Militaire) to come home to after a long day. Everywhere you walk there's that darn Eiffel Tower staring at you. Quelle probleme!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for three nights In mid March 2005 and were pleasantly surprised that it is in a quiet location but very close to the Eiffel tower and in very easy reach of most of the City. We only had breakfast there once as at 8.50 Euros per person I didnt feel it was good value, and with Rue Cler round the corner a simple coffee and croissant was much cheaper in a nicer atmosphere with local people. Our room was very clean and the staff were extremely efficient, responding to our attempts at french which were welcomed so its worth trying no matter how bad your accent! Belinda Gosling and Steve Murphy, Huddersfield, West Yorkshire - England.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: fla-girl
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I stayed at Hotel Muguet (3/20 - 3/26). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Paris. We walked virtually everywhere from this great location. Since it is on a side-street in a mostly residential area there was no street noise. We had a beautiful view of the Invalides dome. The room was very clean and we felt that the staff was very friendly -- as friendly as other Parisians we encountered. We ate breakfast only one day as we enjoyed nibbling all day while we walked around. The room was not terribly big but there was a giant closet and a very large bathroom (by european standards). A bed, 2 very small nightstands and a small desk were all that fit into the room but that was all we needed. There is a tv and a hair dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for its location and price”
Reviews.Author: Cecik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Muguet during Thanksgiving weekend in 2004. We had a great stay. The room is a bit small for those accustomed to American hotel's rooms, but remember you are in Paris and you probably will only be using your room to sleep and to freshen up. The bathroom was extremely clean. The best part about this hotel is its location. It's a 15 minutes walk to/from the Eiffel Tower and the metro station is five minutes away. If you want to save some time eat your breakfast at the hotel. Again it's not the typical Ameican breakfast. It's pretty much the basics (bread, coffee, yogurt, cheese and ham) . You do pay 8 euros but it really helped us save time. I highly reccomend your stay at the Hotel Muguet.

Reviews.Title: “Fleas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in late February-early March 2005. When I woke up the first morning, I reported to the ladies at the desk that I had gotten bites during the night. They told me I must be allergic to something, but that they would change the sheets. The next three nights were fine, but then it started again. I didn't realize until I arrived home that they were flea bites and that they had, of course, come home with me. We had a very nice room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The room seemed clean at the time, but the miserable itching we've since endured from the bites has left a very negative impression on us.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews were Right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Muguet for one night on March 5, 2005. When we were planning our trip and researching hotels on the internet, we came across the reviews for this hotel. All of the reviews were favorable, and after staying in this hotel, we have to agree with all of them. The hotel is centrally located near many of the main tourist attractions, yet it is located on a residential street just a couple blocks from all the action. Very quiet and CLEAN. Also, the decor is elegant and tasteful. Everyone working there was friendly and helpful. We would definately stay at the Hotel Muguet again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Incredibly Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello all... My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Muguet (Feb 17th - 20th), and I must say, the reviews posted here are incredibly correct (right down to the owner's business-like demeanour and fifi dog). The hotel is in a great part of Paris, on a side street between Les Invalides and the Eiffel Tower. It is about 100 yards to the Metro line, and there are many little restaurants and bakeries for convenient dining. However, the hotel is so well located that my wife and I walked to all the major tourist destinations and only had to take the Metro to Montmarte and the Airport. Perhaps most importantly, it seemed very safe. My usually nervous wife felt at ease walking home at midnight from a late dinner. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, and the room was incredibly clean, spotless actually, with very tasteful furnishings and a comfortable bed. We were in room 19 (which was slightly larger than some others we looked in) and had a nice view of the courtyard. As opposed to some rooms we've stayed in during previous trips to Paris, this one was very quiet, we didn't hear our neighbours at all. I would highly recommend this hotel based primarily on value. Anybody looking for a clean, convenient and value-added hotel, this is probably as good as you are going to get anywhere in Paris. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Muguet for three nights in February, and we loved it. The location is quiet, safe, and convenient to les Invalides, the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysee, etc. Rue Cler is right around the corner and provides lots of options for breakfast, lunch, or dinner (Cafe du Marche is a great choice for all three). The room and bathroom were small (expected) but clean. Great towels (large and fluffy)! The front desk was efficient and professional (English is spoken to varying degrees depending on who is on duty, but basic French or a good phrasebook should be sufficient--you are in Paris after all, so any English spoken is a bonus and not to be expected). This is a great value for a 2-star accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Value for price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Hotel Muguet over Valentine's Day and it was nice. Quiet, clean, safe, and good coffee, which we had delivered to the room in the mornings. (I had tried to book a room elsewhere and there were no vacancies.) This was my third trip to Paris. We often lingered in our small double room in the morning or made a pit stop during the day, and the room was always cleaned impeccably. There was no need for our adapter, as the plug in the bathroom accepts 115V, so we charged the camera batteries there. The room was in the front of the building and very quiet and private. We tucked our wine behind the window boxes to keep it cool and took some meals in the room, and were not hassled in the least. On the down side, the bed was a bit soft; there aren't enough hooks available throughout to hang up towels and dop-kits and clothing; the furniture has fake drawerfronts, rather than functionality. I'd gladly trade the little TV for minibar under a nightstand. In summer, there must be no place to keep a snack cool. The staff was efficient but I can't say we felt truly welcome at this hotel. Not until we paid our bill at checkout. We both limp along in French rather than English, and I found Parisians running other businesses far more solicitous than the staff at this hotel. The women at the desk during midday were particularly taciturn. This would not prevent me from booking again; it's just a matter of information. I would stay here again if other hotels I'm interested in, with a bit more character and colorful neighborhoods, were unavailable. And we need a mini-fridge of some kind in warmer weather, as we are foodies and cooks and occasionally enjoy a nibble in privateâ€”not taking every meal in a restaurant or brasserie.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We lived in Paris for a couple of years and have vacationed there for more than 20 years. We knew the area around the Hotel Muguet, but always stayed in a 3 star hotel on the basis that it would be larger, nicer, air conditioned, etc. When our favorite hotel raised their price to 165 euros and the euro / dollar rate declined by 30%, we started looking for a more economical alternative. We were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the rooms, comfortable bed, the nice and very large lobby, high speed internet terminal in the lobby with a QWERTY keyboard at 2 euros for 30 minutes, the complete buffet breakfast for 8.5 euros and free English and French newspapers in the lobby. The street in front is narrow, but we easily found a place to park while we unloaded the car. Double glazing on the streetside windows ensures a quiet night, although we had the windows open and there isn'g much traffic. The bistro recommended by the front desk was very nice, although not too many locals were dining there the night we went. Acting like the "ugly American or the Brit that insists on only speaking English" at the front desk is likely to meet with a cool response and watch out for the little poodle who likes to nip. We have already reserved for the next three trips.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Rue Cler area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris over Thanksgiving week and spent the entire time at the Hotel Muguet. The staff was lovely, the location was fantastic and near the Rue Cler area, without being surrounded by "Rick Steves" acolytes. The single room is very small (I rolled over out the bed the first night), but very clean, with a nice, but small bath and excellent, thick towels. I received a surprise discount for staying 6 nights when I checked out. When I return to Paris, I will definitely stay here again. No question.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: dlqsox
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5-night stay at Hotel Muguet and loved it. It's only a two-star hotel but my husband and I were just as pleased as the time we stayed at a 4-star hotel (Millenium Opera) 2 years ago. We actually said we preferred Hotel Muguet because of its location and proximity to Rue Cler. The hotel is located on a quiet street with very little traffic/street noise at night. When we made our reservation via email about a month prior to the trip, we requested a non-smoking room with 2 twin beds and asked about a room with a view of the Eiffel tower. We were guranteed a non-smoking room with 2 twin beds but no view... So imagine my delight when I saw the Eiffel tower from our room window upon our arrival! I loved seeing the tower twinkle at night from our window. We had room 51 (5th fl) which we were very happy with. The room was acutally a triple with the third twin bed in a separate sitting room-like space. Without that space, the room would have been cramped with our luggage, so we were grateful for the extra space. The best part of the room was the bathroom. It was spacious and immaculate with a nice bathtub. I enjoyed long baths to relax my tired muscles after walking around all day. The towels were big and soft and changed daily. The only caution is the European style hairdryer which looks like a box on the wall with a tube. It's fine for simply drying your hair but not good if you have to blowdry to style your hair. The tube is not long or flexible enough to direct the hot air where you need it. We did not have breakfast at the hotel because there were so many other choices. We stopped at the boulangerie on Ave. de la Motte-Picquet on our way to metro Ecole Millitaire several times and also went to a crepe stand on Rue Cler for delicious and big savory crepes. Overall, the hotel is very clean and professionally run, and its location is ideal. It's a great bargain for what you get. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Full of Charm!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Muguet over the holidays and we thought it was just wonderful! The hotel was quaint and charming and in a very safe and nice neighborhood. Close to a metro stop and to Rue Cler, a local street market where we had breakfast each morning. The rooms and hotel were IMMACULATELY clean. The bathrooms were larger than most in Europe and the towels (changed daily) were larger than I expected. There was even a European hairdryer in the bathroom. I couldn't have been more pleased and thought that it was a great value! Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay at the Muguet again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 12 days in France, 4 of which were spent in Paris at Hotel Muguet. Catherine, the owner, and her staff could not have been more pleasant. The lobby and room were exceptionally clean and comfortable. The bedroom windows on the fourth floor were very sound proof, and the location is very quiet. There were occassional loud trucks or scooters going by, but never very late at night. The location is fantastic - across the street from Rue Cler with tons of shops, and we could see the tip top of the Eiffel Tower from our room. The bathroom was especially clean, with great towels. The shower is small, so be prepared. The staff was helpful with directions and subway instructions, and there is internet access available for 2 euro per hour. Note that there is a trick to turning on the TV - you have to hit channel up, not the power button, to get it to go on. Sheets and blankets and pillows were all very comfortable, and the dimly lit hallways have lights that automatically turn on when you enter the hall. If I ever get back to Paris, I'd definitely stay here again with hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cnote1500
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels, for the money, that I have stayed in. The location was fantastic with wonderful cafes around every corner. Yet it was very quiet due to its residential street placement. The rooms are very taseful, and the bathrooms are fantastic...I would compare them to W hotel bathrooms. Wonderful towels, very clean, great showers. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel, finding better bargins away from there, but i'm sure it's convenient. We found out, as we were leaving, that they have coffee available all day along with ice and a soda machine. Satillite television in the room with CNN and BBC World News, along with Spanish, Italian, German and French channels. I can't think of a better place for the money in Paris, or a better area for that matter. It's within walking distance to almost everywhere, but very close to the Eiffle Tower and Invalides.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Muguet”
Reviews.Author: Fonie
Reviews.Content: The Muguet is a wonderful place - good location; nice rooms; excellent bathrooms; and two small dogs who live in the lobby during the day, making those of us homesick for our dogs feel a lot more at home. (The dogs could use a bath, however!) The only thing I didn't like at the Muguet (and I've stayed there 3 times) is the breakfast. But, its location places it near many nice patisseries, so who cares? Breakfast is not included in the price, so just skip it, and go on to someplace with better croissants. The neighborhood is not especially tourist-y, so you can feel more like an inhabitant of the city, and less like an ugly tourist.

Reviews.Title: “"Retrospect" hits the mark”
Reviews.Author: genouille
Reviews.Content: Everything "Retrospect" says reflects my experiences nearly exactly; the times in Paris, the hotels visited, etc. and my delight with the physical facilities of the Muguet and the neighborhood. Catherine is indeed business-like but she is more than that. She controls, she disapproves, she is distant, and her smile has no warmth. She encourages her staff to be likewise. I am not known for being overly sensitive, but I felt that I intruded when I took a few--and only a few--seconds to tell her my wife and I liked the accomodations. Maybe we hit her on a bad day 4 days in a row. For me, the owner and staff are the hotel just as a good chef and maitre d'hotel are the soul of a good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “In retrospect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris three times over the course of the last four years and we have stayed at two three star properties and Hotel Muguet. The stays at three stars were before and after Muguet. The first was in the 6th and the last was in the 17th. The hotel in the 6th was much higher priced than Muguet and the one in the 17th was less. Of the three, the one I would return to is the Muguet. In spite of what you read here about small rooms, if you have stayed at other properties in Paris, you will know that these rooms are average to large vs. most others of the same or even higher rating. Take your travel alarm and your hair dryer w/voltage converter and you will be set. As far as channel choices or the size of the TV, if I can find out what the weather is going to be like, that's all I need to know when I am in Paris. The front desk is helpful but business-like, not much for pleasantries, but if you do your homework about French social interaction, this is not unusual. Catherine has made a business out of appealing to business and tourist clients alike and she knows that she is providing a good value, the trade off is a no-nonsense, firm handling of guests. If she is fully booked, she will not be able to get you into your room early and you shouldn't expect it unless you have paid for the prior night. Location, location, location. Two metro stops within easy walking distance providing access to different routes and quick connections to anywhere in the city. Rue Cler is a stone's throw from the hotel for many choices of food either in the form of on site dining or for in room or outdoor picnics. With some rooms affording views of the Tour Effiel and others providing views of Invalides, only those seeking four star quality at a two-three star price will be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Muguet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the last week of November after going through a lot of advices from fellow travellers. And we were not disappointed. The location was near the Metro stations, near a market and the Eiffel Tower is just a short-distance walk away. The staff who greeted us speaks good English and was friendly. Our room was pretty but small (we were already expecting this, so it was not really disappointing) and it has the cleanest toilet I've ever been in in all my travels worldwide. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet was great!”
Reviews.Author: amybear
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Muguet during the last week in November. I chose it mainly because of the glowing reviews here at Tripadvisor...and I was not dissapointed. It is a lovely, quaint hotel with very clean & nicely furnished rooms, I was given a warm reception by the front desk (of course It helps if you show the respect of speaking in French...no matter how bad your French may be) They even loaned me a corkscrew to open a bottle of wine I had bought.. The breakfast was standard fare...croissant, coffee, yogurt, boiled eggs.. But I found it very convenient to eat breakfast at the hotel in the morning as the area is a bit expensive..and you'd probably be charged more money for the same choice of food. I adored Paris (it was my first trip) I will say, that the next time I return to Paris I would probably choose to stay in the Marais district... Simply because it was closer to alot of the attractions (and shopping!) But for good value, clean & safe neighborhood in the 7th Arondissement...I doubt you could do better than the Hotel Muguet. Thank you for a great & memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raph92
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in early November. Lovely hotel with an excellent staff. 24hr desk, lift (a bit small) and excellent facilities. Never had breakfast there, but there are great patisseries all around to choose from. Would definitely stay here again. Excellent little grocery store right around the corner for fruit and drinks. Close to the metro stop which is key! Walking distance to Eiffel Tower. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving 2004”
Reviews.Author: Marymillicent
Reviews.Content: After researching hotels for months we finally decided on the Muguet from reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. We reserved 5 rooms on line well in advance and confirmed several days before departure. When we arrived everything was ready except one of the 3 person rooms was not vacated when we got there, but it all worked out okay. This is a very clean hotel with a breakfast area and small elevator. We found the staff very friendly and the location in the Rue Cler district is excellent - very safe. Our 3 person room (135 euros/night) had a shower and tub. My favorite thing was the huge towels and wash rags sewed into mits. Our room had a radiator type heater in the bedroom and another in the bath. They were fully adjustable and we we used the bathroom radiator to warm our towels :-) A short walk took us past the teller machine and post office to Rue Cler for any type of food market one could think of. It was a marvelous trip and the Hotel Muguet (moo-gay) was a big part of it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Muget as a result of positive comments made here on tripadvisor. We were not dissapointed! The hotel is fairly modern, very clean and close (about 200m) to la tour maubourg metro stop. We had a great room from which we could see the tour eiffel!! We also found the staff very helpful although, we spoke to them in the very little french we knew, which probably helped our case! We would definately recommend this hotel to others, especially at this low price!

Reviews.Title: “Up to my Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from Paris, our first trip together, on October 27th. We had reservations at the Muguet since Spring, and had been really looking forward to it. Our room was on the first floor, overlooking the breakfast room. It was not much of a view, but then again, we weren't in Paris to sit looking out of the bedroom window! The only inconvienience was the apartment opposite us which directly faced our window, so we had to close the curtains for a little privacy! The air conditioning was off (or didn't work? i didn't really ask) which was a bit annoying. We went to Paris prepared for the miserable weather we had been having in Ireland, but instead got 4 beautiful days of sunshine. (Hats and scarves out the window!) We had to leave the window open a lot of the time, which was kind of annoying because the weather gave rise to mosquitoes-BIG mosquitoes! My fiance is allergic to bites and stings so the A/C thing was kind of bad. Apart from that, our stay was wonderful. The bed was comfortable, if a little too soft, and the room was always spotless. I had no such problem as the couple who could not check in. We arrived at 12.00 and we were able to check in no problem. The staff were lovely, and very friendly if you approach them with a little French. Although i did notice that they were sort of indifferent to people who just went straight up and started speaking english. Thae breakfast, which we only partook of on the morning we left (we slept in too late most mornings, and they only serve breakfast til 10.30.) was very good value. Overall, we had a marvellous stay, and the only bad thing about it is how many people are finding out about this wonderful little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Tour Eiffel neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: migolfergirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took our mother (75) to Europe in early October, 2004, and decided to start our trip in Paris. We booked a triple room at Hotel Muguet. The Muguet is an efficiently run, spotless and well-kept small hotel. Our triple room was very spacious, and the beds were comfy (once you removed the plastic matress cover....). The rooms were nicely appointed (not luxurious, but very, very nice) and there was PLENTY of room for 3 large suitcases and 3 women's paraphernelia. (I did check out several other double rooms, and found that they were much smaller than our triple. Cozy, but not too small.) The bathroom was very modern, done in white tile, and had a spectacular bath/shower combo. We decided to stay in the Eiffel Tower area for the quiet neighborhood and proximity to great restaurants. We visited Rue Cler (a <5 minute walk--2 1/2 blocks away) every morning in lieu of the hotel breakfast. Rue Cler is a great little marketplace located in a 2 block area with an array of cafes, patisseries and a phenomenal crepe restaurant in the middle block (it is actually a Greek restaurant, "Ulysses", run by a really neat family--father, mother who mans the crepe maker in front of the restaurant and 2 sons who speak perfect English and are friendly and VERY helpful. This place is legendary....people RAVE about the crepes, and they are fabulous!! I got her to sneak some tomatoes in with eggs and cheese. WHAT A TREAT!!!). There are a number of great little restaurants in the area....one of our faves was L'Auberge du Champ de Mars on rue de l'Exposition just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower. The couple that own the restaurant--Madeleine & Michel--are enchanting and the food is tremendous! (We had a late dinner there one night, and I took off without my big, digital camera. I realized my loss the next morning, and asked the lady at the front desk to call L'Auberge for me. Madeleine answered and said they had found it and I could come claim it any time. They were so nice...big hugs and well wishes from both of them. GREAT people, and talented restauranteurs.) There are 2 metro stops JUST around the corner from the Muguet which provide easy access to virtually every corner of Paris. I had read the reviews about the unfriendly ladies at the front desk, and was prepared for the worst. What we found was that if you attempt to communicate, even with just a little fledgling French, they are extremely helpful. Just don't try to pet the little poodle that accompanies one of them...I just about got my hand snapped off! The lady that owns Muguet, Catherine, is fastidious. One morning I found her wiping down the legs of every chair in the breakfast room. She runs a very tight ship, and insists that every inch of the hotel is SPOTLESS. And it is! I met a man who had triend to book into Muguet, but the hotel was full. He said he travels to Paris regularly, and always tries to stay at Hotel Muguet. He also said that it is the #1 rated hotel on the AOL travel site. I would definitely come back to Hotel Muguet. It combines location and comfort with good value.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reviews here are indeed accurate. My husband and I just returned from a week's stay and enjoyed the location and exceptional value. You get a 3-star hotel at a 1-star price.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that you will absolutely love! The location is incredible- we couldn't have asked for a better location. Prehaps the greatest thing about this hotel is that it is in a residential neighborhood, so you really get the feel of Parisian life-style. You can walk a block away and buy a fresh baguette in the morning and mingle with the locals. The hotel is comfortable. It's a little small, but it's still great. The staff is wonderful and totally french. You feel french when you stay in Hotel Muguet

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Muguet is AOK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Muguet is what I would call a "little wonder hotel". It's located on a quiet street in a very busy city and is beautifully run. My husband has arthritis and doesn't sleep well so we asked for twin beds. We were given a lovely twin room on the 5th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. We had front row seats for the light show on the tower every night and it was spectacular. Breakfast costs extra, but is better value than what is offered at the restaurants in the area. It is served every morning in a room that overlooks a garden and was a terrific start to the day. Our room was kept spotlessly clean and the women that work the front desk (I was told that one was the owner) were helpful. If you want to stay in the 7th arrondissement, then you should consider Hotel Muguet.

Reviews.Title: “Was okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed 2 nights at this hotel. It was on a side street and very quiet. The room we had was quiet small as we had 2 big suitcases and a couple of overnight bags. The room was clean and the staff was fine. Not over friendly but answered our questions. The hotel is located near the Eiffel Tower which was nice. You could walk to Napoleans Tomb as well as the Louvre even though it was farther then we thought. I would pass up the breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast was okay, but I am sure a nice cafe would have been better. I would stay here again if we could get a larger room with a bigger bed (they do have them there but they were booked already).

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from France and a stay at our favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: jean4096
Reviews.Content: We returned to Hotel Muguet for our 3rd stay in 4 years. We love the location of this boutique hotel and also the homey feeling. Other features we enjoy: cleanliness, extra large towels and bath mitts and comfortable beds. The breakfast room had been redone since our visit in 2002. We dined in the garden room each morning. For 8 Euro we had our choice: boiled eggs, sliced ham, cheeses, yogurt, cold cereal, fresh squeezed orange juice, croissants, baguettes, butter and assorted jams, oranges, apples, pastry, and of course all the coffee we wanted, hot tea, milk and hot chocolate. If you've eaten out in Paris, you'll spend about 4 euro for a grand cafe' with creme. We ate a good breakfast everyday, as we walked several miles a day, enjoying the gardens of Paris. We also enjoy the neighborhood and especially the nice walk to the Eiffel Tower (at least once a day) You can't get too many pictures of the Eiffel Tower, especially when the lights twinkle on the hour for 10 minutes. This year we choose a room by the garden and enjoyed the ground floor location just off the breakfast room. We would not choose those rooms again, as they are the smallest. However the closet was large and we had just enough room. I liked the previous rooms we've had, as there were drawers available. We managed even with our 4 pieces of luggage. The bathrooms are all white and blue tile and offer plenty of space. Our room had a tub/shower combination and each room has a hair dryer. The hair dryer is the type where you must keep a grip on the handle to make they dryer run. We had just come from Austria where they had the same type. It was a new concept to me, but it worked well. Many people may prefer a larger hotel, with bigger TV and larger rooms, which is understandable. We found Madame Catherine and her Mother very pleasant and helpful, even though we arrived a day earlier than our reservation said. She was "Glad to Recieve us" was her comment. It was my error and yet she was gracious to get us situated in our room. Jacqueline has been there over 4 years and always so helpful. We found all the staff very nice. We do not speak French but always greeted the staff upon coming and going in French... just a simple Bonjour Madame, or Bonsoir, or Bonne Nuit depending on the time of day. We also enjoyed visits with other guests in the breakfast room each morning. Met a nice couple (Dan & Bonnie) from Paris, Canada and another lovely couple from Michigan. Meeting people and sharing travel tips is part of the fun for us. For the price of 87 Euro for 2 people, including tax, we found this to be a bargain. I'm kinda wishing we'd kept it a secret. It is getting harder to get a reservation when we need one. Everyone should stay where they can afford and receive the amenities offered. We do.

Reviews.Title: “The Parisian hotel of my dreams!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve just returned from a spectacular two-week holiday in France, the first week of which was spent in Paris at the Hotel Muguet. I did months of research before choosing this hotel and my decision was based largely on the reviews posted on this site. Since Iâ€™ve benefitted from this service, I feel itâ€™s now my responsibility to post a glowing review of my own. My expectations were high, and Iâ€™m pleased to report that they were surpassed by this charming hotel. The Hotel Muguet is located in the 7th arrondissement, a beautiful, elegant neighbourhood in Paris. Itâ€™s owned by Madame Catherine Pelltier, and before her, I believe it was run by her mother. Every e-mail question that I sent to Madame Pelltier was answered practically within the hour. The airport shuttle driver dropped us at the hotel at 7am and the front desk staff were very courteous, allowing us to lock our bags in a storage room until check-in time at 2pm. We freshened up in the hotelâ€™s public toilette, then started our day of sightseeing with a stroll around our neighbourhood. The 7th arrondissement is a safe, elegant and convenient neighbourhood, full of cafÃ©s, brasseries and shops to explore. Rue Cler, a fresh food market street, is just a five-minute stroll from the hotel. My husband and I went there daily for fresh fruit, sandwiches, or some roast chicken and a bottle of wine to take back to the hotel. For a thoroughly mouth-watering description of the treats that Rue Cler has to offer, as well as a handy map of the shops that line the street, visit ---------. There are two Metro stops very close to the Muguet, Ecole Militare and La Tour Maubourg, so in no time, you can be sightseeing halfway across the city! I loved the Metro â€“ it was fast, cheap and convenient. If youâ€™re staying in Paris for a week or more, get a metro map and a carte orange pass instead of tickets. The Hotel Muguet is a beautiful six-story building in the typical architectural style that most of us associate with Paris: a Mansaart roof, wrought-iron balconies and floor to ceiling windows. While the building may be old, on the inside, the hotel is thoroughly modern. Iâ€™ll begin by mentioning that itâ€™s air-conditioned, a rare find in a two-star hotel. We appreciated this feature on a few very warm days during our stay. We paid $105 Euros per night for our room, #53, which had a King-sized bed and a spectacular view of la Tour Eiffel. Every night, I could see it sparkling madly in the distance, a sight Iâ€™ll never forget. On my first morning in Paris, I jumped out of bed at 6:30 am, threw open the heavy curtains at our window, stepped onto our little balcony and marveled at the sight of the Tower in the distance, bathed in early morning sun light. With Paris waking up in the streets below me, what could be more magical? Our room was small, but not inconveniently so. The bathroom had a shower, but no bathtub. My husband, a broad man, found the shower stall a bit narrow but I had no problem with it. The bed was quite comfortable and we slept solidly every night, exhausted from sightseeing. The hotel offers a light breakfast in their 1st floor garden room and I believe that you can get cafÃ© at any time, but there is no other food service once breakfast is finished. If you enjoy room service, you'll want to stay somewhere else. We found there were so many wonderful, inexpensive places to eat just steps from the hotel, the lack of room service was never a problem. I can also report that there are a couple of small grocery stores in the neighbourhood where you can buy a fantastic selection of beer and wine, as well as snacks and any grooming products you might need. My French is quite limited, but I enjoyed practicing with the front desk staff, who were quite patient. Most of the other guests seemed to be Anglophones and I heard them speaking easily with the hotel staff. Even if you have no knowledge of French, you wonâ€™t have any problems at this hotel. As in most hotels in France, you leave your room key at the front desk when you go out for the day. This may seem odd to some people, but I really liked the system because it kept us from losing our key. The hotel closes its doors at midnight, but if you return after that, you just ring the doorbell and the night porter will let you in. Every day when we returned to our room, we found it thoroughly cleaned and tidied and smelling faintly of grapefruit â€“ very refreshing. The thick, fluffy towels were restocked daily. My husband had only one small complaint: the hotel has just one tiny, traditional elevator. When we checked in and out, we had to ride separately since two people and all of their luggage wonâ€™t fit. I thought the old elevator was charming. A large modern elevator, while convenient, would be inappropriate in this hotel. Most days, I preferred taking the elegant staircase to and from our fifth-floor room. When youâ€™re eating as many delicious omelettes as I was, a little extra exercise is welcome. Iâ€™m more than a little melancholy now that my holiday is over. Paris is the most spectacular city I've ever visited and staying at the Muguet not only put us in the heart of the Parisian neighbourhood of my dreams, it also put us in touch with the cityâ€™s charming daily rituals. When we go back, we will definitely be staying at the Muguet!

Reviews.Title: “A question of balance”
Reviews.Author: richandelsa
Reviews.Content: If you read all postings carefully you'll get a pretty good idea of what is offered here. For the Muguet: it's very close to 2 metro stations, both on the same line; to a variety of neighborhood shopping and restaurants (try le Bistrot du 7e) walking distance to the Invalides, Eiffel Tower, Musee d"Orsay, and more; clean as a whistle; the shower has an open feel even though quite small; the towels are good, the bed firm; the A/C works fine; the recommended airport connection, Golden Air, is reliable, fairly priced, and has nicer vehicles than you're likely to see in the US; the blackout curtains work if you need them; the continental breakfast is a good value; and the price for the room cannot be beat. Against it: the bed is low, with a waterpoof sheet under the fitted sheet, and 2 twins are pushed together to make a queen; the walls and doors are thin, so while street noise is no issue, hallway noise can be if you retire early; the furniture has no drawers; they turned off the A/C while we were there because it turned cool outside, even though the sun heated our room (but turned it back on after we requested it); little English is spoken but the folks who do are quite helpful if you do a little French; the rooms are tiny, as is the TV, and the only English language channels are news all the time; you'll want your own soap and shampoo (and hair dryer); there is no window cover to darken the bathroom window if you so desire; and no pants hangers. If you want luxury, or even Very nice, this isn't it. If you want very clean, convenient, and serviceable, at a price that makes it a killer value, you've found it. They've picked their marketing niche and hit a bulls-eye.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveller
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not expecting the Ritz and did not get it, but for the price and the location it was excellent. Service at the front desk was much better than we expected (from the other reviews) and I also feel that if you make some effort with the language it does help. We did not eat breakfast there, preferring to go out. There are some good cafes nearby in the Rue Cler which we patronised for breakfast and dinner. The hotel is near the metro and the Eiffel Tower and is certainly much better than the hotels we have stayed in over three previous visits to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy It for What It Is”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not a Paris veteran, but I took a room at the Hotel Muguet off what I read at Trip Advisor. I was very pleased, but I could see why someone might be disappointed. The Muguet is not the "11th best" hotel in Paris. It's a reasonably priced small hotel with many good points. The De La Motte Picquet neighborhood is busy and residential but an asset. Inside a three-block radius of the Muguet, you'll probably find 10 or 12 places where you'd want to eat. If you want more night life, excitement and a higher count of tourists or young people, the Metro's just around the corner. The rooms are small and the furnishings are old. If you want a big, modern room and a wide-screen TV, reserve at the Marriott. The hotel breakfast is adequate but optional. You'll do just as well or better elsewhere. I thought the women at the front desk who apparently run the place, Catherine and Jacqueline, were wonderful. Just like everyone else in Paris, they appreciate even amateurish attempts to communicate in French. For 86 Euros, you're not going to "steal" a luxury suite on one of the Grand Boulevards. You're probably not going to do better than the Muguet, either.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Muguet
HotelInfo.Address: 11 rue Chevert | 7th Arr., 75007 Paris, France
